Title: data centre operator - entry level
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
this position is the perfect opportunity for you to learn, grow, and develop new skills within the data centre space. our data centre teams in nsw and vic are well established, growing and we’re looking for reliable, hardworking people with a hunger to learn to join our data centre facilities team.\xa0

the role\xa0
you’ll work in one of our data centres on a roster - 24/7 rotating shift (12hr day shift/night shift) - providing proactive and reactive support across all facets of our day to day data centre operations. our data centres are a first point of contact for many of our customers meaning you will perform a variety of remote and first level support tasks. we host small to medium size companies who are in cloud services, webhosting and other sectors. our facilities are long-standing, reliable and trusted.\xa0

key responsibilities:
  • respond to inbound customer queries and recommend corrective action where appropriate in a professional and timely manner.
  • ensure adherence to datacom\'s and customers\' change management policies and procedures for all technical changes.
  • escalate issues to operations manager and/or facilities manager when necessary.
  • ensure all data is logged in a timely manner at all levels and remain accountable for personal performance.
  • racking and patching of servers and network devices.
  • escorting visitors / customers into the data centre.
  • customer tape management.
  • level1 troubleshooting of datacentre air cons, generator, ups system, network devices and servers.
  • project works that will involve moving customer’s devices to the new facility.
\xa0
essential skills:
  • strong customer service focus with the ability to empathise as well as prioritise customers\' needs.
  • love being hands on and take pride in your work.
  • communicate clearly verbally and in writing, information of both a technical and non-technical nature and pride yourself on being excellent at troubleshooting technical issues.
  • experience in customer telephone support or help desk support is a bonus.
  • good conflict resolutions skills and great ability to work well in a team.
  • must have ability to install and neatly manage copper, fiber and other network cable/connector types.
  • a proficient knowledge of it systems and hardware.
\xa0
at datacom we value people with strong work ethic, integrity and the initiative to always be looking for better ways to do things. you don’t need a degree and there will be formal learning opportunities for the right people.
\xa0
you must have the\xa0right to live and work\xa0in australia\xa0to be applicable for this job. all applications will be handled in strictest confidence, if this sounds like you please\xa0apply\xa0now. please note we will be in touch should you be shortlisted for interview.

Title: data entry & customer service representative
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

our client is a prominent pharmaceutical company and supplier of laboratory supplies in melbourne’s inner-east. our client is seeking a detail-oriented data entry clerk with strong customer service experience.

  • parkville location
  • part time monday to friday from 10am to 3pm – not negotiable
  • contract 3 to 4 months with a possibility of an extension to the contract or permanency
  • the successful applicant must commit to the length of the contract.

you should be friendly and have a soft-touch with customers, with the ability to problem solve on the fly.

this is a part time on-going contract. for the right person, there could be a possibility of the position becoming permanent.

this role will involve:

  • a high volume of data entry
  • processing customer orders that come in by email
  • entering job orders, customers’ details, product code, batch number, quantity and delivery details
  • checking stock availability and product expiry date
  • raising back orders, invoices and credit notes
  • advising the production team about stock levels
  • tracking of orders
  • keeping records and completing sales reports
  • confirming orders with customers
  • answering phones and replying to emails promptly

what you’ll need to succeed:

  • attention to detail
  • impeccable accuracy
  • ability to quickly and accurately enter data
  • strong customer service skills
  • exceptional communication and organisational skills

flybuys aims to be australia’s largest and most valued loyalty program with the most active members. we aim to work with the best brands in australia to ensure we are offering the most rewarding experiences to our members.

Title: analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

company:

mercer

description:

analyst

melbourne location

an excellent opportunity has arisen to join a busy, motivated team of analysts as well as work on mercer’s award-winning insights and analytics platform – mercer edge. this crucial role will help drive data-driven decision-making throughout the business through the delivery of insights, analytics, and reporting to mercer and its superannuation clients.

about the role

  • the purpose of this role is to provide analytics, reporting and insights to inform decision-making in key customer-facing areas of the business. the analytics, reporting and insights generated will be used to inform business decision-making – particularly around marketing, digital, customer experience, and service delivery.

this role will cover a broad scope of work including:

  • provide insights to leadership team and key stakeholders to inform business decision-making
  • provide recommendations on both campaigns and targeting based on analysis undertaken
  • provide leads/lists for outbound campaigns
  • provide recommendations on potential improvement areas
  • build, maintain and deliver dashboards for ongoing monitoring of organisational performance across key metrics – providing ability to drill-down to identify both strengths and problem pockets/opportunities for improvement
  • identify opportunities for improvement in existing reporting (including approach, visuals, methodological efficiencies, etc.) and implement solutions to address those opportunities
  • automate reporting (where possible and/or to the extent possible) and leverage available tools (e.g., tableau, ms excel and ms access) to maximise efficiencies
  • support the analytics lead in undertaking various other data analytics projects for use internally, for clients and for delivery in our proprietary analytics platform mercer edge

about you

to be a positive force in this role you will have the ability to communicate at all levels and help to deliver quality outcomes for clients.

  • experience in data analytics
  • degree qualification in business/marketing/science would be highly regarded
  • advanced knowledge of sql, excel, tableau and access is essential
  • experience in digital analytics using adobe analytics and google analytics would be highly regarded
  • crm systems and marketing automation platforms experience is advantageous
  • ability to derive insights based on data and translate those insights into recommendations
  • excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate and manage expectations of key stakeholders at all levels within the organisation
  • ability to work autonomously and within a team environment to achieve results
  • ability to manage multiple deliverables simultaneously

about us

at mercer, we make a difference in the lives of more than 110 million people every day by advancing their health, wealth, and careers. we’re in the business of creating more secure and rewarding futures for our clients and their employees — whether we’re designing affordable health plans, assuring income for retirement or aligning workers with workforce needs. using analysis and insights as catalysts for change, we anticipate and understand the individual impact of business decisions, now and in the future. we see people’s current and future needs through a lens of innovation, and our holistic view, specialized expertise, and deep analytical rigor underpin each and every idea and solution we offer. for more than 70 years, we’ve turned our insights into actions, enabling people around the globe to live, work, and retire well. at mercer, we say we make tomorrow, today.

mercer is an equal opportunity employer committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. we aim to attract and retain the best people regardless of their sex (including intersex), marital/parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, age, background, disability, sexual orientation and gender identity.

Title: data scientist
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

we are looking for a data scientist for one of our aviation clients based in melbourne.

the hiring manager wants a data scientist with academic and commercial experience that can communicate with the business as well as being technically strong.

coming into this environment, you will need to learn the business\' new operating model and work as part of the organisation\'s new data centre of excellence. the enterprise data platform has been built in azure and ms tools are used also. in addition, r is used for data studio and machine learning and sql is used for legacy cubes and the data warehouse. a background in bi / dw is not necessary for this role and it is more important to be a thought leader, disruptor and think differently in your approach to data.

you will be working alongside the business and a key vendor, as well as data stewards and business owners. success in this role would be to bring data science into the business as part of a technology function that can help the business understand what they can do with the data they have and how it can benefit the organisation and its customers.

in this role, you will form relationships with business leaders to help them create use cases for the new enterprise data platform and look into how data should be analysed and presented. you should be a proactive advisor in helping with proof of concepts and understanding the value of data.

you will need to be able to work independently and have a statistics, programming and data science background. a commercial, technical or operational background will be helpful.

the ideal candidate will be passionate about analytics and data science. this can be a fast paced and dynamic working environment. you will need to lead, prioritise tasks and work as part of a team.

junior, intermediate and senior data scientists are encouraged to apply.

skills & experience

  • data science, programming and statistics background
  • data modelling skills
  • data query skills
  • able to visualise data and present
  • desirable to have skills in machine learning and / or artificial intelligence
  • worked with r and sql or other similar tools
  • desirable to have worked on an azure platform
  • strong written and verbal communication skills
  • strong stakeholder management skills
  • passionate about data science

if the above sounds like you, please get in touch. we can wait for a notice period to be served and we are interviewing immediately.

for further information on this role or to confidentially apply, please contact rik english on 02 8227 9200 or apply directly via the apply for this job button. only word format resumes will be accepted.

Title: data specialist
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about xero

at xero, we’re here to make running a business beautiful. by making small business more efficient every day, connecting them with big business technology and empowering a community behind them, their potential is limitless. when that happens, we’re not only helping small business, we’ll be building a stronger economy that can change the world.

a global saas (software as a service) company we have a team of almost 2,000 xeros doing beautiful work across our 17 offices across the globe. we’re ranked no.1 by forbes as the world\'s most innovative growth company two years running, glassdoor named us one of the top 15 best saas companies in the world, and canstar blue has ranked us australia’s best accounting software company for four consecutive years (2015-2018).

about the role

as part of our practice & compliance platform operations team, you will work closely with the product development, architecture and release teams to assist with database development and administration to improve the performance, scalability and resilience of products in the xero application stack and our platform.

as data specialist you will produce robust database solutions. you will execute performance enhancements improving performance and scalability in the production environment as well as providing the development team with tools and appropriate training to test data components. you will share on-call responsibilities with the rest of your team.

you will be responsible for:

  • work alongside our other data specialists to ensure that new and existing database features are aligned to other products, support service-oriented design and support future platform requirements
  • assist with scheduled releases and hotfixes, and develop tooling to support automation of repeated tasks
  • enhance the use of data technologies and apply xero’s sql development standards
  • help grow and promote patterns, practices and standards to improve the non-functional aspects of data components by all xero product teams
  • working in collaboration with the platform as a service team to ensure databases supporting product applications are supported within the development,testing and production environments

about you

you will have a passion for database-driven web applications and experience of working within and across software development teams. alongside this you will also bring to the team:

  • database design and development experience in microsoft sql server
  • experience of data modelling and schema design skills
  • familiarity with alternative relational database platforms
  • comfortable with source control, preferably git
  • exposure to nosql technologies

xero is an equal opportunity employer. we value diversity, foster innovation and reward success.

if you want to come to work with friends every single day and help to make xero even more special, please apply!

Title: senior revenue protection analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about public transport victoria (ptv)

public transport victoria (ptv) is a statutory authority that acts as a system authority for all public transport and an advocate for public transport users. we are a single contact point for customers wanting information on public transport services, fares, tickets and initiatives. ptv aims to improve public transport in victoria by ensuring better coordination between modes, facilitating expansions to the network, auditing public transport assets, promoting public transport as an alternative to the car.

to put this in perspective:

  • we have a hand in over half a billion trips across the public transport network annually
  • we facilitate 1.6 million trips a day
  • we move hundreds of thousands of people around the state daily

your new role

reporting to the manager, revenue protection and authorised officer practice this role manages the deployment of multi-modal authorised officers and supports operational and performance compliance activities related to revenue protection.

your main responsibilities include

  • support the co-ordination of activities related to revenue protection as set out in strategic policy and planning documents such as the network revenue protection plan.
  • manage the deployment of multi-modal authorised officers to maximise their impact on fare compliance, using data analysis and input from multiple sources, including public transport operators, passenger feedback and fare compliance surveys.
  • liaising with operators to ensure revenue protection activities are coordinated across the network.
  • working as part of a project team on revenue protection operations, including authorised officer equipment.
  • actively contributing to policy development in relation to revenue protection and authorised officer practice from a performance and customer-centric perspective.

what you'll need to succeed

  • demonstrated ability to engage and influence external and internal stakeholders to build positive and effective relationships supporting the implementation of policy initiatives.
  • high level problem solving and analytical skills, including the ability to develop a range of solutions to a problem and assess these against objectives.
  • ability to monitor and assess data to identify issues, and use data to support policy development.
  • experience in managing multi-agency requirements in the delivery of policy
  • demonstrated ability to manage multiple competing priorities and produce operational plans under pressure.
  • a relevant tertiary qualification in a related field or equivalent or appropriate work experience

how to apply

please click the ‘apply now' button below.\xa0 your application must include a cover letter and separate resume (ms word compatible).\xa0 for further information about the role, please refer to the attached position description and capability framework documents. if you have any questions specific to the role, please contact kyle millsteed via email kyle.millsteed@ptv.vic.gov.au.

applications close 11:59 p.m. sunday, 12th may, 2019

emailed applications will not be accepted.

unsolicited recruitment agency applications will not be accepted.

public transport victoria is committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive and supports diversity and flexibility. we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Title: senior energy market analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about the role:

our markets insights team plays a pivotal role in providing in-depth analysis and reporting of australia’s energy markets to an array of internal and external stakeholders. as the senior energy market analyst, you will be key in undertaking analysis and delivering such publications as the quarterly energy dynamics report which is seen in the industry as a source of truth on what has happened over the last 3 months in the electricity and gas markets.

as a senior you will have a strong understanding of electricity and gas markets and be comfortable undertaking analysis and producing reports with the focus on providing insights into trends and market outcomes . you will be hands on with sql, sourcing data and be able to see the wood for the trees.

you will bring a data science background and will have opportunity to use an array of tools with a large variety of data.\xa0\xa0 \xa0\xa0

key accountabilities:

  • deliver high quality analysis on current and future issues and trends that may impact aemo’s markets and strategic initiatives.
  • undertake analysis and report outcomes for the quarterly energy dynamics report.
  • support projects by providing data analysis and insights.
  • monitoring participant behaviours and drivers in energy markets operated by aemo.
  • monitoring drivers of energy market outcomes both domestically and in key comparable markets including the uk and us \xa0

\xa0\xa0 required skills and experience:\xa0

  • tertiary qualifications in an analytical discipline such as economics, science, maths, finance or engineering
  • at least 3 years’ experience in the analysis of electricity or gas markets
  • proven experience delivering impactful outcomes from analysis and research\xa0
  • strong presentation and communication skills.
  • hands on approach to data analysis and the ability to extract data from a range of sources via sql and to derive meaning from large data sets using tools such as excel, tableau, r etc.
  • extensive experience and knowledge of the energy industry including aemo’s wholesale and retail energy markets as well as related energy markets including asx futures, lng, green certificates, carbon etc \xa0

about the australian energy market operator (aemo):

aemo delivers secure, reliable energy to millions of australians every day.\xa0 our work touches virtually all aspects of australia’s industrial, business and domestic life.\xa0 we ensure energy produced by electricity generators and gas suppliers reaches consumers nationwide.\xa0

we operate the national electricity grid and manage gas markets in all states except northern territory.\xa0 we also operate victoria’s gas system.\xa0

aemo provides expert guidance to government and the energy sector to inform policy, investment decisions and infrastructure management.\xa0 we play a crucial role in shaping australia’s energy future.\xa0

your career with aemo:

aemo has some of australia’s finest energy sector talent in its midst.\xa0 our work is intellectually challenging, and our people gain enormous satisfaction from solving the complex problems constantly facing them.\xa0

the continuing interplay of shifts in energy generation, reliability, affordability, and a low emissions future will ensure we at aemo continue to be challenged and driven for many years to come.

so, make your next career move one that really matters!\xa0

some of our employment benefits:

here are some of the attractive employment benefits we offer:

  • professional development via projects, assignments, industry networks and job rotation
  • flexible working: work from home, part time and job share
  • discount health insurance, gym membership and other concessions
  • free salary continuance insurance and annual performance bonuses *

* subject to eligibility

apply now to join us and take your place alongside like-minded passionate, driven individuals in the energy sector: one of the world’s most exciting and dynamic industries.

click ‘apply’ to submit your cv and cover letter by close of business wednesday 8th of may 2019.\xa0

no agency applications will be accepted at this time.

Title: communications specialist - defence tactical data networks
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
  • leading defence contractor committed to driving strategic growth
  • fast paced dynamic work environment
  • permanent opportunity located in port melbourne

the communications specialist is responsible for assisting enhanced position location reporting system (eplrs) users with management and maintenance of eplrs networks and supporting sub systems within both a development laboratory and an operational environment. this includes providing timely advice on: development, implementation and adjustment of eplrs deployment and communications plans, integration with 3rd party systems, assisting with day to day operational and administrative tasks, monitor and ensure systems availability and capacity, incident management, problem diagnoses and resolution.

the communications specialist will also be responsible for the effective and efficient management of a communications security (comsec) account. the position will manage all aspects of the account and associated equipment in accordance with the relevant defence regulations to ensure compliance and availability of equipment as required. the communications specialist is a key point of contact for raytheon australia with the commonwealth user community across all rank levels in relation to battlefield tactical data communications and network centric warfare (ncw).

key responsibilities

  • provide the technical design and operations requirements for complex eplrs networks that comply with raytheon and defence technical standards and security policies.
  • provide diagnostics and fault resolution for hardware and common software services for operational systems.
  • participate as a member of the on call team (eplrs help desk) to provide after-hours technical support for eplrs / defence system.
  • may require occasional domestic and/or international travel.
  • ability to work with no or minimal guidance independently for extended periods.

skills, experience and qualifications

  • tertiary qualifications in information technology / telecommunications
  • qualifications in radio systems or equivalent experience
  • 5+ years’ experience within defence or a technical environment
  • experience in a comsec custodian role.
  • proficient in microsoft office

applicants must be able to obtain and maintain a nv1 security clearance with the ability to upgrade to nv2 as required, eligibility criteria can be found at http://www.defence.gov.au/agvsa.

if you are looking for a great new career opportunity, click the "apply" button now or contact us at careers@raytheon.com.au.

Title: data architect
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

data architect

\xa0

this asx listed market leader is currently experiencing significant growth across the australian market. offering a range of sought after products and services, they continue to attract new customers daily. with a focus on data-driven strategy, my client is looking for a data architect to participate in this growth and transformation.

\xa0

this position will play a key role in driving the data architecture and strategy of the business.

\xa0

key skills and experience required include:

• a background in data with experience across architecture, modelling, bi and data warehousing

• ability to create innovative & pragmatic data-driven solutions

• experience working in complex data environments

• background working with key stakeholders in identifying the best practices in data and how to drive transformation and generate results

• background in oracle data warehouse and can also adapt to new technology bi tools and products

• high level of written and verbal communication to c-level executives and business stakeholders

Title: it data scientist
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

our client is looking for data scientists to join their team for a 6-month contract basis.

the successful candidate will require an in-depth understanding of data-science concepts. you will take the lead in solving complex data-science problems and issues, and guide and mentor others.

the role will encompass the following duties;

  • utilise data science techniques and experimental methods independently to develop technological solutions to achieve business outcomes.
  • develop, enhance and maintain a range of mathematical models to monitor demand and analyse behaviour.
  • provide technical knowledge and expertise in reducing vast and disparate data sets into categorised and useful summaries and reports to improve user experiences and support overall business outcomes.
  • manipulate and analyse big data from disparate systems.
  • work with a cross functional team of data scientists, data analysts, report developers and engineers to move proof-of-concept models/products to production for clients.
  • work closely with project managers and technical leads to meet deliverables and assist in data-driven development of products to industry and agency standards.
  • review research and discussion papers to develop skills and to share learnings and information with team.
  • convert stakeholder needs into business requirements and provide analytical solutions to support those needs.
  • manage relationships with stakeholders across a range of complex issues to influence desired outcomes.
  • present data and complex numerical information in a clear and concise manner and clearly communicate statistical concepts to senior and non-technical audiences.
  • encourage the use of new technologies and techniques to solve data problems and publish regular reporting and dashboards based on stakeholder requirements.

skills and experience:

  • strong practical experience across one or more data science areas such as machine learning, natural language processing, graph analytics, behavioural analytics and visualisation.
  • strong data cleaning and analysis skills, and experience in devising testing methods.
  • demonstrated knowledge and experience with a diversity of programming languages such as r (experience in shiny will be a bonus) and python. professional commitment and skills of maintaining code quality.
  • familiar with hadoop, informatica or talend.
  • strong understanding of the software development life cycle (sdlc) processes.

all applicants must hold australian citizenship to be considered for this opportunity.

if you have the experience to be successful and seek your next career position, then please apply now.

Title: data engineer (etl datastage
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">as a data engineer you will be working in a small team of engineers (6-12 people) developing in the traditional data warehouse for the analytics and information management team. you will take directions from the lead delivery engineer within the team to help develop world class engineering practices and solutions. as an engineer, you will leverage your engineering expertise to deliver quality outcomes for your customers.
\xa0\xa0
the ideal person for this role is a fast learner and a confident self-starter; naturally curious and passionate about technology, but with varied interests; and an excellent communicator who yearns to develop the software engineering practice to help out other engineers within the area. in addition, code quality should be in the forefront of everything they do.
\xa0\xa0

in a nutshell we need:
  • someone who can do a bit of everything (if required) - analysis, design, development and testing.
  • strong sql skills - ability to understand varying implemented patterns and complicated logic blocks. and then write queries to enhance/modify or analyse further.
  • someone who is proactive and will challenge/enhance a solution for an epic. and can cut through the noise of the delivery process to understand the expectations the rest of the team will place on them.
  • someone who can explain a problem in a non-technical manner. i.e. they can illustrate a problem to someone else either verbally, or diagrammatically, without fall back to technical/data detail. this ability also translates to detailing in writing.
  • someone who can talk to business users, if required, and understand requirements, play them back and confirm or challenge.
  • someone who can communicate early that they are struggling, need help or are going to miss a deadline for a valid reason. this is a given in the first month.
  • culturally - co-operative, focused who can manage their work load. they have a personality but not one that is distracting.
\xa0\xa0
specific skills:
  • design, develop and document etl processes using ibm datastage over mpp warehouse (e.g. netezza, teradata)
  • design and develop etl using spark will be advantageous, but not mandatory
  • determine feasible options to implement database objects, load processes, business rules and complex transformations.
  • write reusable unit and functional test scripts using sql queries and data dictionary objects
  • experienced in data driven testing (i.e. golden sets) in functional testing
  • contribute to development and testing environment administration and operation
  • active participation to aim development community of practice (cop)
  • an eye for detail, and always look for continuous improvements

Title: data migration specialist
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">if you are an independent worker with the ability to liaise with project business smes, technical teams and vendor(s) to design, build, test and execute data migration etl routines for the transfer of data from legacy applications to a new platform then please read on.\xa0

our client is undertaking a mission critical system replacement of a complex system that covers a very broad and complex operational model. you will engage with a proven vendor and begin to establish the plan to migrate data from an existing platform. the existing platform is utilised by all areas of the business and many of these groups have added extra systems, integrations and functionality which need to be captured and migrated.\xa0\xa0

task to be completed
  • understanding of businesses complex legacy system and work with the vendor to define data mappings to the new system.
  • etl data from the legacy system using existing routines, in-line with published schedule and generate the xmls/schema loads to be loaded in the new system
  • update and re-test etl full-load routines based on the results from data validation
  • review etl delta-load routines, update, test and execute the full/delta loads on monthly bases
  • create the documents for the data load processes and etl technical specifications.
  • work proactively with vendor to schedule activities, review load errors
\xa0you will have experience across the below:

  • experience creating a data migration and cleansing strategy
  • experience engaging the business to explain the benefits of effective migration. cleansing and data quality capturing practices
  • data mapping
  • large data migration project experience (hands on)\xa0
  • strong etl experience in informatica powercenter.
  • sound knowledge and hands on experience on oracle sql.
  • some level of oracle dba experience.
  • performance tuning expertise.
  • prior data migration experience.
  • experience using xml files in informatica.

if the above description sounds like your skills and you are currently on the market then please apply.

Title: data entry administrator

awesome data entry admin needed for this medical organisation in melbourne\'s east

your new company
this successful medical organisation in melbourne’s east are currently in a strong growth period and looking for an awesome administrator to join their busy team. with labs on site and a support team of over 30 staff, they have a relaxed and positive culture that motivates and inspires.


your new role

Title: business reporting analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about us
specsavers is a multi-award-winning optometry, audiology and optical retail business with more than 375 stores across australia and new zealand and an active customer base of more than six million people.\xa0

we are strongly focused on providing the highest level of optometry and dispensing care with a clear mission to transform eye health in australia and new zealand. having now launched specsavers audiology too in australia, we are at the forefront of leading, shaping and defining the future of the optical and audiology professions.

the role
due to growth within the business, we are currently seeking an business reporting analyst to join our thriving finance team in port melbourne. in this role, you’ll play an important part in enhancing the delivery of performance information through the development, production and distribution of standard business reports and analyses. you’ll oversee data quality, integrity and content of underlying reporting databases to ensure future reporting capability continues to remain at a high standard. most significantly, you will partner with the it department to assist the business and your team with the transition to the mapr platform.\xa0

as business reporting analyst, you will also be responsible for the following duties:

  • preparing and distributing standard performance reports and visualisations for specsavers anz operations
  • collaborating with the it department to ensure reporting capability continues to meet business needs through the controlled and planned development of existing and new databases
  • ensuring database content is complete and accurate with processes in place to load missing data and correct any errors
  • continually improving the efficiency of the distribution of performance information to the wider business through the adoption of new technologies and the development of team capability

about you
reporting to the business reporting manager, you will possess the following experience and skills:

  • technical understanding of databases
  • advanced mysql/sql understanding, with exposure to mapr advantageous but not essential
  • exposure to tableau is advantageous but not a necessity\xa0
  • strong written and verbal communication skills, presentation skills and stakeholder management skills
  • a strong team player and leader, with the ability to guide peers and team members

here at specsavers, we support flexible working wherever possible to assist our people in achieving a balance between their work and personal life. we aim to provide flexibility in where, how and when we work.

we are well-known for valuing our people and not only offer competitive reward and benefits but also ongoing development and training. we support creative minds and recognise hard work. if this sounds like you, why wait? submit your application today!

\xa0

\n\n

Title: head of research analytics
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

lonsec research is looking for our new head of research analytics. this pivotal role is based in our melbourne office and available for immediate start.

we are a leading financial services group with offices in sydney and melbourne. we specialise in research and ratings for super funds and managed funds.\xa0 with around 120 staff, we enjoy a relaxed yet professional corporate culture that promotes the individual strengths of our team members. this is an exciting time for our energetic and entrepreneurial company where ideas are brought to life and initiatives are nurtured to fulfil a niche in the financial services industry.

this role represents an exciting career opportunity for an experienced and passionate data analytics specialist who is ready to manage a team of motivated and intelligent people. the head of research analytics will be a commercially astute and technical team leader who will be responsible for the research analytics used across lonsec research\'s product suite.

the team undertakes research and development of new analytics, maintains current analytics, and manages the provision and quality of data used in the production of research material.\xa0 the role also supports the delivery of new products and services to market.

in addition, the head of research analytics will constantly be identifying opportunities to challenge and enhance the research process through a mindset of continuous improvement.

key tasks of the role include:

  • direct and oversee the research analytics used in the production and delivery of lonsec research\'s product suite.
  • research and develop new research analytics to support the production of quality research, new products and services to market.
  • manage the provision and maintenance of product, benchmark and financial market data
  • ensure the efficient dissemination of quality data and access to analytics to all stakeholders
  • review data providers, process and analytics periodically to ensure best practice standards and high quality are maintained
  • engage with stakeholders across the business to determine requirements for data and analytics
  • work with other stakeholders across the lonsec group to improve the consistency of data and leverage group resources, where appropriate, to drive efficiencies in the collection and analysis of data
  • ensure projects are managed according to schedule and that any resourcing or productivity issues are dealt with proactively so as not compromise deadlines.

\xa0the ideal candidate will have:

  • significant previous experience working with an asset consultant, research house or fund manager, with an emphasis on fund manager research and an understanding of how to tailor investment solutions to meet specific client needs
  • a desire and ambition to build on research experience and focus on management and commercial outcomes\xa0
  • proven track record of successfully delivering change management initiatives and process improvements
  • proven track record in team management
  • ability to work as part of a close-knit team, as well as autonomously, whilst taking responsibility for meeting personal and team objectives
  • excellent verbal and written communication skills which can be competently applied across all levels
  • strong interpersonal and negotiation skills
  • research skills - a strong ability to synthesise and distil financial information down to key concepts.\xa0 excellent attention to detail is essential
  • quantitative research skills - manipulate and analyse data, strong excel skills
  • well developed organisational and time management skills - meet deadlines, coordinate and manage various tasks at a time (and reprioritise as new tasks come to hand)
  • strong and demonstrable technical skills and understanding of investment markets and major asset classes within the funds management industry.

\xa0essential qualifications include:

\xa0an undergraduate degree in a business or mathematical based discipline (science or engineering)\xa0e.g. bcomm, bbus, ba, bec, bsc, bapsci, plus one of the following:\xa0

  • honours year
  • certified investment management analyst (cima)
  • cfa level 1
  • post graduate diploma in finance / management / commerce / financial planning
  • master of business administration / economics / commerce / applied finance
maintain minimum compliance requirements. (i.e. as prescribed by asic regulatory guide rg146) and to continue further education and professional development.

our high calibre and valued staff have access to a range of great benefits including an excellent employee discount program with over 350 participating retailers, additional leave days, multiple training opportunities, coaching and mentoring from industry leading senior staff, free breakfast every day, friday staff drinks, excellent social functions and more!

if this role sounds like the next step in your career journey apply today.

please ensure you answer the screening questions so that your application can be considered.

Title: billing analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

decipha is a key business within australia post that provides information management services for government, enterprise, public, private and not-for-profit customers.\xa0 using market-leading tools, decipha provides business process management services to its customers, with a specific focus on digitisation, image & data capture and storage, and online form creation & management.

\xa0

our operations team, based in abbotsford, has an exciting and challenging fixed term contract, full time opportunity (with potential to become permanent) for a passionate and driven billing analyst.


the primary purpose of this position is to audit billing for all customers to ensure an accurate and compliant billing process. the role will be responsible for understanding our contractual billing obligations by liaising with key stakeholders including contract management, pricing implementation teams, it, operations and ap finance and reviewing our current billing to ensure these obligations are met.

\xa0

reporting into the operations support manager, the role will also be responsible for understanding the billing process and providing recommendations on process improvements to increase the accuracy and efficiency of the billing process.\xa0


your key responsibilities will include but won’t be limited to:

  • complete audits on the billing for each client and identify areas of non-compliance
  • prepare and present analytical reports to the senior leadership team on billing wastage.
  • review client contracts to understand our contractual obligations for billing
  • implement necessary changes to resolve any areas of non-compliance.
  • process new contracts and sales in relation to billing activities
  • liaise with relevant stakeholders to gather and collect information required for billing activities.
  • issue and distribute billing information required for invoicing customers from internal stakeholders and external customers.
  • address customer inquiries and questions.
  • review the current billing system and process and prepare a business case on solutions to mitigate risks and increase efficiencies.
  • lead billing system requirement definition and work with project team to implement new billing system.
  • develop controls and measures to ensure accurate and timely billing.
    \xa0

your profile will include demonstrated experience in a finance role within a dynamic working environment, ideally with a related tertiary qualification. you will have a solid knowledge of electronic billing systems and procedures as well as strong analytical and problem solving skills.

additionally, you will have:

  • a team focused problem solver, with excellent communication skills - both written and verbal.
  • must possess an organized, detailed and thorough approach to development.
  • must be self-starting and able to work independently.

decipha values their employees and the commitment they make to our organisation. in return we provide a supportive and encouraging environment, to all employees to reward and facilitate on-going growth and development.

interested in applying? send your application letter and resume to:

humanresources@decipha.com.au \xa0

\xa0applications close end of business 10\xa0may 2019

\xa0

please note – you must have full australian working rights to be considered for this opportunity.

Title: financial analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

company description

our name isn’t the only thing that’s unique about leidos australia. we’re a complex systems integration company building world-class solutions across government and defence that ensure peace of mind for the entire nation. supported by global backing from our us network, we’re trusted by our customers to deliver the most innovative answers to their most complex challenges. seriously interesting work that benefits and safeguards every australian. that’s where you come in.\xa0

\xa0

job description

your new role\xa0\xa0

leidos australia, is seeking an experienced financial analyst to support program activities including the annual operating plan, monthly outlook, month end closing and accruals process, program performance reporting, earned value management reporting, quarterly contract status review and project profitability analysis.

your responsibilities will include (not limited to):

  • compilation and review of budgets using actual performance, previous budget figures, estimated revenue, expense reports.
  • coordinate multiple financial cost analysis functions, including cost allocation, setting up cost control systems, collecting data, controlling costs and preparing reports that maintain the company’s cost accounting system.
  • responsible for administration and reporting of overhead budgets, charge codes and cost allocation.
  • liaison to the business for indirect cost rates, compliance with cost principles.
  • actively encourage conversion of indirect cost to direct cost.

\xa0

qualifications

about you and what you’ll bring

you will bring your well developed finance experience from a project based environment, including budget development, financial control, forecasting and proposal support. experience in a global business would be valuable, along with familiarity with systems such as oracle financials, hyperion, costpoint and business objects. ability to juggle competing tasks is essential along with strong relationship skills.\xa0

\xa0

additional information

this role does require the successful applicant to be an australian citizen and to be able to obtain a security clearance to the nv1 level.

leidos australia is the largest commercial supplier of intelligence services to the australian government and provides a number of critical systems integration projects to the department of defence. we also deliver service management, including service desk, for the australian tax office, supporting 25,000 ato end users.

Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

  • convenient central city location in melbourne, one of the world’s most liveable cities
  • full time, continuing position
  • competitive salary + 17% super, flexible working arrangements available

the role

you will be expected to contribute to the research and teaching efforts of the school, in the area of statistics and analytics. this includes producing high quality research publications and submitting competitive grant applications, and supervising research students in postgraduate research programs.

your responsibilities

as a statistics and analytics lecturer, you will maintain and advance your scholarly research and professional capabilities relevant to this discipline. you will actively promote the school’s programs especially in statistics and analytics, as well as participate in the development and implementation of the school’s strategic plan. you will maintain and extend research links, participate in research teams and show innovation and flexibility in your teaching.

skills & experience required

  • demonstrated skills in using industry leading statistical computing packages such as r, sas and python

about rmit

rmit is a multi-sector university of technology, design and enterprise with more than 91,000 students and 11,000 staff globally. rmit offers postgraduate, undergraduate, vocational education and online programs to provide students with a variety of work-relevant pathways.

the school of science is one of rmit\'s top-performing research schools, we deliver research that addresses the \'real life questions\' essential to australia\'s innovation agenda. we attract esteemed experts and researchers from around the world and has strong partnerships with industry and international collaborators.

benefits

Description:

about us

we are an outcome-focused, constantly changing business that focuses your talents and challenges you to perform at your best. as a team, we’re bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to delight our members.

the opportunity:

Title: sports risk analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">beteasy is the most sophisticated and rewarding wagering operator in its class. built on a powerful partnership with the stars group, we are well on our journey to be the number one wagering operator by 2020, delivered through excellent people, process and technology within an innovative and dynamic culture.

helping us to build out the best markets for our customers is our risk & trading team. we’ve got a new role for a sports risk analyst to join this team and help them by providing in-depth analysis and allow us to make informed sports risk management decisions.

about the role:
reporting to the sports risk manager, you will be collaborating regularly with our sports and racing traders. please note that as we cover live sporting events, you must be available to work weekends and evenings.
day to day you’ll be involved in:
  • risk management of sporting events
  • data insights and analysis
  • regular reporting to key stakeholders
  • client analysis
about you:
we’re looking for a keen sports and racing enthusiast who really understands our industry. ideally, you’re highly numerate and looking to start a career in analytics. read on and see if you’ve got what it takes to be part of our team:
  • able to make sound decisions under pressure
  • excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • strong interpersonal skills and a team player
  • demonstrate good use of initiative & ability to work independently
  • analytical & able to draw sound conclusions from data insights
  • proficient in microsoft office suite, in particular – excel
  • outstanding attention to detail
  • demonstrated ability to influence peers and stakeholders
  • strong sense of judgement
in return for your hard work we have a number of benefits and initiatives to support you personally and professionally including but not limited to 5 weeks’ annual leave, a performance bonus, matched charity donations, the myki commuter club and, as the official wagering partner to the afl, there are heaps of opportunities to catch a game or two!\xa0

why beteasy?

beteasy was recognised as an employer of choice by the australian business awards for the 2nd year running. with teams in darwin, melbourne and sydney, we’re passionate about what we do and proud of our unique heritage and entrepreneurial spirit. we work together to deliver exceptional outcomes that push the limits of our customers\' expectations. with brilliant minds and a vibrant culture, the sky’s the limit! our environment is supportive and friendly, we encourage innovation, collaboration and creative thinking. if you thrive on being challenged and enjoy working in a fast-paced stimulating environment, come and join us on this incredible journey.

to find more about beteasy please visit https://workatbeteasy.com.au/

Title: business analyst
Description:

  • change management of transitional projects\xa0
  • delivery management skills\xa0
  • experience of working on small, medium and or large projects\xa0

  • managing small to medium tasks, plans and projects\xa0
  • user acceptance testing activities\xa0
  • creation of monthly progress reports\xa0
what we need you to have\xa0
  • recent, strong experience in identifying business requirements and opportunities for business process re-engineering\xa0

this role will be\xa0suited to individuals with 3-5\xa0years’ experience\xa0with an established consulting or professional services firm who are looking for an opportunity for further growth and responsibility. these positions will be based\xa0from the\xa0melbourne\xa0cbd, adelaide or sydney with some travel requirements. it is a\xa0permanent\xa0position\xa0with genuine career growth opportunity.\xa0

rate/salary will be very competitive and based on experience. \xa0

next steps
if you would like to be part of a growing team where you are appreciated, work with like-minded peers and continue to advance your skills and learn then please do get in touch for a confidential discussion.\xa0

velrada do not accept unsolicited cv’s from recruitment agents and are only considering direct applications. \xa0

Title: operations analyst | energy start-up| $80-100k+super
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

the company

this start-up energy business uses technology and a lean business model to offer a growing portfolio of services, at a fantastic price point, to a huge number of customers. with a great start-up mentality this is a collaborative and fun place to work - the organization is looking to grow substantially over the next few years and is a fast-paced, outcome focused business.

the role

the operations analyst role sits in an expanding wholesale energy markets team and is critical to providing insight in to the best way for the business to operate in the wholesale markets. this role has lots of variety and suits people who enjoy a role which has some breadth to it and where you will face new challenges daily. you will perform day-day gas operations, spend a fair amount of time liaising with aemo, suppliers and market operators, and help to develop/implement models for reporting and forecasting. you will also play a key role in the development and operation of the company’s trading and risk systems.

this position has lots of room for growth and is rich with future opportunities. you will be working for a smart, driven and experienced manager who invests heavily in developing people.

key responsibilities include:

  • forecasting demand, bidding and dispatching product in to spot markets.
  • analysing short term and long-term pricing trends in the energy markets.
  • performance monitoring, risk reporting (wholesales contract management).
  • liaising with aemo, suppliers and market operators to reach desired outcomes.
  • work closely with the finance team, and wider business, to understand and manage wholesale position on volume and risk.

about you

you will be an analyst working in the energy market. you will have excellent communication skills, an analytical mindset and experience in modelling, analysis, forecasting, and reporting within the energy sector. you will have some experience working with excel, data modelling, sql, bi tools, and be a great problem solver, and enjoy enabling successful commercial outcomes.

your experience and skills should include most, if not all:

  • a broad understanding of the energy markets (nem, swgm, sttm).
  • data modelling, excel skills, experience interpreting and reporting in data,
  • communicating with finance and business stakeholders to understand needs and provide insights and solutions.

you must be:

  • excited by the idea of working in a growing business.
  • someone who wants to contribute ideas to a fun and innovative organisation.

how to apply

if this sounds like you then click on the apply button or call 03 9691 3661.

Title: technical business analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
  • join a highly skilled and dynamic team
  • 700 bourke street, melbourne
  • lead role in the transformation of our mobile platform

our digital technology team is seeking a passionate, results focused individual to take accountability for the analysis, direction, and process engineering.

the successful applicant will be part of our mobile platform team and will be responsible for providing leadership as we continue our transformation of nabs mobile banking platform.

this position will provide leadership and coaching to our business analysts, work closely to model and influence our digital pipeline of work, as well as provide strategic support, process engineering and influence product decisions back into our digital product capability from the inception of an idea through to production releases. a strong focus will be placed on your digital product knowledge, leadership, innovative mindset, ability to influence and process modelling and re-engineering capabilities.

primary responsibilities will include:

  • responsibility for the end to end analysis and process mapping for nabs frontline applications
  • working directly with our digital lt and key stakeholders to help prioritise work, regularly communicating outcomes, opportunities, risks and issues
  • working with the following individuals/teams to achieve the following outcomes:
    • scrum team – coaching and mentoring the team through the analysis, design, development, testing and implementation phases
    • pipeline and agile release trains – frequent communication through all stages of the process prior to initiatives commencing delivery
    • product/service owners – frequent communication around story/epic/iteration prioritisation, shaping, elaboration and progress through the digital phases prior to commencing delivery
    • product engineering and user experience – providing support to ensure solution architects and designers have all the resources available and roadblocks removed to support the creation of well quantified and researched stories
  • management of conflicting priorities in a rapidly changing environment
  • guide and reinforce a culture where the analysis team are integral from the beginning of an initiative by ensuring they are mandatory at planning meetings, and have the confidence to push back when required
  • continually developing and balancing technical and soft skills with an understanding that making great software requires both collaboration and problem analysis
  • manage initiative pipeline of work for the mobile platform

essential knowledge, experience and attributes

  • 8+ years within a business and technical analysis, digital product or similar role
  • strong experience in business and process analysis, mapping and engineering
  • working in with operations and quality engineering team to provide end to end system high level flows
  • experience working in large, complex projects in an unpredictable environment with competing priorities
  • development and delivery of requirements and processes supporting the build and release of customer facing digital assets
  • excellent communication, stakeholder management and influencing/presentations skills
  • strong analytical, problem-solving skills, risk assessment, planning and mitigation skills
  • proven experience working collaboratively with product and user experience teams
  • experience with mobile software platforms and devices/wearables (ios and android)
  • experience working within an agile software development team, specifically in a cross-functional scrum team of 10-15 people
  • extensive strategy and planning skills across all test phases within the sdlc
  • proven management of multiple inter-dependant deliveries on time and in budget
  • you live to innovate, re-engineer processes, and automate

in return we offer a rewarding work environment, structured training, structured career progression, hack days and personal development in a supportive team environment.\xa0

to be eligible to apply, you must be an australian / new zealand citizen or hold permanent residency status in australia.

Title: senior data solutions specialist
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

job no: 0048316

work type: continuing

location: parkville

division/faculty: university services

department/school: department of infrastructure services

salary: $101,282 - $109,625 (uom 8)

role & superannuation rate: professional - full time - 17% super

about university services

university services comprises of 1,600 professional staff focused on providing client-centric and innovative services to the university. the group is providing transformational change, defining and influencing future service enhancements, and acts as a shared services function within the university of melbourne.

about the role

research platform services provides a range of researcher facing services that enhance research activities at the university. this role will be part of the data solutions team that focuses on the development, delivery and support of data management solutions.

this position has two primary components:

  • contributing to the operational support of the university’s suite of research data management solutions. as the demand on these solutions grows, there will be opportunity to creatively improve, automate and scale-up operational processes.
  • contributing to the development of the current set of data solutions supported by the team. within this, there will be a focus on data that are created by the pool of research instruments that produce data (e.g. imaging scanners, microscopes, gene sequencers) that exist across the university. this provides an exciting opportunity to be involved in developing cutting-edge solutions for both big and complex data. other activities in this component may also involve addressing challenges relating to digital preservation and teaching and learning.

this position will work with other members of the data solutions team as well as other parts of infrastructure services that provide the equipment and services that provide connectivity and data movement from the instruments to appropriate data storage environments. this position requires a medium to high level of ability to engage and consult with researchers to determine needs and to assist in creating solutions that respond to their data management needs.

core accountabilities:

  • undertake a substantive operational role supporting research platform services’ data management platforms
  • contribute to the development of data handling solutions for university instrument platforms and research platform services’ research data management platform
  • participate in the development of other generic and specific data management solutions
  • take part in discussions with researchers to assist in creating custom data management solutions
  • maintain collaborative relationship with other teams from research platform services and infrastructure services
  • communicate effectively with a range of stakeholders, and to explain technical challenges to non-technical audiences
  • contribute to research platform services’ data platform training program as required

selection criteria:

education/qualifications

  1. the appointee will have a degree in computer science or equivalent qualifications / experience

knowledge and skills

  1. demonstrated experience in supporting software systems in an operational setting
  2. demonstrable software development skills (preferably including an object-oriented language)
  3. good understanding of basic data management and security principles and best practices within a research setting
  4. demonstrated experience and ability to work closely with researchers and understand their research processes and translate these into research-enhancing software solutions
  5. ability to work independently, take initiative and set priorities
  6. experience of integrating computing infrastructure, unix and scripting (e.g. bash) experience and knowledge
  7. knowledge of mediaflux would be beneficial

other job-related information:\xa0

this role may require occasional out of ordinary hours of work and travel, local and interstate.

benefits

-\xa0 maximise your benefits through our salary packaging scheme

-\xa0 flexible family friendly policies, providing generous leave and working conditions

-\xa0 the opportunity to work in a culturally rich environment

-\xa0 a substantial discount to eligible staff and their immediate families in undertaking further studies at the university of melbourne

to find out more, go to\xa0http://about.unimelb.edu.au/careers/working/benefits\xa0\xa0

culture

the university is a vibrant campus. we have well-established clubs and networks giving the opportunity to engage and collaborate with other staff around the university. we strive to create an environment where staff and students promote culturally inclusive behaviour and activities, ensure cultural differences are heard and explored, and actively seek to learn from other cultures.

how to apply

your application submitted should include a cv along with your responses against the selection criteria found in the position description for the role.

*for information to assist you with compiling short statements to answer the selection criteria/competencies, please go to\xa0http://about.unimelb.edu.au/careers/search/info/selection-criteria

position description

Title: data modeller - datalake project
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

we believe in bringing craftsmanship back to technology, because as artisans, we passionately care about the quality outcomes we leave behind.

we have some of the best tech talent in australia and due to client and internal demand, we\'re looking to expand our data team with\u202fan experienced data modeller.

our data modeller\'s know their craft, and know it well. in addition we need you to have the right soft skills to listen to and understand other ideas, plus know and see the patterns from your experience across a variation of complex implementations.

our data modeller\'s compliment the skill set of data engineers have been around the block a few times and have some battle scars from building and designing models. they have worked in larger teams and understand the corporate wheel of death (risk, security, governance, finance, etc...) and have worked through these issues before.


requirements


people wanting to become data modeller at versent have the following skills and experience

  • ability to collect, organise and analyse data
  • relational and dimensional data modelling
  • experience in designing databases for microservices
  • experience in designing enterprise analytical data models
  • data analysis to profile and discover data and analyse data relationships
  • construct and document data lineage and data mapping
  • open with data modelling tools, ideally with broad technology/tools/methodologies to bring options and ideas to the table
  • design and help implement data quality and data cleansing techniques
  • document business and technical metadata
  • demonstrated experience with sql and business intelligence tools
  • data security requirements gathering
  • consulting experience, allied with strong stakeholder management skills
  • exposure to aws, oracle, snowflake and talend will be looked favourably upon

benefits


why we\'re different

you know, work doesn\'t have to feel like work. in fact, we don\'t want it to. that\'s why we\'ve cultivated an environment based on creativity. because when people who care about their craft are given the freedom to explore possibilities without restriction, amazing things can happen.

our culture

no cool cliques, just hard-working humans generating ideas and devising solutions in a creative, collaborative work space. professional but not corporate, we believe success is achieved through strong leadership (without interference from middle-management) and an autonomous working environment backed by the moral support of like-minded peers.

versent values and behaviors

  • people: we believe in a positive team with family spirit, because life is to short for anything else.
  • customer: we create remarkable experiences for customers and treat them as you would wish to be treated.
  • quality: be artisans who care for their craft and lead change through continuous improvement.
  • reliability: do what we say we will do when we say we will do it, every time.
  • transparency: full disclosure, integrity and honesty in all things.
  • reciprocate: give back and assist as much as possible, whenever possible.

australasian leukaemia & lymphoma group

full time, ongoing

inner melbourne

the australasian leukaemia & lymphoma group (allg) is the leading national cooperative group that specialises in establishing investigator-initiated clinical trials for patients with a haematological (blood) cancer.\xa0the successful candidate will be responsible for building and amending clinical databases to capture data for the\xa0allg multisite clinical trials.\xa0 this position will also involve data reconciliations, data extraction, development and maintenance of resources and documentation for clinical trial data management including the development and management of the edc crf library, effective communication, collaboration with allg investigators and key stakeholders. the position is fulltime, ongoing, and part of a team dedicated to research excellence in a progressive clinical setting. the position involves minimal travel but a willingness to travel interstate when needed is essential.

  • tertiary qualification in an information technology, health or science field
  • experience in programming and constructing databases for multi-site clinical trials

the allg as a not-for-profit organisation offers salary packaging entitlement. the position involves minimal travel and a willingness to travel interstate when needed is essential.

Title: data analyst - salesforce
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">we are seeking a data analyst (salesforce environment)on an exciting client engagement for\xa06 months.

the primary purpose of the position is to:
  • collaborate with key stakeholders to facilitate the conversation and migration of data between business systems, ensuring data integrity, ownership, and curation practices are preserved, defined, optimised, and documented.
  • extract, transform and obfuscate data in readiness for migration
  • validate data migration strategy and ensure adherence to dependencies and project timelines
\xa0
key areas of accountability:
  • provide expert professional support and assistance, on good practice for the identification, organisation, and curation management of data associated with key business activities, such as research management.
  • perform data analysis and mapping of data entities between business systems, ensuring data integrity, ownership, and curation activities are identified and maintained.
  • ensure data models are documented within the confines of an enterprise architecture framework and relevant to both business and technical operatives.
  • undertake quality assurance activities on data streams, identifying key risks for data corruption or misuse.
  • make recommendations on improvements to processes, practices, or policies affecting data management.
  • produce data modelling outputs such as reports, architecture documentation, and business/system process documentation, as part of an overall knowledge management practice.
\xa0
the successful\xa0candidate we are seeking will comprise\xa0of the following:\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0
  • demonstrated experience in data extraction and conversion.
  • demonstrated experience in working diligently with partner vendors to resolve mismatches once vendor resources have loaded the data into the target platform.
  • experience in a salesforce environment highly regarded although not mandatory.
  • demonstrated experience with data modelling (inclusive of data lifecycle management) across a broad range of business activities.
  • demonstrated experience and expertise in data analysis focusing on requirements elicitation and technical specification development.
  • demonstrated experience in, and data conversation between complex business ecosystems.
  • demonstrated ability to manage multiple stakeholders.
  • demonstrated high level of self-motivation.
  • strong interpersonal skills including ability to negotiate, motivate, influence and build relationships.

additional information

for immediate consideration, please apply now.

Title: business intelligence (bi) developer
Description:

they are looking for a senior business intelligence (bi) developer\xa0to join their boutique and collegiate team, taking on the challenges for one of their clients, which range across a number of industries, including banking & finance, manufacturing, construction, education, transport and government.\xa0the role specifically requires someone who is proficient with microsoft systems, in particular\xa0ssis, ssrs and\xa0ssas. the ideal candidate would also have\xa0experience in ms sql servers,\xa0cubes, dimensions, lakes,\xa0stored procedures, python and aws. knowledge of and experience in powerbi would be a plus.
