Title: manager - market insights
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about the role:

our markets insights team plays a pivotal role in providing in-depth analysis and reporting of australia’s energy markets to an array of internal and external stakeholders. the manager market insights will be key in undertaking analysis of emerging trends in energy markets and expanding the range of publications building on the success of existing aemo’s quarterly energy dynamics report.

as the manager you will have a unique opportunity to undertake research and investigate trends across a broad range of energy market topics. the objective is to provide insight to stakeholders on outcomes and trends that inform decision making around market performance and market design.

you may be a seasoned\xa0energy market professional or an experienced analyst looking to take your next step in your career and to lead and develop a small team.

key accountabilities:

  • day to day management and leadership of the market insights team \xa0
  • collating and publishing the quarterly energy dynamics report and presenting to a range of stakeholders including the aemo board, regulators and governments.
  • monitoring participant behaviours and drivers in energy markets operated by aemo.
  • monitoring drivers of energy market outcomes both domestically and in key comparable markets including the uk and us \xa0
  • analysing energy market outcomes to derive insights that impact market operations and market design.

required skills and experience:\xa0

  • tertiary qualifications in an analytical discipline such as economics, science, maths, finance or engineering
  • at least 7 years’ experience in the analysis of electricity or gas markets
  • proven experience delivering impactful outcomes from analysis and research \xa0
  • strong stakeholder management, presentation skills and engagement capability.
  • experience in the design and development of models for use in answering varied operational and/or or regulatory questions
  • extensive experience and knowledge to the energy industry including aemo’s wholesale and retail energy markets as well as related markets including asx futures, lng, green certificates, carbon etc \xa0
  • hands on approach to data analysis and the ability to extract data from a range of sources via sql and to derive meaning from large data sets.

about the australian energy market operator (aemo):

aemo delivers secure, reliable energy to millions of australians every day.\xa0 our work touches virtually all aspects of australia’s industrial, business and domestic life.\xa0 we ensure energy produced by electricity generators and gas suppliers reaches consumers nationwide.\xa0

we operate the national electricity grid and manage gas markets in all states except northern territory.\xa0 we also operate victoria’s gas system.\xa0

aemo provides expert guidance to government and the energy sector to inform policy, investment decisions and infrastructure management.\xa0 we play a crucial role in shaping australia’s energy future.\xa0

your career with aemo

aemo has some of australia’s finest energy sector talent in its midst.\xa0 our work is intellectually challenging, and our people gain enormous satisfaction from solving the complex problems constantly facing them.\xa0

the continuing interplay of shifts in energy generation, reliability, affordability, and a low emissions future will ensure we at aemo continue to be challenged and driven for many years to come.

so, make your next career move one that really matters!\xa0

some of our employment benefits:

here are some of the attractive employment benefits we offer:

  • professional development via projects, assignments, industry networks and job rotation
  • flexible working: work from home, part time and job share
  • discount health insurance, gym membership and other concessions
  • free salary continuance insurance and annual performance bonuses *

* subject to eligibility

apply now to join us and take your place alongside like-minded passionate, driven individuals in the energy sector: one of the world’s most exciting and dynamic industries.

click ‘apply’ to submit your cv and cover letter by close of business thursday 9th of may 2019.\xa0

no agency applications will be accepted at this time.

Title: big data engineer - melbourne, sydney or adelaide
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about capgemini

a global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients' opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. it is a multicultural company with 200,000 team members in over 40 countries. in 2017 the group achieved €12.8 billion in revenue. learn more about us at www.capgemini.com

\xa0

about our team

our insights and data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. our clients are among australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner with capgemini for a very good reason - our exceptional people.

due to continued growth within capgemini's insights & data practice we intend to recruit a number of big data engineers with relevant consulting and communication skills. if you are already working in a consultancy role, or have excellent client-facing skills gained within large organizations, we would like to discuss our consultant opportunities with you.

\xa0

about the role

\xa0the big data engineer will expand and optimise our clients' data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimise their data flow and collection for cross functional teams. your responsibilities include:

  • build robust, efficient and reliable data pipelines consisting of diverse data sources to ingest and process data into hadoop data platform.
  • design and develop real time streaming and batch processing pipeline solutions
  • assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
  • design, develop and implement data pipelines for data migration & collection, data analytics and other data movement solutions.
  • work with stakeholders including the product owner and data analyst teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
  • collaborate with architects to define the architecture and technology selection.

\xa0

about you

you will have the ability to optimise data systems and build them from the ground up. you will support software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.

essential skills and experience

  • proven working experience as big data engineer for 2+ years preferably in building data lake solution by ingesting and processing data from various source systems on aws cloud\xa0
  • experience with multiple big data technologies and concepts such as hdfs, nifi, kafka, hive, spark, spark streaming, hbase , emr and redshift on aws\xa0
  • experience in one or more of java, scala, python and bash.
  • ability to work in team in diverse/ multiple stakeholder environment
  • experience in working in a fast-paced agile environment
  • bs in computer science, statistics, informatics, information systems or another quantitative field
  • implement test cases and test automation.
  • apply devops, continuous integration and continuous delivery principles to build automated pipelines for deployment and production assurance on the data platform.
  • share knowledge with immediate peers and build communities and connections that promote better technical practices across the organisation

\xa0

preferable skills and experience

  • knowledge of and/or experience with big data integration and streaming technologies (e.g. kafka, nifi, flume, etc.)
  • experience in building various frameworks for enterprise data lake is highly desirable
  • knowledge of building self-contained applications using docker and openshift

\xa0

how to apply

interested?\xa0 we invite you to join us to discover a career that will challenge, support and inspire you. working at capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. not only will you work alongside inspiring colleagues with a world of experience, but you'll also have access to great benefits including, salary continuance insurance, paid parental leave, education assistance, salary packaging, the ability to purchase additional leave, as well as, discounts on entertainment, financial and wellbeing services, travel and shopping.\xa0 ranked among ethisphere's 2015 most ethical companies in the word. our seven values are at the heart of everything we do - honesty, boldness, trust, team spirit, freedom, fun and modesty.\xa0 if you believe you have "la niaque" to go the extra mile, then apply online today.

capgemini is a proud to be equal opportunity employer and all applicants must be legally entitled to work in the country the role is based out of, unless otherwise stated within the job advertisement.\xa0 proof of work entitlements and visa status will be required prior to and/or at time of offer. successful applicants will be required to complete a security and reference checks prior to commencement of employment.

please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.

Title: data scientist
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
  • \xa0multiple\xa0full-time permanent opportunities
  • based in melbourne cbd\xa0
  • exciting\xa0global\xa0data science projects

\xa0

about the role:

brightstar’s global data science team is seeking experienced data scientists to accelerate our product development across several high-profile strategic projects.

\xa0we are an established pure-play data science team, ably supported by other teams who cover data management, infrastructure, business intelligence and reporting. we enjoy highly-flexible working arrangements, value our work/life balance and relish the opportunity to apply sophisticated mathematics to significant commercial challenges.

as part of brightstar’s product organisation, we work within an agile framework in global, cross-functional delivery teams to design, build and deploy cloud-based machine learning and optimisation products. these are a mix of internal and client-facing products servicing customers across the world and span financial products, retailing, product portfolio optimisation, marketing analytics and risk.

we also engage with brightstar’s advisory services teams to design and execute bespoke modelling for key accounts, including executive briefings.

the\xa0data scientists will\xa0have proven expertise in data science techniques, tools and methodologies and be able to contribute to the creation of novel intellectual property. knowledge of the broader telco market and the related supply chain and retail business would be well-regarded.\xa0

areas where expertise is to be applied include, but are not limited to:\xa0price elasticity, conjoint/choice modelling, fraud, \xa0interactive data visualisation, mixed integer programming, time-series and econometric forecasting, monte carlo simulations.

\xa0

key responsibilities:

  • working as part of an agile team to deliver features and capabilities as agreed
  • building and deploying cloud-based machine learning and optimisation products for global clients
  • engaging with a variety of stakeholders: functional smes, it professionals, operations specialists, designers and others
  • conceiving and building innovative ip to solve unique industry problems, and deploying it to production systems
  • creating high-value insights for senior client audiences (metrics, "deep dives", tools, visualisations)
  • depending on experience, the right candidate may undertake further leadership responsibilities within the team

\xa0

to be successful, you will have:

  • university-level mathematics (any discipline) and 3+ years’\xa0corporate experience in an analytical role
  • advanced data science capabilities (machine learning,\xa0mathematical optimisation and algorithm design) as demonstrated\xa0through expertise in r, python and sql
  • exposure to working in cloud-based environments, with azure preferred
  • willingness to write and deploy data science products as part of a collaborative team, embracing git, pair programming, test-driven development, and coding standards and best practices
  • high motivation for ongoing learning, curiosity, tenacity and\xa0desire to be stretched intellectually
  • postgraduate qualifications in a quantitative field are well-regarded but not essential

\xa0

why us?

brightstar is home to innovative thinkers who believe that a connected world is a better world. doing business in the mobile sector is complicated – our job is to make it simple. for carriers, retailers and enterprise partners.

brightstar simplifies the wireless world, making mobile technology accessible to everyone. we process over 100 million devices every year, providing innovative end-to-end services seamlessly integrated with our customers\' businesses.

we hire bold thinkers who thrive in a fast-paced, innovation-minded culture. sound like you?

Title: functional business analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

nikpol pty. ltd. is a national family owned company shaping interior design trends through our high quality environmentally preferable products. nikpol leads the way in decorative and storage solutions for both domestic and commercial applications in the area of decorative surfaces, specialised hardware, domestic home appliances, drawer systems and hinges.

we are looking for an experienced business analyst that is passionate about data and understands how to use data technologies to enable better bi capability. you will be joining a growing bi team that will be leading significant data and it driven change throughout the organisation. you will provide analytical and reporting support to all divisions of the business, enabling more effective decisions to be made. in this role, you will have the opportunity to liaise with a diverse range of people from across the business and continuously seek efficiencies in providing efficient solutions.

\xa0key responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • develop data analysis and ongoing insights leveraging multiple data sources.
  • utilise analysis techniques that test hypotheses and correspond to business performance metrics.
  • engage with stakeholders to develop data insights and communicate findings, projections and recommendations with business leaders to make informed decisions.
  • understand, complete, debug, improve and distribute the recurring and ad-hoc bi reports/dashboards (using excel/power query/vba).
  • occasional data entry and data cleansing for the bi reports.
  • work with business departments assisting them to troubleshoot and identify areas for improvement in their business processes and systems.
  • determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats.
  • prepare reports by collecting, analysing, and summarizing data and trends to provide end to end solutions.
  • identify insights and predict outcomes from large datasets, applying advanced data science techniques.
  • contribute with the execution and recommend prioritisation of analytical projects, through the preparation of technical reports, user documentation and presentations.

about you:

  • a tertiary-level qualification, within it or business preferably in a quantitative or analytical discipline with subsequent relevant experience.
  • strong attention to detail, think outside the box, inquisitive about what the data can tell and not afraid to be innovative in improving systems.
  • ability to think creatively through complex problems and discover the best path.
  • proven advanced microsoft excel macro and power query skills (power pivot, power query, power bi).
  • a \'can do\' adaptive attitude.
  • excellent verbal and written english skills including demonstrated experience in the analysis, interpretation and presentation of complex information for a range of audiences.
  • proven strong interpersonal and communication skills.
  • ability to work in a team environment.

  • ideally experienced with management report design, development and deployment (incl. visualisation).

  • a learning attitude - you are driven by curiosity and a desire to invest in yourself.
  • the ability to be dynamic, assertive and diplomatic, possessing solid influencing, negotiation and presentation skills.
  • your mind is sharp, and you are keen to keep improving how you apply it.

desired, but not essential skills and experience:

  • microsoft dynamics nav and jet reports experience

do you believe you have the skills and experience for this role? we\'d love to hear from you as soon as possible. attach your resume and write a covering letter telling us why you feel you are the perfect person to join our innovations team. as part of your cover letter, please provide a short answer to the following hypothetical question:

we have a hunch that margins for certain products, in a certain area, are dropping. leaving aside macro-economic factors, why do you think that could be?

note: the shortlisted candidate/s may be required to undergo a criminal history background / police / qualifications check at the later stages of the recruitment process. you will also be required to perform an excel / power query competency test to demonstrate your skill set.

please forward your resume to hr – eve huseni.

do work with purpose at afca

the australian financial complaints authority (afca) is a dynamic and exciting new organisation that resolves financial disputes between australians and financial firms like banks, investment firms and financial advisers.

we are a fast-paced purpose driven organisation that has grown rapidly since we launched on 1 november 2018. we already have over 550 staff and we are looking to recruit intelligent and passionate people to join our team.

this role will see you partnering with key stakeholders across the business to understand key strategic issues, identify opportunities, and deliver high impact data analytics.

responsibilities of the role include:

  • defining and implementing afca\'s business intelligence strategy.
  • managing a team of analysts to regularly report insights through microsoft power bi and dashboards.
  • undertake sophisticated modelling and apply independent critical thinking in model\'s development and insights formulation, and
  • mentor and support the development and professional growth of staff.

who we are looking for

the successful candidate will bring demonstrated senior level business analytics experience in a large complex operational and dynamic environment. the candidate will have experience leading a team, and a strong background in data governance and data management, statistics, visualisation and forecasting.

as a new organisation, we need people who want to make afca a great place to work and embody our culture of being fair, independent, transparent, accountable, honest, respectful, proactive and customer focused.\xa0

we want people with empathy, who can speak plainly, have a sense of natural justice and community standards, and who can make stakeholders feel heard.

most importantly, we want people who understand what we mean when we say, "afca is on the side of fairness".

benefits

afca offers you the chance to do work with purpose, along with genuine career development opportunities and the ability to make a difference in an organisation with a positive, collaborative and exciting culture.

we encourage work/life balance and offer extensive health and wellbeing initiatives, including an onsite employee assistance program. because we\'re a not-for-profit, we also provide competitive salary packaging options.

to apply

afca promotes a workplace that values fairness, respect and social and cultural diversity. aboriginal and torres strait islander peoples, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

to apply for this role, please submit your resume and cover letter explaining why you think you\'d be a great fit for afca.

if this looks like you, please contact tayler bridger at mars recruitment via the details listed below.

Title: senior business analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

\xa0

about us

\xa0

cpa australia is one of the world’s leading member service organisations, with over 163,000 members across 125 countries. our core services to members include education, training, technical support and advocacy.

our core services to members include education, training, technical support and advocacy. employees\xa0and members work together with local and international bodies to represent the views and concerns of the profession to governments, regulators, industries, academia and the general public.

\xa0

\xa0

about the role?

\xa0

reporting to the business analyst practice lead, the senior\xa0business analyst will be an active participant on a variety of initiatives, from large web-based and digital projects to smaller enhancements, in agile or traditional approach environments. they will collaborate with a broad spectrum of internal and external stakeholders at all levels, to gather, analyse, review and document stakeholder requirements, through a variety of means including facilitation of workshops.

\xa0

you will also be responsible for:

\xa0

  • liaising professionally and confidently with a diverse group of stakeholders at all levels, from executives to business users to technical experts, both internal and external.
  • partnering with the business as a ‘trusted advisor’ on behalf of the technology team.
  • challenging the status quo, innovative thinking and effective influencing of decision makers within boundaries of business value and technology constraints.
  • understanding the political culture of the enterprise to comprehend and arbitrate a wide range of potentially conflicting stakeholder preferences and views.
  • confidently facilitating workshops, focus groups and other forums – to collaborate with stakeholders; understanding their motivators, objectives, roi, risks, issues etc.
  • identifying, analysing, interpreting and validating business and technical requirements in a manner aligned with project expectations, with exceptional attention to detail
  • producing all types of business analysis documentation, including but not limited to, change impact assessments, business requirements and functional requirements.
  • translating functional, business and technical requirements into epics, user stories and acceptance criteria, as mandated working in an agile environment.

\xa0

about you – you will have:

  • tertiary level qualification in information technology (it) and/or business management or equivalent practical experience.
  • solid experience partnering with the business to deliver targeted, high value solutions to complex problems
  • demonstrated experience as a business analyst on agile projects and ability to translate functional, business and technical requirements into epics, user stories and acceptance criteria.
  • proven experience in facilitating workshops, negotiation and conflict resolution
  • excellent stakeholder management, communication and engagement skills
  • first class communication, writing, interpersonal, negotiation and influencing skills.
  • you will also need to be a self-starter and someone who is comfortable working collaboratively with others.

\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

how do i apply?

click apply now to submit your application for this opportunity! should you require more information on the role, feel free to contact the recruitment team on employment@cpaaustralia.com.au

to learn more about cpa australia and other opportunities, please visit our careers page at https://www.cpaaustralia.com.au/about-us/careers

\xa0

\n\n

Title: business analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about us

western health manages three acute public hospitals: footscray, sunshine and williamstown hospital. it also operates the sunbury day hospital, transition care at hazeldean and a range of community based services. we care for a culturally diverse population of more than 1 million people. we have 7,000 employees who are driven by our values of\xa0‘compassion, accountability, respect, excellence and safety’ (cares).

our continued growth has seen the addition of a new purpose built, multi-storey joan kirner women\'s and children\'s at sunshine hospital.

about the role

an exciting opportunity for a business analyst is available within the financial planning & analysis team at western health. this position is based at the sunshine and footscray hospital.

reporting to the manager of financial planning & analysis, you will provide business planning, performance reporting and financial analysis services to support key stakeholders across various business units within the organisation. specifically to understand business needs, assessing the financial impact of operational initiatives, capturing, analysing and documenting requirements and then supporting the communication and delivery of those requirements with relevant parties.

your excellent verbal and written communication skills will enable you to effectively present business ideas, financial data and performance analysis to a wide range of audiences. your superior stakeholder management and interpersonal skills will allow you to work seamlessly with the finance team, operation mangers, divisional directors and executive directors of wh. you must have extensive knowledge of business management including budget development, forecasting, costing, analysis, and reporting. your positive, and “can do” attitude will ensure you are well fit into the energetic and productive fp&a team.

essential criteria

to meet the requirements of the role you must hold tertiary qualifications in accounting, commerce or other finance disciplines with cpa or ca designation preferred. experience at senior levels within health services would be an advantage but not necessary.

benefits

we offer a wide range of benefits such as:

  • work-life balance
  • professional development and career advancement\xa0opportunities
  • salary packaging including novated vehicle leasing
  • onsite fitness clubs
  • culturally safe and respectful environment
  • access to an employee assistance program

culture

at western health, we value our employees and provide them the opportunity to grow and develop.\xa0 our teams are friendly and supportive, ensuring we deliver a safe, person-centred and connected patient experience. western health is an equal opportunity employer committed to attracting and retaining diversity in our workforce. we encourage applications from aboriginal and torres strait islander people.

western health is committed to providing a safe environment for the children and young people who are involved in our services, sites and operations. we follow and abide by all legislative requirements to keep children and young people safe.

all appointments are made subject to a satisfactory police record check, an immunisation status clearance and (if applicable) a working with children’s check.

western health do not accept unsolicited resumes/applications from recruitment agencies



enquiries: jennilyn baquiran
ph: 83457820
position ref: 34704
applications close: 13/05/2019

to view the position description or submit your application, please click the \'apply for this job\' button below.

Title: business analyst practice lead
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">this well known australian brand has embarked on many company-wide initiatives over the past 24 months. there practice has grown rapidly and they are now seeking the services of a suitably experienced business analyst practice lead to partner with another resource to continue to lead and develop a pool of business analysts. this opportunity will be based in melbourne as a permanent opportunity and will require someone who has past experience in leading teams of business analysts. \xa0
\xa0
the successful candidate for this position will have had an extensive career as a senior business analyst and project delivery. previous practice management experience is desirable.
\xa0
key skills and requirements:
  • experience in leading teams of 10+ ba’s
  • prior experience in a practice management role. takes a long term view of developing individuals and has demonstrated success. fosters accountability and provides regular, clear constructive feedback to their team
  • 10+ years ba experience with excellent requirements gathering and strong ability to conduct workshops
  • excellent leadership, motivation and mentoring skills are essential, as well as strong written and verbal communication.
  • ability to build relationships with the business\xa0
  • strong business case development and project initiation skills\xa0
  • experience working with complex operating model and delivery of projects that touch people, process and technology.\xa0
responsibilities:
  • providing knowledge and advice to projects on methodology, tools, activity and progress
  • support the development, implementation and maintenance of ba policy, procedure, methods, processes and tools whilst adhering to bank policy
  • ownership for the development of the team, succession planning and group and individual training plans
  • managing the ba pool and costs as well as managing varying stakeholders
personal characteristics:
  • patience
  • leadership
  • ability to apply fit for purpose solutions
  • strong focus on operations and delivery
  • ability to work in a flat structure
  • willingness to be hands on and flexible
the role offer a fantastic opportunity to lead a growing team. the culture of the organisation is very strong and they provide excellent benefits and a strong work/life balance once you have established yourself.\xa0\xa0
\xa0
\xa0
if this sounds like a suitable position for you then please apply for a confidential discussion.

Title: systems analyst - shared services
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

david jones and the country road group, with their brands country road, trenery, witchery, mimco and politix, form australia's most highly regarded retail group. our ambition is to be global leaders in retail, and to help build this new reality, we are seeking people who are equally passionate in setting a new standard for retail in australia.\xa0 with an exciting vision ahead, embark on a career with a real point of differentiation.

we are looking for an experienced it systems analyst to join our growing information technology team. the primary objective of the role is to analyze and document business and system requirements and work with business stakeholders and it to ensure systems development and implementation meet those requirements.

in this role you will:

  • document current and proposed processes by liaising with a range of people including key business stakeholders, users and technical staff
  • work with the business and it to validate, refine and manage business requirements against project scope
  • migrate business concepts / requirements into detailed requirement specifications
  • work with the business and it to define test strategy and plans
  • work with development teams, it specialists and / or external parties
  • identify the most appropriate solutions and technologies to bring about timely, cost effective systems solutions
  • facilitate the provision of information from existing systems required for the business case development, requirements definition, analysis and implementation planning processes
  • provide subject matter expertise into the change management processes and communications to the business

we are looking for that little bit extra, so join us if you have:

  • an understanding of user needs and a focus on business outcomes
  • previous experience working with corporate it solutions including hr, finance or warehouse management
  • experience with documenting business requirements
  • excellent analytical and research skills with the ability to collect and analyze complex material and data, and present it in accessible formats
  • strong communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with non-technical resources across other business functions

at david jones we go the extra mile.

  • we are a trusted iconic brand
  • we are surrounded by a great team and are inspired to make a difference for our customers
  • we take pride in what we do and recognise our employees efforts for the seamless service and extraordinary experience they provide our customers
  • career progression - there are always opportunities for those with aspirations
  • we pursue excellence and offer ongoing training and development
  • our management team care, they take the time to develop and coach


if you're looking for an extraordinary career, please begin your application now.

Title: applications and database analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
  • full time, until may 2020
  • high performing team
  • $86,648 - $94,276 (plus super and rdo)

\xa0

an opportunity has arisen for an applications and database analyst, with a professional approach and a commitment to excellence of service to join our innovative information technology department at the city of boroondara on a full time basis.

\xa0

your role with us\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0

reporting to the team leader application services, this is an opportunity to provide technical, operational and business support for boroondara\'s corporate applications and databases. providing guidance and support to all council departments in compliance with it standards and organisational policies.

\xa0

about you

to be successful in this role you will need experience providing a high level of application support to internal customers & users, along with providing solid dba skills, such as database management, monitoring and health checks.

a high level of written and verbal communication skills will accompany your strong evaluation, analytical and problem solving skills while working successfully within the department.

to be considered for this role you will need to be certified in itil methodologies and have experience working in 2nd & 3rd level support and solid ms sql server management skills. additional experience in supporting applications, such as, technology one, conquest, sharepoint, k2, microsoft dynamics and objective would be an advantage.

your qualification in business information systems, information technology or similar are desired for this role. this role requires a satisfactory police check.

\xa0

want to know more?

to be considered for this role, please submit your application online via our website, by close of business, sunday 12 may 2019.

\xa0

for any further information please refer to the position description, or contact leon grinszpan on 9278 4366.

\xa0

if you want to know more about the benefits of working for the city of boroondara, please visit our careers website.

\xa0

council recognises the benefits of a diverse workforce for its employees and customers.\xa0 to ensure equity of access to employment opportunities, council encourages applications from underrepresented groups including people who are from an aboriginal and torres strait islander background, people from different ages, abilities, gender identities, sexual orientation and cultural backgrounds. if you require any additional support or adjustments regarding interview arrangements, please advise the contact listed above in advance.

\xa0

applicants must have the right to work in australia. council is a child safe organisation and as such, some applicants may be required to hold a working with children check. additionally, some applicants may also be required to undergo a national criminal history check and/or medical check as per the requirements of the role.

\xa0

who are we?

the city of boroondara is a metropolitan council, representing more than 170,000 people in the inner-eastern suburbs of melbourne. a leader in the local government sector, with a reputation for innovation and excellence, we believe in providing an environment where our staff thrive, both in the work they do and in how they learn and develop as people and professionals.\xa0

we like to challenge the norm and we are investing significantly in innovation and technology improvements in order to provide our customers with an even greater experience and engagement. we are putting our customers at the forefront of what we do with our organisation wide change initiative, the customer experience improvement strategy (ceis).

you will be instrumental in driving this change across the organisation using best practice approaches to successfully support us from the now to our desired future state.\xa0

with so much going on it’s a great time to join boroondara!

Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

Title: business order analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

reporting to the team leader – business order management the business order analyst will take accountability for\xa0business orders from acknowledgement to completion and a proven working service with the end customer. analysts will perform this by taking accountability for individual orders throughout its lifecycle to identify proactive and potential issues impacting delivery and liaising with internal and external resolver groups to clear the way to order completion. the role will require a person with a strong analytical and proactive mindset along with superior levels of customer service and technical expertise when speaking to retail service providers (rsp) or end customers to discuss and resolve delays impacting orders.

some of the key accountabilities of this role include:

  • proactive btd desktop audit activities based on business information capture (bic), such as
    • proactive btd activities (screening/ assessment of order & location information based on business rules)
    • coordinate design and assign (fallout from order fulfilment)
  • identifying opportunities to complete logical activations
  • monitor and identify proactive issues which could result in an order moving to held
  • monitor orders being released from held to ensure successful completion at the next attempt
  • manage repeat truck rolls due to customer delays
  • manage service continuity and activation warranty issues to ensure end customers have a good working service
  • provide input into governance framework and discussions
  • sme input into the documentation of processes and work instructions for the team
  • identification of process improvement opportunities using lean six sigma methods

as this is a new role there will be plenty of opportunities for process improvement\xa0has a culture to work with those on the front line to understand what parts of our processes can be improved, with this in mind an understanding of process improvement methodologies would be beneficial.

key selection criteria:

  • minimum 3 years in a customer service or equivalent customer facing role
  • excellent written and verbal communication
  • excellent customer service and objection handling skills
  • proven ability to influence and engage with customers and get buy in for and common customer related issues
  • prior experience using lean six sigma process improvement strategies
  • strong general business and commercial acumen

  • ability to communicate complex concepts simply

  • experience using microsoft products such as outlook and word

  • strong experience working with microsoft excel

  • ensure processes are effective and efficient
  • root cause analysis of process defects and provide oversight of improvement initiatives
  • sme knowledge of processes and improvement opportunities

Title: business analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

\xa0

from humble beginnings almost 70 years ago, john holland has been driving positive change in australia, and is now one of the nation’s leading infrastructure and property companies.


we work in australia, new zealand and south east asia offering services from infrastructure and property development, to rail and building.

by finding solutions to complex challenges, we transform communities to make them easier to move around, more connected and better to live in.


this position based will be based in either sydney or melbourne and will help find new and more adaptive ways to solve problems and deliver value by providing expert process, data and systems analysis and ideation to john holland’s company wide applications, systems and enterprise data.\xa0 \xa0

\xa0

responsibilities of the role include;
\xa0

  • \xa0understand john holland’s business needs by analysing and defining business processes, systems and data across all business areas to deliver fit-for-purpose solutions
  • \xa0develop and manage relationships with internal business stakeholders, smes & ict colleagues
  • \xa0liaise between john holland business stakeholders/smes and john holland ict colleagues to elicit & validate business requirements
  • translate business requirements into technical requirements, ensuring requirements are documented and clearly articulated to ict colleagues
  • deliver improvements to john holland systems and processes utilising sdlc or agile development methods

\xa0

to be successful in this key role, you must have:

  • minimum 4 years’ experience in business analysis with advanced understanding of business analysis tasks and techniques
  • strong understanding and experience of the full sdlc
  • exposure to agile development methods
  • advanced skills in facilitating workshops
  • experience dealing with business stakeholders/smes across all levels & negotiating outcomes.

\xa0

from parliament house to the alice to darwin rail link, from the mcg’s great southern stand to sydney metro, we’ve had a hand in the australia we all know today. we are currently involved in delivering all of australia’s largest infrastructure projects. whatever we face, the heart of what we do is creating people-centred solutions to complex challenges and opportunities. we think deeply about what we do and how it affects communities. we push boundaries and innovate, gain trust through our actions and whatever the project, we’re in it for the long, long term.

\xa0

we work hard to attract and retain the best employees, and we provide opportunities for rich career experiences, and a strong framework for on-going career development.



.

Title: business analyst | nfp | $105k
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

the company

our client is a not-for-profit organisation that provides multiple products and initiatives which contribute heavily to the development of their specialized sector. the product offerings are constantly pivoting and evolving and as such, an opportunity for a well-rounded business analyst has presented itself. this organisation holds strong values of respect, accountability, collaboration and integrity as well as offering healthy work life balance and flexibility.

the role

reporting directly into the project manager, the role will involve a number of end to end initiatives to build upon an array of products and applications. specifically, the business analyst will;

  • lead the analysis of the ‘as is’ and ‘to be’ of the current environment along with product recommendations upon customizations and improvements.
  • act as the conduit between the business, developers, it and executive stakeholders.
  • develop product specifications, business cases, functional requirements and process & transition models.
  • conduct workshops, surveys and interviews to undercover opportunities.
  • break down complex technical information into simplicity for non-technical stakeholders.
  • manage both internal and external stakeholders’ expectations.
  • understand and define the change impacts throughout the organisation.
  • challenge existing processes and constantly look towards innovation.

your profile

as the successful candidate you will have impressive business analyst foundations with proven experience thriving in differing environments according to projects, people count and industry. you will be able to wear multiple hats with a “can do” attitude. you will have;

  • an ability to translate business needs into technical and functional requirements.
  • have extensive experience in mapping business processes, gathering requirements, facilitating workshops and performing gap analysis & benchmarking.
  • experience working on system implementation projects.
  • excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • a hands-on, can-do approach and the willingness to go above and beyond.
  • excellent verbal and written communication skills including a high level of emotional intelligence
  • a highly collaborative and team orientated attitude.
  • experience in engaging and managing both senior and external stakeholders.
  • be solution driven and comfortable challenging processes.
  • excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

apply today

please send your resume to us by clicking the “apply now” button. resumes in ms word format are preferred.

Title: senior pricing and profitability analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
  • are you competent with developing pricing models in excel and have proven experience in pricing, profitability and market analysis?
  • do you have hands on experience managing product portfolios whilst maintaining excellent relationships with your stakeholders in the superannuation industry?
  • if this sounds like you, we have a great opportunity in our wealth and asset management services team in melbourne

we believe in people with ideas and dreams, and we want you to achieve your aspirations. at nab, we work together to deliver exceptional outcomes that push the limits of expectations. \xa0

our passion about creating value and exceeding our customers' expectations means we're constantly striving to redefine our standards of excellence.

about the role

the senior analyst role is responsible for providing profitability analysis, pricing, advice and support to the corporate superannuation division.

this role is responsible for the following:

  • management of day to day operation of the pricing and profitability sub-division encompassing delivery of tailored platform pricing, profitability analysis and market analysis
  • setting and monitoring assumptions applied in pricing models for business decision making and ensuring pricing model remains compliant with relevant policies
  • supporting the leadership team and other key stakeholders by providing analysis and advice relating to the development of product offers and position strategy for the product portfolio to maintain a range of compelling, profitable, compliant, sustainable and customer-focused market offers
  • be proactive by managing risk, meet all policy and compliance requirements, perform controls, adhere to processes and procedures pertinent to the role, and escalate events, issues or breaches as they are identified.

about you

you will be competent with developing pricing models in excel with proven experience in pricing and profitability analysis gained with the superannuation industry. the ideal candidate will have exemplary stakeholder skills along with 3+ years’ experience (as a guide) working as an analyst, senior analyst or consultant within the superannuation industry. you will be degree-qualified and will have preferably completed post graduate qualification in an investment and/or actuarial discipline e.g. cfa.

to be eligible to apply, you must have australian or new zealand citizenship or permanent residency status.

we embrace diversity of thought, style and working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the community that we serve.

Title: systems analyst - emerging business unit
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

energyaustralia is one of australia's largest energy companies providing smart, innovative energy solutions for our customers. we're in an exciting transformation and are committed to becoming a world-class organisation with the customer at the heart of everything we do.

the management of embedded networks it resources is required to deliver, control and manage the current and future business requirements of the embedded networks business.\xa0

about the role

Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

telstra is one of the most exciting technology companies in australia in which to work. you will be exposed to huge scale and complexity that drives personal growth. our goal is that telstra will have the leading big data and machine learning capabilities in australia. this capability will enable the entire business to transform using data and ai.

the purpose of this role is to provide company-wide technical leadership, and demonstrate the practical application of big data, analytics and machine learning technologies in an enterprise environment.

this will include: leading architectural design, development of technical standards, coaching and solving practical enterprise implementation issues associated high availability, cloud computing, large scale data analytics, security and operations.

the role will ensure telstra is able to leverage leading edge big data and machine learning capabilities to deliver better, more personalised customer experiences, drive process efficiency and deliver on new growth opportunities.

in this role you will provide leadership and ownership of practical working designs using deep technology expertise. provision of technology architecture and implementation services and being the primary domain expert on technologies in areas such as:

•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 hadoop

•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 data integration in a telecommunications environment including working with apis, data streaming, and “platform as a service”

you will ensure consistent application of enterprise standards in the big data domain including: security; system administration / operations management; resiliency; and information management and governance / metadata.

you will lead, and develop, a strong team of data engineers who will work in a wide range of projects across the business.

you will provide strategic advice to telstra’s internal stakeholders and external clients with clear verbal communication of best solutions to meet customer needs balanced with long term cost to serve. we expect you to utilize proven methodologies which balance time to market, risk, and value. ideally you will have proven telecommunications experience and a knowledge of network analytics.

Title: data mangement coordinator newborn services
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about us

western health manages three acute public hospitals: footscray, sunshine and williamstown hospital. it also operates the sunbury day hospital, transition care at hazeldean and a range of community based services. we care for a culturally diverse population of more than 1 million people. we have 7,000 employees who are driven by our values of\xa0‘compassion, accountability, respect, excellence and safety’ (cares).

our continued growth has seen the addition of a new purpose built, multi-storey joan kirner women\'s and children\'s at sunshine hospital.

about the role

the women’s & children’s (w&cs) newborn data management coordinator is a role for a professional clinical facilitator who will provide leadership, planning, delivery and quality assurance activities within newborn services. the role will be responsible for the collection and recording of the required data within the unit and statistics and data entry for the australian and new zealand neonatal network. clinical data quality and integrity, audits and guideline development are also key components of the role.

this is an opportunity to be a part of a team and\xa0share your\xa0skills and knowledge in a family focused, progressive and innovative\xa0neonatal service. \xa0join the team and contribute to the positive change to facilitate our move to the purpose built joan kirner women\'s and children\'s hospital

\xa0

essential skills & experience

  • successful completion of a bachelor of nursing qualification or equivalent
  • registration as a registered nurse/midwife in australia
  • effective organisational skills, with respect to time management and delegation
  • well-developed written and verbal communication skills
  • demonstrated ability to practice collaboratively as part of a multi-disciplinary health care team
  • skills and experience to work in a high dependency special care nursery and nicu
  • post graduate qualification in neonatal intensive care or equivalent
  • demonstrated knowledge and skills in the systems and processes that support patient access and flow in sunshine hospital, western health
  • it skills, including extensive experience using microsoft office suite and clinical information systems (e.g. patient management system, electronic medical record, clinical results viewers etc)
  • an ability to work with people and problem solve
  • a track record in providing education and training to clinical staff.
  • an ability to analyse work processes, striving for improvements that minimise waste and maximise efficiency.
  • demonstrated ability, interest and commitment to participate in audit, quality control and quality improvement activities.
  • understanding of relevant policy / standards in neonatal services including the anznn reporting requirements
  • a broad knowledge of contemporary issues and trends in health information management.

benefits

we offer a wide range of benefits such as:

  • work-life balance
  • professional development and career advancement\xa0opportunities
  • salary packaging including novated vehicle leasing
  • onsite fitness clubs
  • culturally safe and respectful environment
  • access to an employee assistance program

culture

at western health, we value our employees and provide them the opportunity to grow and develop.\xa0 our teams are friendly and supportive, ensuring we deliver a safe, person-centred and connected patient experience. western health is an equal opportunity employer committed to attracting and retaining diversity in our workforce. we encourage applications from aboriginal and torres strait islander people.

western health is committed to providing a safe environment for the children and young people who are involved in our services, sites and operations. we follow and abide by all legislative requirements to keep children and young people safe.

all appointments are made subject to a satisfactory police record check, an immunisation status clearance and (if applicable) a working with children’s check.

western health do not accept unsolicited resumes/applications from recruitment agencies

applications close: 21/05/2019

Title: data reliability engineer
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about xero

at xero, we’re here to make running a business beautiful. by making small business more efficient every day, connecting them with big business technology and empowering a community behind them, their potential is limitless. when that happens, we’re not only helping small business, we’ll be building a stronger economy that can change the world.

a global saas (software as a service) company we have a team of almost 2,000 xeros doing beautiful work across our 17 offices across the globe. we’re ranked no. 1 by forbes as the world\'s most innovative growth company two years running, glassdoor named us one of the top 15 best saas companies in the world, and canstar blue has ranked us australia’s best accounting software company for four consecutive years (2015-2018).

about the role

as a database reliability engineer you will share ownership of data persistence in the following systems: microsoft sql server, postgresql and cloud services such as amazon rds. you will be passionate about resilient systems and want to further your knowledge of database engineering. you will be there for you team to provide on-call support shared with other dres. you will know you have made an impact in your role as you will be able to find ways to automate mundane tasks and create a culture focussed on continually improving the operation of xero’s data persistence technology. you will be helping champion database devops across product teams.

you will also be responsible for:

  • embracing and championing best practices for database safety and performance.
  • contributing to automating every aspect of datastore management that can be automated
  • meeting service level objectives for services in your care
  • collaborating with a wide variety of product team engineers to help them build reliable and scalable services
  • creating scalable alerting and auto remediation systems
  • sharing an on-call rotation backed by all our product teams
  • performing advanced troubleshooting and monitoring of our systems to ensure adequate slo and capacity requirement
  • helping define the tools and philosophies used among the team around deployment, monitoring, testing and security

about you

as xero’s next database reliability engineer you will be passionate about stable and secure systems management practices and be detail oriented and systematic. alongside this you will ideally have varied experience working closely with cross functional delivery teams while also bring to the team:

  • experience managing production databases
  • exposure to working with one or more of microsoft sql server, postgresql, mysql, elasticsearch or cassandra
  • knowledge of, or experience working with “devops” teams
  • comfort with distributed source control including reviewing pull requests
  • the ability to orchestrate and automate administrative tasks
  • experience working with data modelling and data structure design skills
  • familiarity with distributed systems
  • the ability to learn new software, frameworks, open source tools and development languages

xero is an equal opportunity employer. we value diversity, foster innovation and reward success.

if you want to come to work with friends every single day and help to make xero even more special, please apply!

in order for the business to implement dynamics 365, all their data from multiple legacy systems, needs to be analyzed, cleansed and migrated. this has now created a need for a data analyst to be the conduit between the business, it and the solution implementer. as the data analyst, you will play a pivotal role in the implementation of dynamics 365 which includes the configuration of finance, supply chain and field operations modules.

  • assist in development of cutover plans and schedules for trial migrations, dress rehearsals and go-live implementations.

your profile

  • significant experience in etl to dynamics 365 or dynamics ax.
  • experience in migrating existing legacy data to an enterprise solution.
  • experience with databases, t-sql scripting, stored procedures and data models.
  • expertise in developing migration solutions within sql server, ssrs, etl tools, data conversion, data de-duplication and data cleansing.
  • ability to engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders as well as managing their expectations through a migration process.

these guys may be small, but they still make a rumble wherever they go, and their clients love them for the hats they wear – they’re researchers, innovators, analysts and entrepreneurs! \xa0from traditional research to highly bespoke methodologies, quant is what they do best. they help get under the surface with clever analytics and they bring data to life using custom build dashboards, beautifully designed reports and engaging videos.

\xa0

you will be given autonomy from day one, utilising your proven abilities in quant research, to derive actionable insights from research data. you will work with a real mix of clients including in technology, services and retail.

\xa0

from npd to u&a to consumer segmentation to positioning and advertising to brand development, this role will involve a huge amount of variety. as an account manager, you will have input into the whole cycle of quantitative project, this will include taking clients briefs and presenting findings, whilst ensuring the streamlining of all the bits that come between! you will be client facing, ensuring that clients are kept in the loop along every step of the way. you will also be heavily involved in the analysis of data and will prepare the reports that you will be present back to the clients.

\xa0

you must have at least 2 year’s research experience across both ad-hoc and continuous projects. you will also need strong numeracy skills and experience with spss or q. it’s important that you have a keen desire to interact with people at all professional levels as it will be a key part of your job. most importantly, you must have a genuine passion for market research.

\xa0

if the person described sounds like you, please send your details to rowan haylett at resources group: rhaylett@resourcesgroup.com or call 02 9051 9966

reporting into the general manager marketing, you will play a critical role responsible for the overall insights and innovation function. with an industry background in fmcg you will build our data science capabilities and champion the development of advanced analytics and models to drive marketing effectiveness.

Title: research fellow - immersive analytics
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

job no.:\xa0591635

location:\xa0caulfield campus

employment type:\xa0full-time

duration: 3 year fixed-term appointment

remuneration:\xa0$68,040 - $92,343 pa level a / $97,203 - $115,429 pa level b (plus 17% employer superannuation)

  • be inspired, every day
  • drive your own learning at one of the world’s top 80 universities
  • take your career in exciting, rewarding directions

everyone needs a platform to launch a satisfying career. at monash, we give you the space and support to take your career in all kinds of exciting new directions. you’ll have access to quality research, infrastructure and learning facilities, opportunities to collaborate internationally, as well as the grants you’ll need to publish your work. we’re a university full of energetic and enthusiastic minds, driven to challenge what’s expected, expand what we know, and learn from other inspiring, empowering thinkers.

the opportunity

monash university’s faculty of information technology is undergoing a period of significant growth. as part of this growth, our data science and ai group has an opportunity for four outstanding research fellows in our immersive analytics lab.

the ialab, is internationally renowned for its research into information visualisation, accessibility and responsive document layout. led by tim dwyer, this lab consists of academic staff, research programmers, postdoctoral fellows, and phd students. we have a vibrant, collaborative research culture, as well as strong links with local and international industry.

the successful candidates will conduct research in the areas of data visualisation and immersive analytics. you’ll explore theory, frameworks and tools for analysis to support data understanding and decision making.

the successful appointees will have an honours or doctoral qualification, or progress towards a doctoral qualification. a strong background in data visualisation, human-computer interaction, immersive user interfaces and/or user-experience design will also be required.

this role is a full-time position; however, flexible working arrangements may be negotiated.

at monash university, we are committed to being a child safe organisation. some positions at the university will require the incumbent to hold a valid working with children check.

for instructions on how to apply, please refer to “how to apply for monash jobs”.

position description

Title: operations associate
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about billy:

billy uses technology to reimagine the way care is provided to older adults. we make products that make it easier for older adults to live independently, in their own homes, for longer. we have a growing team committed to changing the way that care is provided in australia and around the world (www.billycare.com).

our first product, which launched in australia on may 1st, is a monitoring kit that captures thousands of data points characterising the day-to-day activities which take place in an older adult’s home. we process this data to provide actionable insights for the seniors themselves, their family members, and professional carers. billy passively tracks taking medication, eating meals, waking up in the morning, as well as general movement and ambient conditions around the home.

billy’s services are currently being used by some of the leading health insurers and aged care providers in australia and the us. we are proud to be managing the largest trial of in-home aged care technology anywhere in the world from our office in melbourne and have closed our series-a funding round in july 2018.

\xa0

the role is located in:

we are a small team based in melbourne, with secondary/satellite offices in sydney and ann arbor. this role will be based in melbourne.

\xa0

we are looking for:

our growing business is looking for an enthusiastic and skilled problem solver to join our team. from evaluating new opportunities to driving cross-functional initiatives, the operations team formulates strategic recommendations with actionable insights that help make billy more productive and successful.

the operations associate will support the team on high-priority projects, from analysis to execution. you will be responsible for providing the ultimate operational support from the purchase and setup of billy, to the ongoing support and engagement of our customers, and all the logistics in between. the successful applicant will be a great problem solver, communicator, and influencer.

\xa0

responsibilities - use your skills to:

  • work collaboratively in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment to accelerate billy’s growth

  • participate in a range of operational projects to drive team towards company goals and targets

  • establish and lead operating processes and tools for effectively managing the organization

  • provide insightful data-driven strategic recommendations across our team

  • use cross-functional knowledge and seek to understand issues, trends, and perspectives that may influence the business

  • assist in identifying problematic trends and work towards solutions

  • share the benefits of billy with seniors and their families

\xa0

qualifications - who you are:

  • quick learner, self motivator, and a deep passion for what you do!

  • 2+ years experience in an operational, consulting\xa0or similar role

  • ability to seek information, solve conceptual problems, corral resources and deliver results in challenging situations

  • innovative by nature and ability to devise unique ways to elevate service to our customers

  • hardworking, have a results-driven attitude and go above and beyond to get things done

  • ability to research new tools and problem solving methods is ideal

  • start-up experience is a\xa0plus!

Title: consultant business analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

the business

dog and bone is australia\'s premier independent ict consultancy. our independence enables decision makers to make informed and strategically sound decisions to successfully fulfil their organisation\'s mission.

founded in 2002, we are a growing and dynamic organisation that is looking for enthusiastic people to join our team. our growth is driven by a commitment to ethical business and creating demonstrable value for our clients. we are focused on creating a better world through empowering our clients. these include a wide variety of well-known corporates, government and a focus on the not-for-profit sector, thus, reflecting our strong interest in equality, social justice, and environmental responsibility.

being one of the only bcorp certified ict organisations in australia, we believe in playing a role in corporate social responsibility, helping build a cohesive, tolerant and just society.

the role

the rapid growth of dog and bone has led our consulting project delivery team to seek an additional team member. we are looking for an experienced business analyst with drive and commitment, who wants a rewarding career in it. this role will see you working as part of a team of consultants who are responsible for the delivery of key projects. as a trusted advisor who understands business requirements and holistic solutions, you will work with a range of technologies and it services that support an organisation\'s strategies and workforce to deliver value to an organisation.

the role is designed to gather client business requirements, analyse existing systems and recommend future state solutions based on those needs. you will facilitate meetings and workshops with clients and deliver complex messages in a non-technical way, bridging the gap between business and technology requirements. you will also prepare technical specification documents which clearly identify business needs and contribute to the preparations of reports which include it strategies, rfps and technical reviews.

about you - skills and experience

you share a similar philosophy to our own and have business analyst expertise with at least 4+ years\' experience working in the australian it/ict industry. throughout your experience you have been responsible for collecting, analysing and summarising information and trends and proposing improvements or alternative solutions to systems based on analysis and need.

with an excellent ability to work with business and technical teams, you have gathered business requirements and converted them to user stories and technical requirements, developed workflow charts and diagrams and prepared technical reports. you have excellent report writing and verbal communication skills, including presenting in a clear and concise manner. you are a flexible and adaptable individual who can work autonomously but also collaboratively as part of a team.

job benefits and perks

dog and bone pride ourselves on the diversity of our staff, progressive business practices and commitment to a positive, flexible and family-friendly workplace.\xa0the delivery of high-quality outcomes to our clients is underpinned by a focused and collaborative work environment.

in addition, we also offer:

  • five weeks leave + your birthday off!
  • located in trendy northcote, close to great cafes, shops and close to public transport
  • weekly team lunches
  • fresh fruit and espresso on tap

if this sounds like exactly what you are looking for, please send a current resume and covering letter through the seek link\xa0asap. applications close when we have found the right person!

Title: data engineer
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

in a nutshell…

help us make better decisions by getting our (many) data pipelines flowing smoothly and sensibly into a well-architected warehouse. \xa0bellroy loves to balance art with science; using data to inform and test our theories, and iterating towards truth.

we need your help to \xa0build, improve and maintain the infrastructure required to extract, transform, load and enrich data from a variety of sources. \xa0with your help we’ll be able to get the right info, infer useful things and make better decisions. then test, and keep improving.

when the warehouse is fully functional, you’ll lend your sharp logic to improve internal processes, automate systems, and optimise, well, everything. \xa0and down the track we’d love you to get involved with some bayesian analysis, machine learning and other interesting data team projects.

if you get excited by the idea of providing the right data to inform great decisions; and you want that data to be accessible, understandable and trustworthy, then this could be the job for you. if you bring your experience, smarts and detail-oriented brain to help us, we’ll offer a world-class team to learn from, the tools you need to do your thing, and the support you need to flourish.

\xa0

you could be the one, if…

your logic and reasoning is formidable, as is your determination. you are ordered and decisive, yet creative at the same time. you like things to end up fitting neatly in the boxes; but you don’t mind looking outside of them in the first place to find the answers. you get a kick out of getting things right, and you have the patience to do that every time. because you present your work with pride, knowing you’ve done all you can to make sure it’s correct – and useful.

disorder makes you uncomfortable. with well ordered data in a clean schema, life is good. but you love a challenge more than most other things, so where you see inconsistency or confusion, you also see an opportunity. and you’ll follow that thread until you’re confident you’ve sorted it out. \xa0

you might have been called a “bookworm” more than once in your life, because your curiosity has you forever seeking (and absorbing) information. and nowadays, this natural thirst for knowledge has you constantly looking at ways to improve, optimize and enhance – yourself, your processes, and your data. a bit like a mechanic will with a car, you’ll break apart the whole into pieces you can check and analyse, before rebuilding an idea, process or system into something better.

sound familiar? if so, we’d love to meet you (and that brain of yours).

\xa0

if you were here in the last couple weeks you might have:

  • reviewed our overall data systems (supported by very competent sysadmins) to make sure everything was in order and to look for larger scale improvements
  • built out a handful of new pipelines to bring more of our core business data into our data warehouse
  • chased a handful of data validation alerts raised by our pipelines, and taken the time to get to the root cause of each of them, then either delegated the fix to an appropriate someone else or fixed them yourself
  • suggested an improvement to our a/b testing infrastructure
  • worked outside of data team, with our developers, flexing your database and query optimisation skills to decide whether to fix a performance issue they’re having at the database level, or insist that the fix should be in the code (and, that’s fun - they’re an excellent bunch)
  • provided an ad-hoc analysis (working with our analysts) to someone who requested it, integrating a one-off data source
  • talked with our cio about some of our mid-term plans, and how we’ll support them with data

there are some qualities you must possess:

  • at least three years experience in data-related roles
  • advanced working knowledge of sql and experience in etl using a workflow management tool such as apache airflow
  • experience with building and optimising data pipelines
  • experience with collecting data from a variety of sources including apis (good apis, bad apis, and ugly apis)
  • strong analytical skills and an ability to perform root cause analysis
  • training in computer science, statistics, informatics, information systems or another relevant quantitative field (or demonstrable skill in one of those areas and the story of how you built that skill without formal training)
  • very high precision – you need to know how to verify that your work is correct
  • bonus points for more experience with relevant programming languages (ie. ruby on rails, python, r, scala), postgresql, project management and machine learning.

\xa0

location and hours

this is a full-time role based in our fitzroy office.

start date: we\'re ready when you are!

\xa0

if you\'re ready to apply...

we love receiving applications directly.\xa0please visit this website:\xa0https://grnh.se/9b4b38f31.\xa0you\'ll need your cover letter, resume and to answer\xa0a couple questions.
