    or work remotely from anywhere in australia


headquartered in melbourne, australia, envato is a completely online company with an ecosystem of sites and services to help people get creative. we’ve consistently been named as one of the best places to work in australia, since 2015, in the brw awards, and we’ve also been awarded the title of australia\'s coolest company for women and diversity by jobadvisor.

envato was found in 2006 and, since then, we’ve helped a community of creative sellers earn more than $500 million. millions of people around the world choose our marketplace, studio and courses to buy files, hire freelancers, or learn the skills needed to build websites, videos, apps, graphics and more. find out more at envato market, envato elements, envato sites, envato studio and tuts+.

you might be surprised to know that not only do we run some of the biggest websites in the world; we’re also growing really fast! we have close to 600 staff and contractors worldwide, adding more than 100 people to the business, year on year, since 2017.

what you’ll be doing

in this senior leadership role, you will lead envato’s growing business intelligence/data warehouse team of 10+ whilst also developing and communicating your centralised data platform vision for envato and maintaining the roadmap. you’ll partner with senior stakeholders and delivery teams to continue developing our centralised data platform, looking at ways to innovate and continuously improve. this platform enables multiple analytics teams to build business insights and reporting. you will also be responsible for the operational aspects of the data warehouse.

what we’re looking for

we’re looking for a highly motivated leader, with 5+ years experience leading, coaching and mentoring highly effective data warehouse and data platform teams. we’re going through a period of rapid growth and transformation, so it would be amazing if you had experience working in one, or multiple, fast-growing digital businesses where ongoing planning and frequent re-forecasting is the norm. we’d also love experience with amazon redshift.

your approach to matching work and people is outstanding; you love to focus on getting both the best out of the team and the best result for the business. your excellent planning skills and experience mean that you’re naturally capable of seeing dependencies and driving others to deliver, while maintaining great relationships across the business at all levels. above all else, you have high integrity and align with envato’s values.

as well as developing your team, we’re looking for an individual who is also driven to develop themselves professionally. in this role, you will be surrounded by industry leaders who are passionate about providing you with opportunities to grow your career, innovate and constantly upskill.

technology your team be working with

  • aws cloud services (aws redshift, ec2, s3 etc)
  • sql server
  • microsoft visual studio
  • gathering data via api’s from cloud based data sources
  • tableau
  • google cloud platform tools (bigquery, google analytics, adwords)

what we offer

  • a fantastic culture of creatively minded, hard working people who are passionate about envato and being part of its growth and success
  • flexible working conditions – we want you to love your work but also your life outside of envato
  • our preference is to hire this role in our melbourne cbd office, with optional flexibility to work from home some days, but we are also happy to consider applications from people\xa0who would like to work remotely (australia wide)
  • we actively work on creating a safe, inclusive environment free from discrimination
  • a fast paced and progressive environment where everyone has regular interaction with teammates and envato community members from all over the world!
  • read more from our staff about why they love working at envato by visiting www.jobadvisor.com.au/envato

who should apply?

we care deeply about diversity at envato, and welcome applicants of all types, and from all backgrounds. if you think you have the skills and experience needed for this role then we\'d like to hear from you.

what next?

submit a cover letter, an up to date copy of your resume and answers to the below questions. good luck!

Title: senior intelligence analyst
Company: australian transaction reports and analysis centre (austrac
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about us

austrac is australia\'s financial intelligence agency with regulatory responsibility for anti-money laundering and counter-terrorism financing.

we identify threats and criminal abuse of the financial system, and act to protect australia\'s economy.

we also work in partnership with industry and government agencies in australia and overseas to -

  • help keep australia safe from financial and other serious crime
  • build and maintain trust in australia\'s financial system as part of the global community.

\xa0\xa0

\xa0

about the role

the senior intelligence analyst under limited direction is responsible for information collection, data extraction, collation and analysis of austrac data and other information. the role involves initiating, producing and coordinating high quality intelligence assessments, making recommendations and contributing towards the development of analytic methodologies. in addition, the role will involve working closely with stakeholders on project work and influencing partners to develop actionable intelligence.

\xa0

this role will suit someone who thrives working under limited direction, demonstrates experience in intelligence environments and the ability to carry out complex intelligence projects involving research and analysis, high-level problem solving and the formation of sound judgements.

\xa0

the skill sets required to be successful in this role include highly developed oral and written communication skills and the ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships. your ability to contribute strongly to strategic thinking to maximise work linkages and opportunities will be highly regarded.

\xa0


where to next

these roles presents an exciting opportunity to raise awareness of austrac’s vital role in protecting the australian community from money laundering, financial fraud and terrorism funding. \xa0the selection process now starts with you! \xa0if you’re intrigued by the opportunities austrac and this role presents, then find out more at our website.

Title: asset information specialist
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">metro trains melbourne (mtm) operate and maintain melbourne’s metropolitan train network. successfully transporting over 400,000 passengers per day is achieved by our large dedicated workforce. above all, at metro we are passionate about safety and working as a team. all employees are instrumental in driving a ‘zero harm’ and ‘one team, one metro’ mindset that is so critical to the continued success of an essential service to melbourne.

the position

as the asset information specialist, you will be responsible for the development, publication and implementation of the asset information strategy, and associated improvement program.\xa0 this role is part of the strategic asset management team.\xa0 the role will include:

•\xa0engaging with various internal stakeholders to compile stakeholder requirements
•\xa0synthesise an improvement strategy taking into account competing interests, contractual requirements, and practical improvement opportunities
•\xa0publishing an update to the asset information strategy, endorsed by various stakeholders
•\xa0developing a long term improvement roadmap, to support our strategic asset management vision
•\xa0supporting our iso 55001 asset management certification by identifying improvements in our asset information management
•\xa0supporting our asset management excellence journey by making improvement recommendations for developing: asset information standards, systems, and data management

requirements

you will have experience in system administration of asset intensive information systems.\xa0 ideally, you would have expertise in ellipse (or equivalent cmms) and developed strategic asset data quality improvement programs.\xa0 experience in developing an asset information strategy is essential.\xa0 having asset data quality management experience, such as iso55001 or iso9001 (or similar), coupled with a background in data science, is desirable.

relevant tertiary qualification in an area such as data science, computer science/systems, engineering discipline, or equivalent is essential.\xa0 experience in asset data management in transport, logistics, or similar asset intensive industry is highly desirable.

benefits\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0
\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0
•\xa0all metro employees receive a free myki pass that allows free public transport in victoria
•\xa0metro supports work/life balance with opportunities to work from home on occasion
•\xa0melbourne is currently home to the largest rail infrastructure projects in australia that will boast long term employment and future career opportunities

ready to apply?

please submit your application by clicking ‘apply now’ or if you have any queries, please contact kyle maclean (talent acquisition partner) – kyle.maclean@metrotrains.com.au

metro trains is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity. we encourage all interested applicants to apply but only applications with the right to live and work in australia will be considered for this position.

Title: sap sd & le analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about orora

our name may not be instantly recognisable, but chances are, our packaging touches your life every day! from cartons, bottles & cans through to innovative point of purchase displays and recycling solutions, we help our customers package and present their products for maximum appeal to you, the consumer. whilst we are amongst the world leaders in containing everything from washing powder to wine there is one thing we will never want to contain… you and your passion!

about the role

we’re looking to hire an sap sd & le analyst, on a 12 month fixed-term contract, to join our it team in hawthorn. this role will report directly to the it service manager- supply chain and be responsible for supporting sap le (logistics execution) and sd (sales and distribution) dealing mainly with supply chain and manufacturing stakeholders and it services.

what will this role involve?

  • working on production support and projects
  • analysing business requirements
  • assessing impact of new requirements or changes
  • proposing solutions based on sap best practises
  • effort estimation, as-is, to-be, gap analysis, process mapping etc.
  • sap configuration and proof of concepts/prototyping
  • developing specifications for the development team
  • creation of test scripts and unit testing
  • training, documentation and supporting end-users
  • resolution of bau issues (incidents, monitoring errors etc.)

what are the major challenges & complexities of this role?

  • managing support tickets in line with tight slas
  • work on projects that may have competing priorities and timelines
  • encouraging users to adopt standard / best business practices
  • engaging the business to optimise system functionality
  • interfaces and integration to non-sap systems that interact with sap

about you

what will you need to be successful in this role?

  • minimum 5 to 7 years’ hands-on support and project implementation experience in sap sd (sales & distribution) and sap le (logistics execution) modules
  • sap sd experience including pricing, quotations, sales order flow, variant configuration, shipping, billing/invoicing, rebates, fi-sd integration, idoc interfaces etc.
  • sap le experience including inbound, outbound processes and shipment costing
  • knowledge of \xa0sap wm (warehouse management) internal warehouse processes desirable
  • strong knowledge on master data related to these modules
  • domain knowledge in the supply chain space is a plus
  • ability to have a consultative, collaborative and proactive approach
  • excellent analytical and problem solving skills
  • strong written and verbal communication skills
  • self-motivated and ability to work with team members across the organisation

interested?

if you know this sounds like the right move for you then please send us your details via the apply button. we also invite enquiries from individuals who may not necessarily be actively looking for their next role, but could be tempted if the right opportunity came up. this could be it…so feel free to call us for a confidential chat.


contact:\xa0 \xa0annik pearson on +61 3 9730 5451 or annik.pearson@ororagroup.com

interested candidates are informed that no recruitment agencies have been briefed on this role. your best means of applying is to orora directly.

whilst we recognise the value of recruitment agencies we won’t be accepting introductions from third parties on this occasion so thanks in advance for letting us get on with it!

\xa0

Title: ict procurement analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

\xa0

from humble beginnings almost 70 years ago, john holland has been driving positive change in australia, and is now one of the nation’s leading infrastructure and property companies.


we work in australia, new zealand and south east asia offering services from infrastructure and property development, to rail and building.
\xa0

responsible for the day to day management of the sourcing of ict hardware, software and telecommunication assets from external suppliers in a professional and competent manner such that it can provide a high level of service to the group. typically this involves reviewing and processing requests received through the servicenow portal for these assets, supporting the sourcing manager in any contract reviews, raising purchase requisitions and following up with the supplier as required.

\xa0

responsibilities of the role include;

  • support the strategic sourcing strategy by:
    • engaging with stakehlders and your team members to identify areas of potential improvement in ict sourcing
    • management f all ict procurement including purchasing ict assets, creating purchase orders, tracking and receipting of deliveries and cost allocations in accordance to the budget and group policy
    • participate in supplier perfrmance meetings and assist in the day to day management of key suppliers
  • monitor, follow up and advise users on the progress of outstanding requests logged into the services request database
  • liaise with suppliers to ensure sla’s are met

\xa0

to be successful in this key role, you must have:

  • \xa0\xad \xa0 \xa0 \xa0\xa0 experience in managing diverse and dispersed customers (3+ years).
  • \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xad\xa0\xa0 demonstrated information management competency
  • \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0excellent communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • \xad \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xadexperience in project based and corporate ict supplier management will be highly regarded
  • \xa0 \xa0\xa0 \xad \xa0\xa0 good working knowledge of interpreting and delivering technology-based contractual obligations

\xad \xa0\xa0

john holland is up for the challenge of transforming lives.

\xa0

from parliament house to the alice to darwin rail link, from the mcg’s great southern stand to sydney metro, we’ve had a hand in the australia we all know today. we are currently involved in delivering all of australia’s largest infrastructure projects. whatever we face, the heart of what we do is creating people-centred solutions to complex challenges and opportunities. we think deeply about what we do and how it affects communities. we push boundaries and innovate, gain trust through our actions and whatever the project, we’re in it for the long, long term.
\xa0

we work hard to attract and retain the best employees, and we provide opportunities for rich career experiences, and a strong framework for on-going career development.

div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

client details

be part of a proven culture of success within one of the world\'s most recognisable brands. with a culture of work-life balance and achieving team based success, this is the perfect place to up-skill and accelerate your career growth.

as pioneers in full scale automation of businesses using machine learning, ai and innovative technologies, this is an extremely unique team to be a part of. constant up-skilling and refinement of knowledge is paramount to the continued retention and growth of the team.

description

design and deliver solutions that align the business strategy, insight needs, information flows and functional structure of the organization to provide the required outcomes encompassing analytics, process excellence and business transformation.

you will proactively:

profile

a sound understanding of digital technologies, analytics, information management and business process based solutions and the application of such solutions to deliver new business capabilities.

you will have a proven ability to:

  • define the value chain and competitive environment of a client’s business
  • develop the business case for investment in capabilities including the identification and quantification of business benefits
  • explore and document client needs into functional and non-functional requirements
  • design complex business customer journey’s, processes and workflows that incorporate analytic, process excellence and business transformation outputs
  • conduct complex analysis and structured problem solving, resulting in pragmatic and executable recommendations to clients
  • define business policies and rule associated with insight-driven decisioning solutions
  • ideate and validate business initiatives
  • bridge the gap between technology and business environments

job offer

Title: research fellow in medical data mining
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

job no: 0048228

work type: fixed term

location: parkville

division/faculty: melbourne school of engineering

department/school: school of computing and information systems

role & superannuation rate: academic - full time - 9.5% super

salary: the appointment for this position will be either at a level a research fellow ($89,251- $95,800 p.a) or a level b research fellow ($100,849 - $119,753 p.a), commensurate with experience relevant to the role, plus 9.5% superannuation.

the opportunity

we seek a research fellow for a two-year appointment with expertise in computational algorithms, machine learning driven analytics and advanced data mining approaches for medical and health data. you will be working closely with other researchers in biomedical datamining projects, in particular in the analysis of electronic healthcare records. the research group works closely with the faculty of medicine, dentistry and health sciences (mdhs), as data has enormous potential to improve public health and lead to improved patient outcomes. today, it is perhaps one of the greatest forces driving transformations in the way we predict, prevent, detect and manage disease. as australia’s healthcare system moves towards the systematic integration of digital health records, it is particularly important that we invest in our capabilities in order to maximise the potential of data to improve healthcare. exciting times ahead in the school of computing and information systems!

this position provides an opportunity for an emerging researcher to build their research career. this is a unique opportunity to engage with a strongly collaborative partners, mdhs and hospitals, that have a history of translating innovative research into impactful solutions, as well as to gain supervision and organisational experience.

about you

with a phd in computer science or a closely related discipline, you have a strong record of achievement in research and associated publications in high-quality journals, conferences, technical reports or other scholarly publications.\xa0 in your career to date you have demonstrated the ability to perform independent research and communicate complex concepts to technical and non-technical audiences alike.

application process

please apply online with your resume and cover letter.

about melbourne school of engineering (mse)

at mse, we are committed to excellence.\xa0 we are transforming our engineering and it teaching as well as research at the university of melbourne guided by mse 2025, our ten-year strategic plan.\xa0 with an expected investment of $1 billion in people and infrastructure, we are creating the entrepreneurial leaders and technology of the future — the people and things that will drive innovation and productivity to make a sustainable impact on the world in which we live.\xa0 it’s an incredibly exciting time to be joining mse!

school of computing & information systems (cis)

cis undertakes research and teaching\xa0across a range of information technology disciplines including software engineering, information systems, and computer science. it offers a comprehensive range of it courses at all levels, including offerings in science, engineering, and business, and is at the forefront of computing research in australia and internationally with close links to major computing research initiatives, including melbourne bioinformatics, ibm research, the arc training centre in cognitive for medical technologies, the microsoft research centre for social natural user interfaces (snui), and data61 (formerly nicta).\xa0 the school’s aim is to attract and retain outstanding staff available in order to maintain a leading research and teaching. we have an existing highly successful research team in the area of the appointment, a large number of phd students, and a substantial cohort of graduate students in our coursework master programs.

to find out more about cis, visit: http://www.cis.unimelb.edu.au/

\xa0what we offer you

apart from competitive salaries, our benefits are aimed at recognising and rewarding the contributions you make. \xa0we offer complete flexibility, whatever that may mean for you. \xa0many of our benefit programs and onsite amenities are aimed at supporting you - including generous leave, child care subsidies, discounted parking, medical and health care. \xa0we offer extensive opportunities for personal and professional development and we’ll support you in doing what you love.

about the university of melbourne

the university of melbourne is consistently ranked among the leading universities in the world, at number 1 in australia and number 32 in the world (times higher education world university rankings 2017-2018). \xa0we are globally engaged, comprehensive, research-intensive and committed to respond to the major social, economic and environmental challenges of our time.

while we review your application, find out more about mse by visiting http://www.eng.unimelb.edu.au/about/join-mse/why-join-mse

Title: invoicing coordinator/ar
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about the business

the rimoptics group is a leading independent optical wholesaler, established in melbourne in 1981. \xa0we sell eyewear to retailers across australia, operating out of our head office in hampton east, melbourne. \xa0for almost 40 years we have specialised in importing and distributing quality, affordable eyeglasses to independent optometrists and optical retailers, priding ourselves on our customer-centric service and ethos.

about the role

this customer-focused role reports directly to the office manager and will be responsible for invoicing of all customer orders as well as related functions concerned with customer purchases.\xa0 this candidate will also resolve any outstanding queries to ensure prompt payment is received. in addition, this role involves accounts receivable duties such as processing customer payments, and other general customer service tasks.

key responsibilities:

  • daily invoicing of customer orders
  • data entry and account maintenance regarding consignment stock
  • ar duties such as processing customer cheque and card payments
  • data entry relating to stock items (receipting product shipments)
  • customer service duties via telephone (e.g. resolving customer account queries)
  • processing consignment stock returns
  • generating sales reports for management and sales team - various daily, weekly and\xa0monthly reports
  • ad-hoc administrative tasks such as filing, scanning and archiving
  • ad-hoc customer service tasks such as assisting with inbound calls when required (infrequent)

benefits and perks

  • flexible working days/times/hours - permanent part-time role of 20 to 25 hours per week
  • full on-site training provided for all aspects of this role
  • friendly &\xa0productive team and working environment
  • conveniently located for se-suburbs residents
  • our premises are located opposite moorabbin train station
  • all-day free staff parking available on-site

skills and experience

  • proficiency\xa0in relevant computer applications is highly desirable; attache bi, microsoft office (mainly excel and outlook)
  • particular attention to detail and high level of accuracy
  • analytical problem solving skills
  • ability to multi-task and prioritise work-load
  • client-friendly phone manner

\xa0

  • strong administration experience in an office environment is essential
  • previous employment in invoicing is highly desirable\xa0

\xa0

to be considered for this role, please\xa0send your application online through "apply for this job" button.

this role needs to be filled asap.\xa0 interviews\xa0to be conducted commencing wednesday 15th may 2019.

only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: emr clinical analyst (technical
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">box hill hospital
temporary full time

emr clinical analyst (technical)

\xa0

\xa0

eastern health is one of melbourne’s largest public health services. we provide a range of emergency, surgical, medical and general healthcare services, including maternity, palliative care, mental health, drug and alcohol, residential care, community health and statewide specialist services to people and communities that are diverse in culture, age, socio-economic status, population and healthcare needs.

\xa0

the emr clinical analyst (technical) is responsible for providing expert knowledge, support and advice to the electronic medical record (emr) team and key stakeholders whilst working in a multi-skill, multidisciplinary support team. this role assists in configuration, build, data analysis, testing, cti accounts security maintenance and management, reporting activities required for emr clinical applications.

\xa0

the emr clinical analyst (technical) is able to analyse and review data related to inbound and outbound messaging for troubleshooting emr incidents and service requests, and as such is a key contact between the emr and eh ict. in addition, this position is involved in supporting, maintaining, testing (end to end and regression), and facilitating communications and changes for the clinical end users of the emr at eastern health.\xa0

\xa0

this position will initially be involved with the testing and project deliverables for uploading documentation and results to the my health record via the emr

\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

to be successful in this role you should possess:

\xa0

  • an understanding of clinical workflows in both inpatient and outpatient settings and administration workflows.
  • hands on experience with cerner application will be highly regarded
  • strong customer focus and analytical skills with attention to detail
  • a commitment to quality and excellence.
  • demonstrated ability to work in a team on related clinical applications project tasks.
  • experience or understanding of integration messaging (for example hl7) between clinical applications
  • ability to work both independently and in a complex team environment; collaborate with external and internal professionals and other customers.
  • ability to manage multiple tasks with ease and efficiency.
  • proven ability to influence and manage change.
  • skills in prioritisation, problem solving, organization, decision-making, time management, and planning.
  • proven ability to use initiative, identify, solve problems and when required escalate issues with relevant internal and external parties.
  • proven ability to forward plan, establish and complete targets.
  • proven communication skills; able to communicate effectively with all levels of personnel within the organization.
  • personal maturity and experience in dealing effectively with competing priorities.
  • ability to work effectively with end-users, technical staff and management in a hospital setting.
  • advanced knowledge in use of ms excel
  • commitment to eastern health values
  • experience in design, and troubleshooting\xa0cerner applications.

\xa0

\xa0

eastern health offers a variety of fantastic employee benefits, view the extensive range\xa0here!

the benefits of working for eastern health include:

  • diverse and engaging career opportunities
  • friendly & supportive\xa0team
  • flexible working hours
  • salary packaging options
  • career progression in our teaching hospitals

\xa0

\xa0

if you have the ability and drive to make a difference take hold of this opportunity and\xa0apply today!

for full details refer to the attached position description and direct all enquiries to the contact person listed.

\xa0

all appointments are made subject to a satisfactory police records check.

\xa0

you must have the right to permanently live and work in australia to apply for this job.

please submit all applications online.

recruitment agency applications will not be accepted.

Title: data engineer
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about the company

global insurer with over 80,000 employees across 190 locations with annual revenues in excess of $20b aud. board level commitment to affecting enduring change within the insurance industry that puts members truly at the centre of outcomes. first class leadership team with a proven track record in successfully delivering large transformational change accompanied by a robust balance sheet and board level commitment.

about the role

reporting to the head of data engineering, the data engineer role is responsible for the design, build and run of data pipelines to efficiently and reliably move data (both operational structured and behavioural unstructured, and in both batch and real-time modes) from primary source systems to the big data platform; the configuration, customisation and integration of data components to deliver and operationally run the big data platform; and, the operationalisation of predictive models/ machine learning algorithms in the big data platform.

duties

  • develop, maintain, test and evaluate large-scale data processing solutions (batch & real-time modes)
  • assess, select and integrate any data tools, components or frameworks required to deliver the requirements of the business
  • operationalise predictive models/machine learning algorithms in the data platform.
  • implement etl processes where required

skills & experience

  • proficiency (3+ years') in understanding big data platforms and extensive experience in working within a data warehouse environment.
  • proficiency in the use of ms azure's data services in the cloud (or aws equivalent)
  • 3+ years' experience working across sql, power bi and ssis
  • experience with big data softwear tools such as hadoop, kafka, spark and python.
  • natural self-starter with action orientation and willingness to "roll up sleeves" as needed in support of a "lean" project approach.

how to apply\xa0

for more information please click on the apply button below or contact jonathan bell on 03 9918 0981 and quote reference no.512768

Title: imaging & data
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

\xa0

gfp group is the market leader in graduation services with over 40 years of experience in australia and is growing through the asia pacific region. gfp has evolved to specialise in photography services, merchandise services and academic dress. gfp currently operates within maternity hospitals, schools, universities and tertiary institutions throughout australia and asia.

this is a fantastic opportunity to join us at gfp in the imaging and data department and become a valuable team member. you will need to be pro-active, have a spark for detail and enjoy working within a team environment. in return we will offer a great working environment, training, hands on support, and a cake on your birthday!

this role will include the following responsibilities –

  • receiving large quantities of image data from interstate and international jobs
  • backing up data to appropriate server locations
  • quality control of work received
  • editing of images using specialist software such as photoshop and bridge/camera raw (colour correction, sharpening, cropping, etc)
  • upload work to online portals
  • monitor incoming jobs and manage time effectively to ensure work is done within time constraints stipulated in contracts with clients

Title: pricing analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
  • are you up for an adventure which guarantees to drive and push you to your limits?
  • are you ready to challenge everything and use analytics to drive your decisions?
  • do you want to be part of australia’s e-commerce future?


we\'re on the hunt for an exceptional pricing analyst who is ready to take on a challenging and rewarding position in an asx listed and high-growth, australian success story. the successful candidate will be given the autonomy to make this role their own, grow and develop in line with the company.

\xa0

our import and buying teams play a crucial role in our business. they source the best quality products to ensuring that we have the latest and most in-demand products available and ready to delight customers.

as pricing analyst you will be responsible for working within kogan.com’s exclusive brands/private label team and play an integral part of the team that ensure we have the quality and value products in the market - after all, this is how our business started!

\xa0

the role

  • develop, maintain and action various pricing strategies to achieve maximum profitability of exclusive brands products
  • specify, build and implement\xa0 pricing models to meet business needs, including the development of new approaches and techniques
  • utilise price analysis, price elasticity, margin analysis, market data, competitor analysis and other tools to demonstrate positive p&l impact of pricing initiatives
  • ensure that pricing, stock levels, discounts, products presentation and other aspects are accurate\xa0 for edms and other promotional channels
  • build and actively manage internal relationships with all stakeholders such as category managers, marketing team and others
  • understand all significant competitors, their pricing strategies, their products, ranging strategies and promotional cycles, and ensuring this knowledge stays current and updated
  • make sure all price changes are urgently actioned and effectively communicated through all channels\xa0
  • conduct aged inventory audit and action the necessary steps to minimise aged stock, including pricing and promotional campaign recommendations

\xa0

in order to join the team, you’ll be/have:

  • previous extensive success in a highly commercial role in retail (or similar) industry
  • bonus points if you’ve had exposure to private label products and marketing before
  • previous track record in recommending and implementing pricing strategy with a focus on maximising revenue and profitability
  • university degree qualified in a relevant field (commerce, analytics, maths, accounting, marketing, buying, etc)
  • highly analytical and ready to delve into data
  • excellent commercial and business acumen to make key commercially savvy decisions
  • a multi-tasking ninja - we expect you to juggle 50 different tasks at once without dropping the ball (we’re not kidding)
  • a whiz with microsoft excel (we’re talking vlookup, index matching, pivot tables, advanced formulas, macros - and we will test your capabilities)
  • tech savvy and ability to use various it and cloud-based tools to improve efficiency and productivity
  • ready to challenge, be challenged, and work within our highly disruptive business model

to be considered and apply for the role please apply via: https://hire.withgoogle.com/public/jobs/kogancomau/view/p_aaaaabmaaakcxwgmmedhs2

think you have what it takes to be part of team kogan.com?

upload your cv and a cover letter outlining why you want to work for us! generic cover letters don\'t cut it here. make it personal and highly specific to the role.

\xa0
about us

we’re kogan.com - pioneers of australian e-commerce.

\xa0

we were born in a south-eastern suburb melbourne garage in 2006 from a young entrepreneur\'s idea to revolutionise the supply-chain to make the latest products more affordable. now, we’re the largest australian pure-play online retail website with hundreds of thousands of visitors each day and a customer base of over a million aussie shoppers.\xa0

\xa0

our success is built off technology and digital efficiency to make the most in-demand products and services more affordable and accessible for all australians.\xa0

\xa0

in our team, we thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, high-performance culture where we work hard and play harder. we aren’t afraid of change, we embrace it.

\xa0

we love being pushed outside our comfort zone and being challenged to continuously deliver the best value to our customers and that sets us apart from the rest.

---

\xa0\xa0

heads up!

  • kogan.com is a fast-paced business - our vacancy close dates are subject to change. we will assess applications as they are received, so don\'t wait to apply!
  • all new kogan.com team members are required to undergo a national police record check and must have full-time australian working rights on an ongoing basis.

Title: analyst - transition, it
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">company description:

orica is the world’s largest provider of commercial explosives and innovative blasting systems to the mining, quarrying, oil and gas and construction markets, a leading supplier of sodium cyanide for gold extraction, and a specialist provider of ground support services in mining and tunnelling.

our purpose is to make our customers successful, every day, all around the world. we take pride in operating safely, responsibly and sustainably. together, these enable us to grow and create enduring value for our shareholders.

founded in 1874, orica has more than 140 years of experience and investment in innovation. we are the global leader in mining and civil services, with a diverse workforce of around 11,500 employees, servicing customers across more than 100 countries. orica is listed on the australian securities exchange (asx: ori).



job description:

\xa0

\xa0

orica is the world’s largest provider of commercial explosives and innovative blasting systems to the mining, quarrying, oil and gas and construction markets, a leading supplier of sodium cyanide for gold extraction, and a specialist provider of ground support services in mining and tunnelling.orica has a diverse workforce of around 11,500 employees and contractors, servicing customers across more than 100 countries. our purpose is to make our customers successful, every day, all around the world. we take pride in operating safely, responsibly and sustainably. together, these enable us to grow and create enduring value for our shareholders.

\xa0

about the role

\xa0

\xa0

the analyst, transition, it is accountable for working with the it testing and transition lead and it project management lead to plan and execute transition to support activities as part of the project delivery lifecycle and maintain a transition environment that allows for it solutions to be transitioned with the required integrity, quality and stability to a productive and operational state.\xa0

\xa0

what you will be doing

\xa0

\xa0

it transition processes and tools\xa0

  • work with the it testing and transition lead to establish and maintain it transition standards, processes and toolsets.\xa0
  • work with the it project management lead to ensure programs and projects adhere to and use it transition standards, processes and toolsets for transition planning.\xa0
  • working with it application, infrastructure and project teams, maintain workable transition environments.\xa0


it transition execution\xa0

  • work with the it testing and transition lead and it project management lead to identify and plan transition activities required to move from the project to operational environment.\xa0
  • includes activities covering solution readiness, cutover readiness, support readiness and business readiness.\xa0
  • with the direction of the it testing and transition lead and it project management lead, execute it transition activities to the agreed plan.\xa0
  • provide expertise to help expedite decision making if issues are encountered when executing transition. \xa0
  • work with the it testing and transition lead to monitor and report status and adherence of it programs and projects going through the transition process.\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

what we offer

\xa0

\xa0

  • the opportunities, facilities and environment associated with working in an international organisation;
  • career paths that are totally flexible allowing you to specialise or become a generalist;
  • a\xa0diverse workplace where your unique abilities and talents will be recognised and encouraged;
  • training programs, opportunities and initiatives to ensure your continued growth;
  • competitive salary packages.


seeked profile:

\xa0

  • tertiary qualified, preferably in an it-related discipline.\xa0
  • 3+ years of experience in an it transition analyst role.\xa0
  • 3+ years of experience with waterfall and agile implementation approaches.\xa0
  • strong analytical and problem-solving skills.\xa0
  • experience across a broad range of it application and infrastructure technologies, including operational aspects.\xa0
  • strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate across all levels of an organisation.\xa0
  • strong stakeholder-engagement and customer-facing skills and experience, with the ability to understand requirements, manage expectations and maintain strong working relationships.\xa0

we’re nab

for more than 150 years, we’ve been helping our customers with their money. today, we have more than 33,000 people serving 10 million customers at more than 800 locations in australia, new zealand and around the world.

we have built our business on understanding our customers and supporting them. as australia’s largest business bank, we work with small, medium and large businesses to help them start, run and grow. we also fund some of the most important infrastructure in our communities – including schools, hospitals and roads.

more than money

we know that to be australia and new zealand’s most respected bank, we need to be more than good with money. we need to be just as good with people, too.

about the role

reporting to the delivery lead, the role of senior associate performance management delivery superannuation will be responsible for the provision of accurate and valuable financial data, analysis and be able to provide advice to the business on the use and interpretation of the financial data and outputs. you will work flexibly and collaboratively with other teams to ensure that the function overall within the region operates in a smooth manner.

accountabilities

in this challenging and pivotal role, your key responsibilities include:

  • provision of accurate and valuable financial data, analysis and able to give advice to the business on use and interpretation of outputs;
  • review, document and improve current procedures, continually assessing the quality of processes provided to internal/external stakeholders and assisting with developing proposed processes;
  • development and support of processes and reporting solutions to ensure timely and accurate delivery of data;
  • act as a point of contact for business unit partners resolving or escalating query/problem solutions;\xa0
  • testing/implementation of complex bau developments/changes;
  • able to analyse data to ensure overall integrity and compliance with regulatory and legislative requirements in the best interest of the member;
  • ensure processes keep up with changes in business rules, structures and operations;
  • ensure consistency of approach is adopted across the team;
  • work flexibly and supportively with finance colleagues both within own bu/ function and outside to ensure that the function overall within the region operates in a smooth manner;\xa0
  • provide professional and ethical behaviour in your actions by ensuring compliance with external legislation, bank standards and internal operating policies and procedures relevant to the position;
  • ensure all personal training records are maintained and kept up to date;
  • show leadership, e.g. coaching, monitoring, supervision of team members to ensure they have the skills and knowledge to perform their role to be compliant with fsra requirements and external legislation in a professional & ethical manner;
  • to conform with all internal operating policies and procedures relevant to the position;
  • expected to drive improvements and changes across the finance function;
  • expected to keep up with changes affecting our industry to continually improve knowledge and business acumen and the information is used to drive development;
  • value adding analysis and providing insights to internal and external stakeholders;

skills and experience

you will be customer focused, outcome driven and be inquisitive by nature. your demonstrated experience working in a similar financial accountant role in a large matrix organisation, ideally within financial services sector along with previous experience working in a professional accounting firm will ensure your success in this position. you will have extensive knowledge and understanding of financial control and preferably experience across statutory, regulatory, financial and/or management reporting along with strong critical thinking and problem-solving abilities. you will have a relevant tertiary qualification in business, commence, accounting or finance coupled with a post graduate qualification (ca / cpa) is required for this role. advanced excel skills (and/or automation skills) are highly desirable.

\xa0culture

we believe in people with ideas and dreams, and we want you to achieve your aspirations. at nab we work together to deliver exceptional outcomes that push the limits of expectations. our passion about creating value and exceeding our customers' expectations means we're constantly striving to redefine our standards of excellence.

benefits

at nab, we provide access to a large number of exclusive employee benefits that will support you both personally and professionally. these include volunteer leave, education and learning benefits and banking & financial services discounts for example. visit our benefits page for more information http://www.nab.com.au/about-us/careers/working-at-nab/benefits

how to apply

if you are ready to take the next step in your career, we are keen to hear from you!

please note, candidate screening and interviews may take place prior to the advertised close date.

to be eligible to apply, you must have australian or new zealand citizenship or permanent residency status. please apply via the link.

we embrace diversity of thought, style and working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the community that we serve.

Title: senior analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">headquartered in melbourne, our client is a disruptive financial technology company with a global footprint. consumer-focused across a multitude of industries, it is a well established fintech which prides itself on innovation and agility. given its steep upward trajectory and projected growth, now is an incredible time to join this exciting organisation.

the role

in a fast-paced and constantly evolving environment, the role of senior analyst\xa0is key to the fp&a team. reporting to the group head of fp&a, you will be responsible for providing key insights and analysis into business performance and working with the broader financial performance team to drive improved performance across the group.

duties & responsibilities
  • perform critical and in-depth financial analysis on weekly and monthly financial results across the group, identifying and assessing underlying trends in the business
  • prepare financial models and scenario analysis; work with the fp&a reporting manager to provide key insights into financial performance to inform the annual budget and quarterly forecast
  • perform due diligence on business cases to drive performance; work with the finance business partners to develop robust business cases and profitability assessments
  • support the fp&a reporting manager to produce insightful standardised weekly and monthly reporting
  • partner with the broader finance team to ensure best practice reporting and analysis processes are in place

experience & expertise\xa0
to be considered for this exceptional opportunity, you will have:
  • highly developed analytical skills and excellent financial modelling skills
  • exceptional commercial and financial acumen and insights, including the ability to identify trends and value drivers in financial data
  • good judgment, insight and in-depth knowledge of industry/markets, competition, products and key trends
  • a demonstrated history of successful stakeholder engagement and business partnering
  • big picture thinking with reasoning at a conceptual level, while maintaining strong attention to detail
  • experience as a senior analyst in a listed company with 5+ years experience
  • tertiary and post graduate qualifications in finance, economics or related business field, or an mba
  • please note that a background in investment banking or an advisory division of a professional services firm will be highly regarded

Title: senior policy analyst, forestry
Company: department of economic development, jobs, transport & resources vic
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

senior policy analyst, forestry

  • $96,942 - $117,293 (plus superannuation)
  • ongoing\xa0
  • usual hours of work: full time (flexibility may be available)
  • usual work location: melbourne cbd (flexibility may be available)

the position of senior policy analyst, forestry forms a part of the forestry and game branch within the rural and regional victoria group.

the forest industries policy team leads and assists in delivering the government's actions aimed at enabling productive and sustainable timber industries in victoria.

reporting to the manager, forest industries policy, the senior policy analyst will be responsible for managing projects and providing analysis and advice to executive management on issues that relate to or impact on victoria's forestry industry. this includes delivering the department's legislative and regulatory responsibilities for commercial timber harvesting operations on public and private land through the allocation of public timber resources and shaping operational policy outcomes.

the senior policy analyst will work collaboratively within the department of jobs, precincts and regions and with relevant departments and agencies to implement the government's forest industry policies. this includes environmental policy and projects that include the consideration of commercial forestry industries, including: forest management reform; threatened species and native vegetation management; and carbon and climate change. the senior policy analyst will be required to represent the department in senior internal and external forums and to develop and maintain extensive networks.

the successful candidate will have demonstrated knowledge of government policy for victoria's forestry industries and understand government policy development processes. they will be strong analytically and have a track record of being able to present thoroughly researched and pragmatic policy solutions to satisfy a complex group of stakeholders. they will need to demonstrate an ability to apply sound logic in the preparation of strategic advice. excellent communication, negotiation and influencing skills are essential.

the senior policy analyst must demonstrate strong initiative and an ability to work individually or as part of a team.

for a confidential discussion, please call charlie tack, manager, forest industries policy on 03 8392 6823.

successful candidates will be required to undergo a national police records check prior to commencing employment with the department.

for further information on the position, please see the attached position description.\xa0 to apply, please click the ‘apply now' button below.

applications close at midnight on 10 may 2019.

please note:\xa0 when submitting your application online, there will be questions pertaining to a number of the position's key selection criteria to which you are required to respond. the generic online form may ask you to provide the responses to all of the ksc. at this step in the on-line process, please only upload your resume and cover letter (there is no requirement to address all of the ksc) and move on to the last screen where you will be asked to submit responses to the specific questions only". complete these specific questions to complete your application.

Title: m&a analytics - analyst to manager
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

we are looking for a number of analytics professional at the analyst, senior analyst and manager levels.

what will your typical day look like?

you will bridge the gap between data analytics, visualisation, financial analysis, and ultimately play a key role in delivering valuable insight to your clients and support them through the entire transaction process; from acquisition and vendor due diligence, bid defence, reporting accountant services for capital market transactions, and post-deal.

you can expect to:

  • design flexible and extensible analytic solutions that encompass people, process and technology to deliver tangible value to our client’s business and m&a objectives
  • develop static and interactive data visualisations to communicate business insights
  • build your understanding of analytic methodologies/techniques, relational databases and visualisation based story telling


about the team

with our deep expertise in m&a analytics, we help clients make smarter decisions quicker, with a high level of confidence. be a part of our innovative and forward-thinking team who have developed ideal, an m&a-centric analytical tool that provides insight at every step of the m&a lifecycle, allowing us to provide clients with real-time advice to inform their big decisions.

designed to be different, our team brings diverse thinkers from commerce, quantitative finance, science, mathematics, and consulting to work together in a dynamic and creative environment.

enough about us, let’s talk about you.

you will have:

  • a degree in finance, accounting, commerce, mathematics, statistics, computer science or engineering
  • previous experience within in a finance/commerce or analytics role
  • some knowledge in a range of languages and tools such as: sql, r, alteryx, python, tableau, qlikview, github or vba
  • some knowledge in one or more of the following areas: data mining & management, predictive analytics, machine learning, optimisation, business rules engines, geospatial analysis, risk scoring & identification
  • depending on the role level, you may have some project management and leadership experience


why deloitte?

at deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. we value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

next steps

sound exactly like the sort of role for you? apply now!

if you’ve got any questions you can contact juliette jamoneau from the talent acquisition team. we’d love to hear from you.

Title: data driven marketing - digital sales - business development manager
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">data driven marketing – digital sales - business development manager!

big wave digital has had the long standing pleasure of partnering with this hugely successful global customer information and data driven marketing technology firm. through new product launches and new business wins, we are currently on the hunt for a self-motivated b2b business development manager, with a sales assassin attitude to join the data marketing and digital sales team.

the position requires someone who has the smarts to turn marketing data and numbers into business outcomes; you’ll need drive and determination to succeed, the persistence to chase down a win, the tenacity to convert your prospects and the desire to make a shyte load of commission.

to be selected for interview, you’ll need to have the following skills/experience/attributes….
  • proven ability to make quality cold calls to brands and agency clients, selling into digital marketing leaders, directors & c-suite.
  • have a winning sales methodology/formula that you can demonstrate and articulate when asked
  • have that sales assassin attitude – never give up till the qualified prospect has converted to an active client
  • established forecasting skills (using salesforce would be great, however other crm experience is fine)
  • aptitude for understanding client needs, sensational listening skills, with the ability to think on your feet
  • ability to interpret large sets of marketing data – highly analytical, with the passion for using numbers and consumer insights to create successful business outcomes
  • experience selling solutions is essential; this is not an account management role. it’s all about new business development. you’ll need to be able to demonstrate your actual’s v’s targets and discuss your kpi formula
in return, you’ll have the one off chance to join a market leader in marketing tech and consumer insights, the opportunity to grow within a dynamic and always evolving digital first business, and gain the highly sought after skills in data driven marketing that is set to be massive now and in the coming years. the team is collaborative; close knit, they celebrate wins and love a friendly competitive banter! \xa0they share a laugh; they love a friday arvo drink and are all keen team sports people.

if you command attention in a business meeting and are keen and eager to prove yourself in the edgy data driven marketing industry, then i’d love to hear from you! apply now via the link below, marked attention; dayna stewart | head of digital & data recruitment | dayna@bigwavedigital.com.au |www.bigwavedigital.com.au

Title: business analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

minterellison people aspire to be our clients best partner. collaboration, innovation and opportunity are the foundation of our workplace environment. we welcome people who want exciting careers in high performing teams.

purpose of the role

the business analyst will contribute to the effective delivery of high quality projects and work packages for operational and improvement projects, and build upon a body of knowledge of complex transactional systems (preferably finance related), to manage business requirements, analysis and design outputs.

job description

working\xa0as part of a tight-knit, high performing team, the business analyst\xa0will\xa0become a resident expert with\xa0in depth product expertise and ability to leverage excellent business analysis skills to effectively participate in projects and software design and delivery.

responsibilities include:

  • participate in requirements gathering workshops and other forums;
  • document user stories / requirements, seek feedback from multiple parties and update as required;
  • collaborate to complete full requirements analysis, including functional, data, security and stakeholder impact analysis;
  • build deep financial systems product expertise;
  • co-ordinate meetings, agendas, minutes and action lists;
  • liaise with developers, smes and project team members on work items associated with project deliverables;
  • assist with test planning to fulfil the business requirements and review test cases to ensure adequate coverage;
  • maintain issues registers, defect logs, run sheets and other project artefacts as required;
  • contribute to continuous improvement of business analysis processes, activities and outputs, with a focus on agility, responsiveness and high quality outcomes;
  • carry out other business analyst tasks as requested by the business analysis team leader or head of business systems;
  • availability for go live testing outside work hours.

more about you

on your first day, we expect you to have:

  • product expertise in complex finance / erp systems;
  • demonstrable experience analysing requirements/user stories and developing specifications with a focus on robust, scalable solutions;
  • the ability to quickly learn key modules and functions of a system, and understand key system tables and relationships;
  • the ability to demonstrate a strong understanding of the commercial environment and the key drivers of the business and to be flexible in meeting changing requirements and priorities;
  • experience as a team member on either small or large projects, including estimation of own work deliverables and collaboration with other team members;
  • ability to assist with and review test cases as per requirements and execute some testing as required by the test manager;
  • beginner to intermediate sql knowledge;
  • good understanding of and strong adherence to itil principles;
  • exposure ideally to both waterfall and agile methodologies;
  • a sound understanding of project delivery and your role in the software development life cycle;
  • a good communicator, excellent at building relationships and communicating promptly re issues and blockers;\xa0
  • presents new ideas, seeks and develops suggestions;
  • maintains a pro-active, flexible and collaborative attitude.

bonus points for someone who has:

  • experience with legal practice management systems;
  • 2 - 3\xa0years' experience in professional services or comparable environment

who we are

we embrace flexibility and empower all our people to learn, grow and become truly extraordinary. we provide our future leaders with best practice learning and development programs to accelerate and grow their careers. we value diversity in the workplace and care about ensuring you balance your professional goals with your commitments and interests outside of work. we have a wide range of social, financial and health benefits to support your wellbeing.

how to apply

we prefer to deal with you directly, so please follow the prompts below to apply.\xa0 for specific queries about this opportunity please contact alyce bennett on alyce.bennett@minterellison.com.\xa0

minterellison does not accept agency submissions unless approval to do so has been given by a member of the resourcing team. approved agency submissions must be submitted through our on-line system. candidates submitted directly to any employee or partner of the firm will not be considered valid and will not be considered by minterellison. minterellison will not be liable for a recruitment fee in these circumstances.

to be eligible to apply for this role you must be legally permitted to work in australia.

Title: senior digital business analyst
Company: talent – winner ‘seek large recruitment agency of the year’ 3 consecutive years
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about us
our client is one of the world\'s leading services within education, training, technical support and advocacy.



about the role
reporting to the business analyst practice lead, the senior business analyst will be an active participant on a variety of initiatives, from large web-based and digital projects to smaller enhancements, in agile or traditional approach environments. they will collaborate with a broad spectrum of internal and external stakeholders at all levels, to gather, analyse, review and document stakeholder requirements, through a variety of means including facilitation of workshops.

you will also be responsible for:
\xa0
  • liaising professionally and confidently with a diverse group of stakeholders at all levels, from executives to business users to technical experts, both internal and external.
  • partnering with the business as a \'trusted advisor\' on behalf of the technology team.
  • challenging the status quo, innovative thinking and effective influencing of decision makers within boundaries of business value and technology constraints.
  • understanding the political culture of the enterprise to comprehend and arbitrate a wide range of potentially conflicting stakeholder preferences and views.
  • confidently facilitating workshops, focus groups and other forums - to collaborate with stakeholders; understanding their motivators, objectives, roi, risks, issues etc.
  • identifying, analysing, interpreting and validating business and technical requirements in a manner aligned with project expectations, with exceptional attention to detail
  • producing all types of business analysis documentation, including but not limited to, change impact assessments, business requirements and functional requirements.
  • translating functional, business and technical requirements into epics, user stories and acceptance criteria, as mandated working in an agile environment.

about you - you will have:
  • tertiary level qualification in information technology (it) and/or business management or equivalent practical experience.
  • solid experience partnering with the business to deliver targeted, high value solutions to complex problems
  • demonstrated experience as a business analyst on agile projects and ability to translate functional, business and technical requirements into epics, user stories and acceptance criteria.
  • proven experience in facilitating workshops, negotiation and conflict resolution
  • excellent stakeholder management, communication and engagement skills
  • first class communication, writing, interpersonal, negotiation and influencing skills.
  • you will also need to be a self-starter and someone who is comfortable working collaboratively with others.
if you\'re interested push the "apply now" button for a faster response shoot me an email to wes.elsayed@talentinternational.com or call me on (03) 9236 7766\xa0

as australia\'s largest privately owned it services company conducting business australia wide and in the asia pacific region, dialog\'s key focus is on delivering outstanding results to its many corporate and government clients using leading tools, technologies and methodologies. dialog is a dynamic organisation which offers attractive career development to its people through diverse projects, training and mentoring in a collaborative atmosphere.

Title: senior associate, market risk analysis
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
  • 2nd line of defence risk role within market risk analytics
  • key analytics\xa0 function with project leadership opportunity
  • 12 month fixed-term opportunity

at nab, we believe success comes from our people. we're committed to supporting your talent and skills through your career, as you help us build a culture that affects change for our customers - and for the community too.

about the role

a challenging opportunity has arisen for a senior associate, market risk analytics to maintain the integrity of the internal model framework and comply with regulator obligations of prudential standard aps116 through smooth transition of change proposals into production. this role will manage change initiatives relating to strategic projects, regulatory changes, process improvements and system maintenance.

the market risk analytics team exists to implement the internal model in compliance with the traded market risk regulatory standard and with any associated internal policy and procedures.

responsibilities

reporting to the manager, market risk analytics, the key responsibilities of this role include but are not limited to the following:

  • management of the market risk change and product support processes
  • collaborate with other market risk teams, markets and technology in development and testing of market risk systems
  • providing business requirements, contributing to the ongoing development of market risk processes and reporting
  • provide business support and maintenance of the market risk internal-model framework (from which risk metrics are produced) in a timely and accurate manner;
  • build strong working relationships with key stakeholders to ensure issues impacting on market risk are being considered and addressed;

skills and experience

this is an excellent opportunity for a proven risk professional with exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills to play a critical role within the market risk team. we are looking for practical experience in financial services and a solid understanding of nab’s risk management methodology, tools, systems and policies.

additionally, you will have the following skills and experience:

  • tertiary qualifications preferably with a business, banking, finance or risk management focus
  • additional qualifications e.g. afma, post grad studies in applied finance, markets or quantitative/actuarial studies (beneficial)
  • solid understanding of market risk systems, policies and daily production processes
  • solid understanding of activities within global markets (ficc) division
  • sound strategic, analytical, evaluation and consultative skills
  • strong communication skills and experience in resolving stakeholder concerns, issues and conflicts

how to apply

if you are ready to take the next step in your risk career, we are keen to hear from you!

please note, candidate screening and interviews may take place prior to the advertised close date.

to be eligible to apply, you must have australian or new zealand citizenship or permanent residency status. please apply via the link.

we embrace diversity of thought, style and working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the community that we serve.

job description & summary

as a contractor with pwc, you’ll find the flexibility you need to make choices that suit your individual needs and unique skill set. you’ll gain experience, marketability and the opportunity to grow your network, which you’ll be able to leverage to progress your career.

join us on a 3-6 month contract, ideally starting may 20, 2019.

what will you create?

you’ll help australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. from digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems.

risk assurance bring this to life by helping clients to protect and strengthen every aspect of their business; from people to performance, systems to strategy and business plans to business resilience.

as a data analyst in our data assurance team your impact will be seen by:

  • delivering crucial business insights to clients through data analytics and data visualisation

  • partner with clients to enable them to understand the value in their data

  • partnering with teams to overcome client data centric issues

  • helping businesses make sense of complex data sets through manipulation and use of \xa0data manipulation and visualisation tools i.e sql, acl, alteryx, qlik sense, power bi

about you

you have a background in data analytics and are skilled in data visualisation, data cleansing and manipulation and hold an understanding of the volume and complexity that exists within the financial services industry. ideally, you have previous experience working within a big 4 or mid-tier consulting firm.

passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our risk assurance team transform how risk is perceived and capitalised on.

you’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. you’re a problem solver by nature and want to work with a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.

life at pwc

whether you’re working as a contractor to gain experience in a new area, as a platform to gain a more permanent role or as a lifestyle choice, it’ll offer you a predictable pattern of work and provide you with endless opportunities to leverage.

you’ll also benefit from our inclusive culture - something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named linkedin’s #1 australian workplace. here, differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.

we empower you with the technology, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. we’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.

we’re living this commitment through initiatives including our reconciliation action plan to increase indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, lgbti and gender equality. at our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.

claire gascoine is the recruitment manager for the role. as the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.

Title: data wrangling expert/asset performance analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

the organisation

asset analytics supplies the leading indicators that tell an organisation when an asset is likely to fail in the future, and on what schedule that asset should be evaluated for maintenance or replacement. comprehensive asset analytics also takes into account the entire performance and lifecycle cost of the assets, how they are networked and their value to the company. today, asset performance analytics is becoming more important as a way to provide a holistic, predictive approach to asset maintenance and performance. historically ‘maintenance’ has often been viewed as a cost, when in fact it is an investment to “preserve” the function of plant and equipment.

importantly, this organisation is focussed on taking ‘managing assets’ to a system and culture of true ‘asset management’ and your ability as a data scientist/asset performance analyst will be showcased and allow you a career trajectory where you are using extensive data to analyse the performance of their assets and in being a part of reshaping how this organisation deliver services to maximise value.

the role

this is a newly created role and a position where you will see the difference your superior data analysing abilities can impact the bottom line and improve life across this large community.\xa0as a data wrangling expert you are probably used to working with random data.\xa0 if this is the case, you will feel valued see the genuine impact of your work in this role. your skills in data analytics will lead to improved processes and to driving continuous improvement across water and wastewater assets, civil/transport, open space and stormwater assets. learning about these assets and identifying how to fix things efficiently will be underpinned by your ability to pull patterns out of data across the asset portfolio and translate these into tangible solutions.

your goal is to reduce vast and disparate data sets into categorised and useful summaries and reports to improve maintenance efficiency across the asset portfolio and support overall business and customer outcomes.

about you

as with all niche roles, we are seeking a specific combination of qualifications and experience including ideally:

  • tertiary qualifications in engineering, science or it that underpin your industry leading proficiency in data science or a related field.
  • extensive experience capturing end user requirements and using data science to solve complex challenges, including data linkage and modelling
  • superior communication skills, including the ability to work effectively with and convey highly complex information to non-technical people across the business.

in the role of asset performance analyst, you will contribute to important analytics and modelling projects that will support evidence-based decision making, driving positive outcomes for the people of this region.

a salary of up to $100k + 12% super + 5 weeks annual leave with 17.5% loading and a 9-day fortnight together with generous relocation assistance is on offer for the successful candidate. future learning and development opportunities are supported together with reimbursement of some professional registration fees.

for a confidential conversation, please call\xa0rona horsfall on 0438 943854 at peak services recruitment.

a position description and details on how to apply can be found if you put the following link into your browser https://lgaqld.applynow.net.au/jobs/peak97 or click apply and you will be taken there directly.

Title: data engineer
Description:
