Title: data scientist - small consultancy - $120k - $180k + super
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
the company.

my client are a small firm with offices across australia, europe, and asia. made up of mathematicians, statisticians, and software engineers, they are incredibly delivery focused, working with large sets of data for their clients. they are dedicated to rewarding hard work and innovative ideas.

the role.

an opportunity exists for a data scientist to join the team. you will be working closely with senior mathematicians out of the sydney office, working with large amounts of sports data. you\'ll be mentoring junior members of the team, working to improve existing models, and looking to automate / build internal tools where possible.\xa0

key responsibilities.

you will be working with large sets of legacy data. cleaning it up, introducing factors, regression modelling. you have experience extracting large data sets and will be working closely with programmers. a background in maths, data analysis, actuarial, or physics would be an advantage.

ideal experience.
  • - background in anything maths heavy.
  • - academic, with good results through uni.
  • - proficient in r and sql
  • - strong in algorithmic coding
  • - experience with statistical forecasting
other benefits:
\xa0\xa0
  • small team, lots of exposure
  • sydney cbd location

Title: senior commercial analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
  • support the development of winning bids and proposals
  • influence stakeholders to effect outcomes
  • based in sydney cbd

\xa0

\xa0

about you

you are a highly collaborative, innovative and dynamic individual with exemplary interpersonal skills and exceptional time management. you are adaptable and resilient, and thrive in fast paced team environments. you can engage and influence at all levels of an organisation, and have a strong solution delivery and improvement focus. you are enthusiastic, energetic, and positive, and have highly effective organisation skills, allowing you to balance competing demands and workload peaks. you are passionate and driven, and demonstrate exceptional moral values in all that you do.

\xa0

about the role

the role of serco’s bid team is to develop winning proposals that successfully convert tender opportunities into new contracts for serco. our work is underpinned by a value-for-money ethos, driving us to provide compelling proposals for our government customers. reporting to the head of commercial aspac, you will develop and modify dynamic and accurate excel-based cost models for serco contract bids and tenders, and undertake a range of quantitative analysis to develop cost assumptions, understand trends and influence business unit stakeholders to affect outcomes. you will develop and interrogate reasonableness of assumptions, and provide support to senior team members with the preparation of external and internal presentation materials, including bid financial statements.\xa0\xa0\xa0

\xa0

to be successful in this role you will have:

  • the highest levels of personal integrity and ethical behavior
  • tertiary qualifications in accounting, commerce, business or other relevant discipline
  • qualified or part qualified accountant to internationally recognised standard
  • advanced financial modelling skills
  • strong financial and quantitative analysis skills
  • sound experience in a similar role for a comparable organization
  • proven sales success is (desirable)
  • commercial operations, bidding, procurement and/or budgeting experience within the services sector (desirable)
  • workforce modelling experience (desirable)

\xa0

this is a position of trust and responsibility and to support this we will conduct a thorough probity assessment as an essential selection component for this role.

\xa0

about us

within our group corporate teams, we collaborate and support the operational arms of serco’s asia pacific division. we problem solve and innovate across a range of disciplines including corporate affairs, finance, information technology, legal, sales and bids.

\xa0

at serco, you’ll be part of a team of more than 50,000 people delivering essential services on behalf of governments and organisations around the world. we apply world\'s best practice, insights and technology across six key sectors: citizen services, defence, healthcare, immigration, justice and transport. but no matter your role or where you’re based, we each share the same goal – to bring service to life to make a positive difference every day. to learn more please visit www.serco.com/aspac

\xa0

join us

if you are inspired to make a positive difference and would like to be considered for this opportunity, please submit your cover letter and resume by clicking the \'apply now\' button.

\xa0

serco values of\xa0trust, care, innovation and pride underpin everything we do.\xa0 we are curious, creative and collaborative. our people help in ways that matter.

\xa0

we are committed to diversity and we encourage people from different backgrounds including aboriginal and torres strait islander people, culturally and linguistically diverse and people with disabilities to apply.

\xa0

\n\n

Title: reinsurance accounting analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

summary of responsibilities:

the duties revolve around reinsurance analysis, managing data and accounting, reporting to the reinsurance accounting manager.

key accountabilities:

  • reinsurance reporting – monthly and quarterly.
  • assist with the facilitation of reinsurance treaty accounting charfield setup requirement.
  • strategic development to automate and improve all reinsurance processes.

  • assist with the facilitation of reinsurance treaty accounting charfield setup requirement

  • qualified or close to qualified ca/cpa
  • strong knowledge of excel, sql and vb macros

  • ability to liaise effectively with other departments and external parties to metlife

personal attributes:

  • attention to detail
  • can-do attitude
  • team work
  • demonstrates initiative
  • willing to take accountability for the completion of tasks
  • effective communication

what\'s in it for you?\xa0

to apply, please send your resume to\xa0aupeopleculture@metlife.com

applications close tuesday 21st may 2019

Description:

Title: data engineer
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

why join?

  • australian hyper-growth startup - head office in sydney
  • winner of westpac innovative business of tomorrow 2018
  • no. 5 on forbes cloud 100 for 2018: rising stars
  • deloitte\'s #21 fastest growing technology startups in aus 2018
  • raised $111m series b round led by ivp, openview (our series a investor), square peg capital and evp.
  • global growth across apac, america and emea.

make a genuine impact on the growth of deputy and influence how processes are established as we scale internationally!

\xa0

summary

you will work closely with the principal data engineer, a team of data analysts, & the head of data. right now, we have an assorted data pipeline, you get a chance to help build the pipeline from scratch which will scale as the company grows.

\xa0

the role

you will be responsible for helping to expand\xa0and optimize\xa0our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams.

\xa0

you

are an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. as an experienced data engineer you will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. you must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products. you will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.

\xa0

responsibilities

  • create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture,
  • assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
  • identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
  • build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using sql and aws ‘big data’ technologies.
  • build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.
  • work with stakeholders including the engineering, product, data and design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
  • keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and aws regions.
  • create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
  • work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.

\xa0

qualifications

  • advanced working sql knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (sql) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
  • experience building and optimizing data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
  • experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
  • strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
  • build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
  • a successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
  • working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable data stores.
  • project management and organizational supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
  • we are looking for a candidate with 5+ years of experience in a data engineer role, who has attained a graduate degree in computer science, statistics, informatics, information systems or another quantitative field.
  • you should also have experience using the following software/tools:
  • experience with big data tools would be beneficial but not prerequisite: hadoop, spark, kafka, etc.
  • experience with relational sql and nosql databases, including postgres and cassandra.
  • experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: azkaban, luigi, airflow, etc.
  • experience with aws cloud services: ec2, emr, rds, redshift
  • experience with stream-processing systems: storm, spark-streaming, etc.
  • experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: python, java, c++, scala, etc.

\xa0

perks

* hack days * training * career development * flexible work * catered lunch * team building events *

\xa0

want to know more?

at deputy we’re on a mission to change the way the world works. since 2008 over 200 million shifts have been rostered on deputy, in over 80 countries, and across 245 different industries. we were #21 in deloitte’s fastest growing tech startups 2018, winner of westpac’s innovative business of tomorrow 2018, and #5 in forbes’ cloud 100 2018. and we’re only just getting started.

we’re making it easier for businesses and teams to roster staff, manage leave, complete payroll and take the admin out of work so that our customers can focus on doing what they love. we hire amazing people to do what they’re best at, and work with some incredible businesses all around the world.

check out these videos:\xa0deputy explained,\xa0#deputydays

check out why our employees and customers love us:\xa0jess (sales)\xa0hannah (ux/ui design),\xa0louis (head of mobile),\xa0getapp\xa0and\xa0g2crowd.\xa0

deputy believes in equal opportunity and that inclusiveness and diversity promotes innovation. our global team members are from a variety of cultures. and we welcome different perspective and skills.\xa0

interested? apply now

Title: data analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

we would like to find a candidate that is looking to develop their skills and seeks growth opportunities within the company. \xa0\xa0in return, we will provide on-the-job training and support, challenging new tasks and exposure to new technology.



infomedia is the global leader in automotive software, providing saas solutions from our large suite of products in pursuit of creating efficiencies and process improvements for our clients. our team gets to build, implement and support some of the coolest products on the market, using the latest tech in an environment where ideas are nurtured, curiosity is rewarded, and collaboration is key to our success. we are evolving quickly and so we are on the lookout for those who thrive in fast paced and ever-changing environments where innovation and continual improvement are the norm. you know, the people who are forever curious, asking questions and seeking answers, challenging prevailing perceptions in pursuit of the best outcomes and not the "normal" outcomes. our team are not leaders in our industry by accident, we are forever challenging each other to be better in a supportive culture conducive with high performance, creativity and achievement. we challenge you to challenge us.

we offer:

  • quarterly meetups
  • relaxed and informal but very high performing culture
  • social events

what will the role look like on a day to day basis?

  • many of nidasu's products receive data from multiple sources; the data is standardized and used in our applications to create key performance reports.
  • we would like someone to join our team to generally assist with tasks such as:
  • adding data from our clients into nidasu products;
  • managing and reviewing data we receive from dealers;
  • regularly source data from automotive distributors, update nidasu applications, and check the data quality;
  • comparing reports from nidasu's applications with reports from other sources; report on inconsistencies;
  • reviewing data matching processes; discover trends and reporting findings;
  • assisting with the support requests raised by our clients.


experience and attributes that will translate into success:\xa0

  • please be comfortable with using microsoft excel;
  • have very keen attention to detail;
  • have good written and verbal communication skills;
  • be flexible and adaptable;
  • be happy to work in a team.

Title: business analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

exciting opportunity to join a global business in an innovative and ambitious team!

your new company
hays is recognised as the leading recruitment agency across the globe. we work with the biggest and the most innovative companies in the world and last year we placed over 300,000 people into jobs in anz. with over 10,000 employees in 250 offices located across 33 countries in australasia, asia, europe and north and south america, there is no doubt that we are industry leaders with an unbeatable global footprint.
consisting of our it, finance, people & culture, marketing, bids & tenders, legal and ohs teams, our corporate services department provide essential support to our organisation, maintaining the infrastructure, processes and procedures required to keep our organisation functioning to the highest of standards.

your new role
reporting to the product manager of our back office systems you will research new and innovative ways to improve the user experience of our corporate services systems and reduce unnecessary manual work, allowing the business to work more effectively and increase productivity. this role will be a mix of relationship management, assessment & analysis, documentation and communication & delivery and will see you:

  • working with internal stakeholders and teams to clearly understand the technical and functional architecture of applications and the support, maintenance and infrastructure needs of solutions
  • engage with users to fully understand their needs and add value where possible- with a particular focus on user experience and user interface
  • run workshops with the business as required
  • attend backlog reviews
  • review requests, assess and ensure value is added
  • accurately document user stories on the product backlog for discussion with both the business and development team
  • create detailed workflow diagrams to visualise both existing and new process flows
  • design prototypes around user feedback
  • act as a point of communication between the development team, testers and business throughout the life cycle of the sprint
  • provide assistance to live deployments during storm support period immediately after go-live
  • work with the tech support team to migrate items from support onto the product backlog


what you\'ll need to succeed

Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">we\'ve got an exciting permanent, full-time opportunity for a strong quantitative data analyst/data scientist with experience developing analytical solutions, helping to support a wide range of business and technical stakeholders in building complex models and continually improve their understanding of their business, clients and customers.

· \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 3 month initial contract – high chance of extension

\xa0

t he role

\xa0

an exciting opportunity as a senior data analyst with a strong data analytics background to join my client on a 3 month initial contract. the client has a growing data analytics program to support the division and its operations. we require a data analyst that will be part of a team that will play a key role in the design and implementation of data governance and management frameworks across the program.

\xa0

duties

\xa0

• \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 development and implement data insights to ensure high standards of data quality and analysis within prd.

• \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 perform regular review of data projects and solutions to ensure they are updated to meet changing business needs.

• \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 provide analytic function to developing key performance indicators within prd for identifying trends and evaluating the success of the business’s initiatives, service improvement and product development.

• \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 measure and report the effectiveness of these data frameworks and policies to senior management using qualitative or quantitative metrics (e.g., cost avoidance or return on investments).

• \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 drive the timely delivery of program deliverables (e.g., design and drafting of the required data governance frameworks & policies) that is fit-for-purpose in meeting divisional needs.

• \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 implement data analytics principles and methodologies that underpin high quality research and analysis.

• \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 undertake critical data analysis to draw accurate conclusions that recognise and manage contextual issues.

• \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 conduct research and formulate recommendations to support evidence based decision making.

\xa0

skills and qualifications

\xa0

· \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 experience working with large data sets from a large number of different sources, interpreting diverse data, whilst ensuring data integrity and privacy.

· \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 demonstrated project management experience from concept, to conducting research, data set development, designing and implementing practical solutions for stakeholders.

· \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 develops logical and conceptual data flows that are in support of departmental project requirements and guides various business departments in appropriate and effective use of data.

· \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 experience in the design and delivery of risk and evidence based projects.

· \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 high level written and verbal communication skills with the ability to liaise with a range of internal and external stakeholders.

· \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 excellent problem-solving skills with a solution focussed, consultative approach.

· \xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0 demonstrated high level personal motivation to deliver results and to be self-driven.

Title: nsw government data analytics - manager
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
  • nsw government consulting opportunity - manager
  • data engineer / data analyst /information management
  • flexible working options available


kpmg is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. we are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.

you will work in a rapidly growing part of kpmg’s management consulting practice with projects that span multiple locations and industry sectors.

our highly skilled data & analytics team helps our clients to use their data resources for creating value, enhancing competitiveness and driving business decisions. within data & analytics we provide unique services through delivering consulting projects, custom analytics work, proofs of concept, fantastic face to face and on-line trainings and accreditations\xa0for our brightest minds around data and advanced analytics.


your new role

our team is seeking a range of data analytics specialists to support our ambitious growth strategy. working in our team you'll be mixing with some of the brightest minds while working on significant government projects – solving real world problems with nsw government, using some of the most exciting and interesting data you wouldn’t normally have access to.
you’ll be working collaboratively within a team environment and building strong client relationships.

joining our team you’ll be working across projects that are applying data solutions to solve client problems using some of the below:

  • building solutions using technologies like java, python, node.js, nosql databases – leveraging big data platforms like hadoop, spark on amazon aws and microsoft azure.\xa0
  • use data analytics tools such as sql, python, ssis and visualisation tools
  • developing innovative web and mobile applications using html5, css and javascript (d3, jquery, bootstrap and react).
  • data strategy assessment, strategy development and stakeholder socialisation and acceptance
  • data platform assessment, solution strategy and delivery
  • define and deliver enterprise information management frameworks that address data lineage, data dictionaries, data ownership, data sensitivity, data privileges and accessibility.\xa0

you bring to the role

we are open to candidates of all skill levels and experience. you will describe yourself as one of the below roles and bring relevant experience in your chosen area:

  • data engineer: engineering modern data solutions or pipelines to facilitate advanced analytics, visualisation & interactive data applications
  • data analyst: analysing and business consulting with data – using relational databases (sql), data workbench & visualisation tools for project delivery, applying business logic and interpreting results
  • information management: you might focus on technical im or be have more experience in traditional data governance and data strategy or platform assessment


you’ll demonstrate your experience in within a government sector, either through in-house or consulting experience.\xa0 you’ll need to bring an ability to work collaboratively within a team environment and to build strong client relationships. we're looking for talented people, team players and progressive thinkers who can communicate their ideas convincingly.


you will:
●\xa0have a questioning mind and lots of bright ideas
●\xa0be a critical thinker with strong analytical and problem solving skills
●\xa0be comfortable with manipulating and combining large, high dimensional datasets from multiple sources
●\xa0have an ability to interpret findings and identify key insights to communicate to a non-technical audience
●\xa0have demonstrated experience building relationships with internal and/or external clients
●\xa0be passionate about delivering high quality work


what we offer you

we offer rewarding careers for outstanding professionals, ongoing learning and development opportunities, a collaborative and inclusive culture, and flexible and agile work practices that focus on our people's wellbeing to drive innovation and entrepreneurship. we also believe that our business plays a distinct and vital role in helping solve important social and environmental issues; and use our unique skills and expertise to help create positive and lasting impacts for our communities.

we believe diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. we are consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and our inclusive culture promotes the development of our people irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation or disability.

this is an exciting opportunity to be a part of kpmg and its ongoing success. so if you want a career where you can use your deep expertise to deliver real results, talk to us first.

\xa0

Title: business analysis/business intelligence (ba/bi) - graduate program
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

there are thousands of graduates in the market, stand out from the crowd.

technology is transforming all our lives – developments in robotics, automation, artificial intelligence and big data are creating the careers of the future. digital careers need intelligent, analytical minds, people who want to make a difference; graduates who desire to be at the forefront of change.

regardless of your degree subject, we believe all graduates possess the skills to fuel an exciting career in technology. fdm offers numerous career paths for you to choose, and that’s why in 2017, we launched the careers of over 1,000 graduates. fdm group is a ftse 250 employer with a global footprint working with some of the world’s most reputable organisations such as hsbc, kpmg, anz and macquarie.

\xa0

how is the program structured?

your journey as a ba/bi consultant will begin at fdm’s academy in sydney, where you will receive fully-funded training and the chance to gain industry recognised qualifications, as well as mentoring and support throughout. our award-winning graduate program provides a wealth of opportunity to gain transferable skills as well as becoming an expert within your field. after successfully completing your training, you will work with one or more of our clients in australia during the two-year program.

\xa0

what will i be doing?

fdm’s business analysis/business intelligence program will train you to become an expert at developing strategies to help businesses gain and maintain competitive advantage through the use of data. you will learn how to design and develop analytics tools and platforms to analyse data essential to ensuring that businesses function efficiently. bi technologies provide historical, current and predictive views of business operations with the aim of creating a simpler interpretation of big data, identify opportunities and improve strategies for long-term organisational stability.

\xa0

what we are looking for:

  • bachelor’s degree
  • analytical skills
  • excellent communication skills and ability to build relationships
  • ability to meet deadlines effectively
  • big ambitions to succeed within the it industry
  • eligible to work in australia (citizen/permanent resident)
  • geographically flexible throughout sydney and melbourne to support our clients

\xa0

what we offer you:

  • fully-funded industry recognised training and qualifications
  • key skills development e.g. stakeholder management, communication, planning and microsoft excel
  • a foot in the door to some of the world’s most reputable organisations
  • mentoring and on-going support throughout your entire fdm journey
  • modern and central training academies
  • social events and networking

\xa0

whether you’ve been studying for a role in the technology industry or not, we have exciting opportunities available for you. we have multiple start dates all year round, so why not make an application today? click to apply for the fdm graduate program. if successful, you will be able to specify your interest for this particular role at a later point in the application process. \xa0

\xa0

if you wish to apply please use the following link:\xa0https://apply.fdmgroup.com/?chkcategory=1&chkcategory=2&chkcategory=3&lstregion=7

Title: director - data engineer | hong kong
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">global life insurance company: hong kong


description


are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? with work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.


director, data engineer, global data office: hong kong based\xa0


job overview


the data engineer is responsible for developing and implementing a strategic enterprise data lake capability for collecting, storing, processing enterprise & divisional data to support and enable analytics, digital transformation and operational improvements. this involves researching, recommending and choosing optimal solutions to manage and implement modern data architecture as well as maintaining and monitoring the success of these solutions. the incumbent must have a passion for how data can be leveraged and used to drive deeper, meaningful insights that enhance the customer experience, grow our businesses, minimize risk and engage our employees globally.




responsibilities


the data engineer has primary responsibility for:
  • modern data architecture: setting the strategic rollout, selection and delivery of proven as well as emerging tooling to ensure that data pipelines are scalable, repeatable and secure serving multiple users within the organization. the incumbent is responsible for implementing highly complex, multi-faceted big data initiatives associated the following functions areas:
  • governance and controls: responsible for ensuring all data management processes conform to standard operating procedures and aligns with how a modern data architecture aligns to enterprise technology standards and policies; contribute and provide guidance around data quality, metadata management, data stewardship and security, and access controls.
  • innovation and continuous improvement: evaluate/conduct poc of new data technologies and capabilities that are value-driven; work closely with our innovation teams (i.e., loft), remain current with industry advancements working closely external vendors as well connected to the apache foundation projects.
  • translate complex functional and technical requirements into detailed design and high performing capabilities;
  • lead the design and build of data patterns and services - both batch, real-time and complex event handing - leveraging open technologies;
  • ensure the timely delivery to meet project timeline by automating development and deployment tasks;
  • effectively manage operational risk and change with a continuous focus on process improvements.
\xa0


qualifications


required knowledge and skills:
  • demonstrated 7-10 years professional experience in big data/data management including a university degree in engineering, computer science or equivalent program;
  • extensive expertise in data technologies and the use of data to support software development, advanced analytics and reporting. particular focus on cloud (azure) and hadoop-based technologies and programming or scripting languages like java, scala, linux, c++, php, ruby, python, r and sas.
  • additional expert knowledge should be present regarding different (nosql or rdbms) databases such as hawq/hdb, mongodb, cassandra or hbase.
  • working experience with modern data streaming process with kafka, apache spark, flink and data ingestion framework nifi, hive, pig, etc.
  • experience with security/data protection solutions, kerberos, active directory, hdfs access control, oauth2, openid, ldap
  • experience with network layer security design in vpn, firewall, loadbalancer
  • experience and capability in translating non-technical user requests into complex technical specifications and solutions that meet these requirements;
  • excellent organizational and time management skills, with ability to multi-task. ability to work with minimal or no supervision while performing duties.
  • own the ability and initiative to organize various functions necessary to accomplish department activities or goals and be a strong team player.
\xa0


about us


we are a leading international financial services group providing forward-thinking solutions to help people with their big financial decisions. we provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. at the end of 2014, we had 28,000 employees, 58,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving 20 million customers. at the end of june 2015, we had $883 billion (us$708 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made more than $22 billion in benefits, interest and other payments to our customers. our principal operations are in asia, canada and the united states where we have served customers for more than 100 years. with our global headquarters in toronto, canada, we trade on the toronto, new york, and the philippine stock exchanges and in hong kong.




\xa0

Title: master data administrator (6-month contract - part time
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about the role

based at either our belrose office in sydney or balcatta office in perth and reporting to the logistics and distribution manager, this role is responsible to ensure accurate creation and ongoing management of all master data related to products planned, manufactured, sourced and supplied by perrigo australia across a number of different platforms including sap, npc and 4pl providers.

this is a 6-month contract role, available on a part time basis 3 to 4 days per week.

duties:

  • obtain and collate accurate master data information from various sources as required; including siop, procurement, suppliers/manufacturers, finance, sales, production and distribution.
  • enter and maintain product data in sap, bizcaps (npc), other external systems as required.
  • develop business processes to collate and enter key information for new products and for input of relevant changes to data for existing products.
  • undertake random data integrity reviews to ensure accuracy.
  • ensure product data is maintained – any changes (including discontinuation and archiving) to be captured and updated in all relevant systems.

skills & experience

  • educated to relevant tertiary level.
  • minimum 3 years’ experience in master data management preferably within the fmcg or pharmaceutical industry.
  • minimum 2 years sap experience.
  • advanced skills in microsoft office, particularly excel.
  • understanding of product and customer hierarchies, product bills of material and routers.
  • able to communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
  • multi-task assigned work.

how to apply

submit your cv with a covering letter that best demonstrates your ability to meet the above requirements by cob wednesday 15 may 2019.

Title: research data manager
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
  • become part of a team that is devoted to making the world a mentally healthier place
  • design, implement and manage systems to enable collection, analysis and reporting of data to determine outcomes for multiple large-scale implementation studies
  • full-time contract for 2 years

about the institute:

the black dog institute is a medical research institute and a global leader in\xa0translational\xa0mental health research. we harness the latest technology\xa0and other tools\xa0to quickly turn our world-class research findings into\xa0clinical services, education and e-health products\xa0that improve the lives of people with mental illness and the wider community.\xa0

we pride ourselves on translating our own world leading workplace mental health research into an award-winning culture that encompasses a holistic view of wellbeing. we aim to create a positive, mentally healthy workplace that recognises the importance of meaningful work, balanced lifestyles, psychological well-being and continual learning whilst being guided by our core values - collaboration, compassion, excellence, innovation and respect. we offer:\xa0

  • competitive salaries
  • salary packaging
  • commitment to learning and development
  • flexible working hours and work-life balance
  • generous parental leave policy
  • pet friendly office
  • social and team events

about the role:

the research data manager will be responsible for creating unified study databases combining data from existing, ongoing data collections managed by internal and external project partners and establishing a reporting platform allowing for routine access by project investigators, and visualisation of research outcomes for a range of audiences.

the position works collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams across discovery, innovation and corporate services. it will require an understanding of the research environment, along with core expertise in data management, including data security, data governance and in the development of data protocols and procedures.

key responsibilities:

  • develop the data plan for research studies, including recommendations for technologies, formats, operating models and decisioning platforms.
  • develop protocols, processes and dictionaries to support data management and access across studies, considering data security, data governance and broader research ethics requirements.
  • manage the collection and integration of data from a range of data providers, including setting up and implementing systems and procedures for quality assurance (quality control, data checking and cleaning large datasets), as well as data extraction for analysis.
  • manage the study databases to enable researchers to generate insights into study progress and recommendations for improvements to study data collection procedures.
  • ensure that database development and management will integrate with ongoing data collection processes.
  • internal and external liaison, consultation and knowledge exchange with stakeholders including data custodians.
  • provide accurate and timely data to support research reporting as requested and contribute to the dissemination of results.
  • develop database systems and architecture using specialised fit-for-purpose software such as sas.

selection criteria:

essential:

  1. tertiary qualification in information technology, health information management or a relevant scientific discipline.
  2. demonstrated experience in establishing and managing sql-server based database systems for large-scale health projects.
  3. demonstrated experience in sas or similar software for data management, analysis and reporting.
  4. demonstrated experience in quality control, data checking and cleaning of large-scale datasets, including data manipulation and extraction.
  5. experience in the development of documented data management plans and data governance processes.\xa0\xa0
  6. demonstrated ability to manage a variety of internal and external stakeholders, using excellent consultation and negotiation skills to produce positive project outcomes.
  7. demonstrated ability to manage large projects to time and on budget.
  8. proven ability to work flexibly and adapt as necessary to the demands of multiple projects.
  9. excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills, with an outstanding level of attention to detail.
  10. a knowledge of eeo principles and wh&s responsibilities and commitment to attending relevant wh&s training.

desirable:

  1. experience in data management for health research. experience in mental health research highly desirable.
  2. experience of working within a research ethics governance framework.
  3. proven experience with linkage of health service data.
  4. proven experience with visual analytics tools, e.g. sas.
  5. previous experience working in the not-for-profit sector.

to apply:

if you’re interested or want to find out more, we’d love to hear from you.\xa0drop us a line at\xa0recruitment@blackdog.org.au, using the subject line:\xa0research\xa0data manager\xa0with your cv and cover letter addressing the selection criteria.

\xa0

applications close:\xa015 may 2019

the black dog institute is an eeo employer.

aboriginal and torres strait islander people are encouraged to apply.\xa0

download the\xa0position description:

https://www.blackdoginstitute.org.au/docs/default-source/job-position-descriptions/research-data-manager-position-description-final-march-2019.pdf?sfvrsn=0\xa0

Title: metadata specialist
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

the world is not mono. look around it\'s not monochrome or monotone. the world is marvellously multi. when you look at the world this way, it makes a difference. it\'s what we\'ve been doing for 40 years, breaking down the barriers that divide us and telling a multitude of stories that reflect, excite and inspire us. we are looking for passionate people who want to come on a journey somewhere different.

about the role

the metadata specialist will support and work with the sbs audience data & insights team who analyse and report on viewing behaviour, demographics and trends within broadcast television environment. this important function enables sbs content teams to evaluate the effectiveness of purchase and programming decisions. ability to work to deadline, responsiveness to rapidly changing schedules, accuracy and meticulous attention to detail is key to this role.

the role is responsible for analysing and preparing weekly scheduling reports (pre-logs) for sbs, viceland and sbs food channels to provide essential data to ratings service provider nielsen. this includes extensive data coding, reviewing historical information, categorising programming, schedule amendments and clearing up any inconsistencies. in addition to this, you will be working closely with our custom research team to develop meaningful research findings derived from our insights community panel. you will also assist the sbs media team with the creation of research collateral and regular updating / compilation of reports using industry software arianna.

about you

we are looking for someone with excellent microsoft office skills, especially excel at an intermediate level.\xa0 you have a high level of attention to detail, and experience working with large volumes of data.\xa0 as you will be working on reports, you have excellent written and verbal skills, and can read, edit and check data accurately.\xa0

to be successful, you are able to manage multiple tasks at the same time, and able to prioritise and deliver work to strict deadlines.\xa0 previous exposure to sparq, arianna, ibms integrated broadcast management system (sintec) and/or nielsen events editor within a television programming environment would be highly regarded.

the benefits

  • fantastic culture
  • onsite health and wellbeing programs
  • free onsite parking, free gym membership and an active social club
  • being part of an organisation dedicated to\xa0making a positive social difference

sbs aims to inspire all australians to explore and appreciate our diverse world and by doing so contribute to a cohesive society. it\'s a purpose which drives and motivates our team and the reason we love doing what we do. click apply to take the first step in becoming a part of it.

applications close 24th may

\xa0

Title: customer analytics manager
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">we’re on the hunt for an insights and analytics manager for one of our leading financial services clients.\xa0 working for this medium-sized business, your role will be integral to the management of a small team of customer insights analysts, performing hands on modelling and analytics activities.

as customer analytics manager your role will be responsible for ensuring that this business makes appropriately timed and relevant communications to their customers by utilising data to target marketing and other interactions.

the role acts as the subject matter expert within the organisation to ensure that the campaign process is efficient, quality assured and that the interaction activity is measurable and consistently delivers roi.

role responsibilities:
  • manage the marketing analytics capability and the provision of solutions for the marketing and communications team and other key business units including: strategy, product, strategic relations group and digital.
  • lead and drive the delivery of pre-campaign analysis, campaign design, campaign reporting, predictive modelling and customer profiling to support strategic goals and objectives.
  • manage the customer experience of interactions through the ownership and deployment of a business-led set of contact rules.
  • drive and lead change and continuous improvements for efficiency of the campaign process and for improvements to return on investment.
  • lead the identification of improvements and value-add data enhancements that can help improve both the quality of, and efficient utilisation of data
  • work closely with direct reports to manage workload and prioritisation to ensure optimum support is provided to the business
  • provide your team with coaching and identify training requirements that correspond to their career development and support business needs.
your skills and experience:
  • degree and/or tertiary qualification or equivalent experience in business/statistics/analytical or related discipline
  • minimum of 5 years solid experience with direct marketing and customer management strategies
  • 5+ years’ experience working in a hands-on analytical role ideally in marketing, campaign or customer insights analysis
  • proficiency in sql, tableau, predictive modelling techniques (r, python) and cloud based technologies (e.g. redshift)
  • outstanding written and verbal communication skills with the ability to deliver complex ideas and actionable recommendations to non-technical audiences
  • demonstrably strong planning, organising and project management skills to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, prioritise work, manage time, and meet deadlines
  • sound relationship building, influencing and negotiation skills
this is an ideal role for a candidate who has some experience leading and mentoring junior analysts and who enjoys the process of creating actionable insights through complex analysis, modelling and data visualisation.\xa0 you’ll need to be consultative and have a strong commercial acumen as well as being driven to consistently deliver continuous improvement and thought leadership.
\xa0\xa0
you’ll be joining a well-balanced, established and highly successful data team who operate in a friendly and collaborative team environment.\xa0 \xa0please apply now for a confidential discussion.

Title: head of workforce analytics
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

as the head of workforce analytics at commonwealth bank of australia, your role will be to lead the workforce analytics (wfa) team to develop world leading and business relevant insights by fostering a customer service culture and developing the commercial acumen of the team.

the position will drive a culture of continuous improvement to continually innovate and find more efficient ways of delivering an effective and efficient service to hr and the cba group.

lead a world class hr analytics function to deliver the following:

  • provide the cba group with qualitative and quantitative analysis of workforce information through the mining of data, internal research and thought leadership.
  • develop and provide recommendations and advice that will lead to improved people management practices.
  • actively influence and participate with senior management to drive appropriate data driven decision-making in relation to workforce strategies.
  • support key initiatives within group people services (gps) to deliver a better day at work for all employees of the cba group.
  • oversee the hr privacy & data management program including driving procedures, awareness and compliance.
  • upskill the hr community to use the data and tools on offer to deliver a data driven hr service into the wider cba businesses.
  • oversee and take accountability for all initiatives within wfa including all preparation of board and senior leadership papers.
  • deliver significant productivity gains via a continuous improvement regime.
  • encourage green belt training participation to upskill the formal skills of the team and role model formal practices.

what we can give you

this role is a senior role within the human resources business unit. this role will provide you with further experience in the fields of analytics, innovation, productivity, and global hr service delivery. it could lead to further and broader hr or business leadership roles.

what will help you succeed

  • advanced analytical capabilities with a recognised qualification or equivalent
  • experience in designing, implementing and delivering workforce analytics and insightful reporting, always considering the “so what”
  • demonstrated track record of delivery sound business analytics and innovative thought leadership
  • strong ability to contribute and co-create in a team where the focus is on what is delivered together, not as an individual
  • ability to work autonomously; take ownership of projects with proven experience of process development and improvement
  • track record in developing strong working relationships with leaders, clients, colleagues and other stakeholders

the people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. to reflect this, we’re committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. with a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we’ll support you at every stage of your career.

Title: m&a analytics - analyst to manager
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

we are looking for a number of analytics professional at the analyst, senior analyst and manager levels.

what will your typical day look like?

you will bridge the gap between data analytics, visualisation, financial analysis, and ultimately play a key role in delivering valuable insight to your clients and support them through the entire transaction process; from acquisition and vendor due diligence, bid defence, reporting accountant services for capital market transactions, and post-deal.

you can expect to:

  • design flexible and extensible analytic solutions that encompass people, process and technology to deliver tangible value to our client’s business and m&a objectives
  • develop static and interactive data visualisations to communicate business insights
  • build your understanding of analytic methodologies/techniques, relational databases and visualisation based story telling

about the team

with our deep expertise in m&a analytics, we help clients make smarter decisions quicker, with a high level of confidence. be a part of our innovative and forward-thinking team who have developed ideal, an m&a-centric analytical tool that provides insight at every step of the m&a lifecycle, allowing us to provide clients with real-time advice to inform their big decisions.

designed to be different, our team brings diverse thinkers from commerce, quantitative finance, science, mathematics, and consulting to work together in a dynamic and creative environment.

enough about us, let’s talk about you.

you will have:

  • a degree in finance, accounting, commerce, mathematics, statistics, computer science or engineering
  • previous experience within in a finance/commerce or analytics role
  • some knowledge in a range of languages and tools such as: sql, r, alteryx, python, tableau, qlikview, github or vba
  • some knowledge in one or more of the following areas: data mining & management, predictive analytics, machine learning, optimisation, business rules engines, geospatial analysis, risk scoring & identification
  • depending on the role level, you may have some project management and leadership experience

why deloitte?

at deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. we value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

next steps

sound exactly like the sort of role for you? apply now!

if you’ve got any questions you can contact juliette jamoneau from the talent acquisition team. we’d love to hear from you.

Title: database administrator
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about the role

we have a great opportunity for a skilled database administrator to join the dba team based in either our brisbane or sydney office. reporting to the delivery manager, the core database platform team is responsible for the end-to-end lifecycle of suncorp’s sql database platforms.

accountabilities of the role will include:

  • drive automation and self-service.
  • use agile and lean practices to drive our way of working.
  • provide support to assist in the resolution of incidents.
  • identify and report operational risks to delivery manager.
  • provide robust tools and platforms to support our customers.
  • create and maintain relevant documentation including standard operating procedures for all\xa0platforms and processes.
  • highlight technology incident trends for root cause investigation.
  • perform on-call support duties as required.
  • contribute to the development and maintenance of disaster recovery and availability plans.
  • ensure compliance to corporate and bt governance standards and escalate potential breaches.
  • provide input into workload and resource planning and estimation activities.
  • participate in the ongoing capacity planning and management of the team’s platforms.

the ideal candidate will have the following qualifications, skills & experience:

  • 7+ years sql database administration (or equivalent) experience in a medium to large organisation.
  • bachelor’s degree or applicable certifications highly regarded.
  • strong microsoft sql server 2008/2012/2014/2016 experience.
  • support and optimisation of sql server queries.
  • knowledge of windows server environments.
  • scripting: tsql, powershell.
  • extensive use of failover clustering\database mirroring\always on availability groups.
  • involvement and support in major outages\critical incidents.
  • previous oncall support experience.
  • sql build experience.
  • foglight experience (desirable).
  • aws experience (desirable).

benefits of working with suncorp

  • flexible working arrangements i.e. working from home 1 day per week.
  • up to 25% off insurance, banking, superannuation.
  • flex leave of 2 days for first year and up to 4 days after 3 years of service.
  • employer of choice for gender equality.

if this sounds like we've just described you, then we'd love to hear from you. click to apply now!\xa0

Title: junior analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about the company

my client are paving the way in digital personalisation in australia. they use the full adobe suite and other proprietary data sources to find the most valuable ways of crafting impact using digital personalisation. the data analyst will work in the existing data, insights and planning team alongside data scientists and digital planners who have deep expertise in data manipulation and insight, focussing on finding key opportunities for personalisation and demonstrating the value of their digital marketing efforts.

about you

you\'ve just finished university, or maybe you\'ve been finished a little while and you\'re looking for the right role, in the right company, with the right kind of culture. you love the thought of finding the most valuable ways of crafiting impact using digital personalisation and you\'re great at crunching data, manipulating it and using stats to find a solution to a problem. you are capable of performing analysis and modelling to assist in identifying key areas of opportunity for a business and you have a high attention to detail.

need to have:

- bachelor\'s degree in quantitative discipline (or equivalent experience)

- you are self-motivated, have strong comms, you\'re professional and the ability to work as part of a team.

- you\'re able to simplify and explain complex concepts

- you have proven proficiency in python or r

- you\'re passionate about the \'why\' and use data to find it.

- you can demonstrate that you learn quickly.

nice to have:

- experience in marketing (digital or direct). seo/sem, display, social media, website properties, email marketing, campaigns.

applied skill in linear algebra and in building and interpreting generalised linear models

- familiarity with foundational statistical concepts, bayesian inference and machine learning

to find out more or to apply, email with a copy of your cv. you can also call me on 0481711152.

please apply now with a word version of your resume.

for further information call leisha morrison on 02 8246 7740.

Title: business analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

the company

our client is a leading retail business who are about to enter an exciting growth phase. with a great business culture and an impressive business here in australia they are about to undertake some exciting transformation projects. the business pride themselves on hiring only the best and they have cultivated a diverse and motivated leadership team who enjoy improving financial performance. this is an ideal opportunity for a high caliber business analyst, who loves strategy and analysis and can identify issues and deliver outcomes.

\xa0

the role

this role is highly strategic and highly commercial in nature. you will report to a supportive and talented senior manager who has a reputation of building high performance teams and will offer you continual guidance and input.

this role will involve going into this retail business and evaluating the current financial performance and processes in this division. your role is then to clearly identify the financial issues and look for solutions which will deliver the most change.

you will need to use your strong business partnering skills to influence change and work with different stakeholders.

\xa0

your background

you’re a high performer, with a strong academic background and have experience working in a retail, fmcg or product base environment and will have a good understanding of the drivers for those businesses. you will have worked as a business analyst/financial analyst preferably within a large complex business. you will have advanced excel skills and outstanding commercial acumen. naturally you will have superior communication and presentation skills coupled with the ability to work with top level executives.

\xa0

if you are keen to find out more about this position, please contact geoff balmer at richard lloyd on 02 8324 5642 quoting reference 5062 or click on \'apply now\' below.

\xa0

please submit your cv in word format and note that due to the high volume of responses we receive only suitable candidates will be contacted.

Title: technical business analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

working within our pmo and trading finance operations team, you will contribute to the delivery of a project that enhances our commodities and global markets finance reporting, taking end-to-end accountability for all analysis activities from inception through to delivery. you will bring your background and demonstrated experience in business analysis and project delivery and be confident working across finance and technology teams.

this role will see you engaging with project managers, product owners, technology team-members and business subject matter experts to gather requirements and acquire an understanding of current state processes, business context, and opportunities to improve. you’ll also work to facilitate and drive workshops to gather feedback and review business requirements, as well as document business and functional requirements, manage day to day relationships and requirements with development teams, and \xa0act as the key contact between the business and technical teams.

using your technical skills, you will:

  • drive the definition of quality of service (non-functional) requirements
  • capture which existing requirements are to be inherited by the initiative
  • work closely with the technical analysts to translate requirements into technical specifications.

to be successful in this role we would like you to have experience working on projects in the financial services industry. you will also have:

  • proven experience as a business analyst working on business change projects and/or new platform implementations
  • exceptional problem solving skills
  • ability to balance multiple competing priorities and effectively manage expectations.

in addition, a charted accountant qualification would be advantageous for this role, as well as experience working on agile projects.

if this role sounds of interest, then please contact lucy.glover@macquarie.com

the financial management group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of macquarie. the group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing macquarie's funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing macquarie's corporate communications and investor relations.

macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. at macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. the one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. if you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.\xa0

we facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. talk to us about what flexibility may be available.

Title: insights analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

at foxtel, we’re bringing television to australians like never before. our mission is to provide australia’s best value streamed and live sport, movies, drama, news and entertainment experience.

we work as a team, we’re agile and we’re accountable. we put the customer first and we’re passionate about what we do. we have fun and we’re different, better, special.

our data & analytics team is seeking a customer insights analyst to build analytical solutions that address marketing and customer challenges, enable decision making and provide interpretation of results.

your purpose

  • design, develop and deploy customer analysis, addressing key business challenges
  • develop and implement advanced analytical solutions including cluster segmentations and propensity models
  • provide interpretation of results and recommendations to meet stakeholder deadlines
  • design and implement new analysis or modelling processes
  • act as an expert in test and learn methodologies, ensuring quality insights
  • refine and optimise campaign activities based on post-campaign analysis
  • provide end to end management of analysis from briefing to solution
  • build strong relationships within the analytics community and pro-actively engage with stakeholders

    your\xa0capability

  • proven background in product and strategy insights along with experience in role which has required strategic planning of analysis
  • skillset in planning and executing large analysis projects in stages (end to end) autonomously
  • ability to develop and execute advanced analysis such as cluster segmentation and propensity modelling
  • experience working with large volumes and complexed data, cleansing where needed
  • exposure presenting to senior stakeholders with business partnering experience highly desirable
  • knowledge and participation in an agile and scrum team highly desired
  • proficient in sql, spss (or similar) and strong understanding of analytical techniques
  • tableau and r skills advantageous
  • knowledgeable in next generation data paradigms highly beneficial – big data/hadoop, nosql
  • excellent skills in interpretation of data to generate succinct and actionable insights
  • ability to translate sophisticated analysis into narratives

what’s in it for you?

we have a benefits program with something for everyone. but we’re in the entertainment business and we connect australians to all the stories they love, so what would a foxtel benefits program be without a free foxtel subscription and discounted broadband!

above all, we love entertainment and, if you do too, you’ll love working with us.\xa0 so if you’re excited about this opportunity, please click ‘apply now’.

Title: financial planning & reporting analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">about the company:
real pet food company\xa0is an aussie success story… using our local ingenuity, we’ve built a reputation for the freshest products you can find. we are serving real, locally sourced and made pet food - wet, dry, fresh, chilled and treats. no one knows pets quite the way we do.
we are a fast growing, innovative fmcg manufacturer with strong ethics and a love for keeping it real. our success comes from having a great team of people behind some of australia’s favourite pet food with brands such as billy & margot, farmers market, ivory coat & nature’s gift!
this is where you come in…
we are currently seeking a highly motivated financial planning & reporting analyst to join our finance team. the primary purpose of this position is to lead the financial planning and reporting activities for the anz division. business partner multifunctional stakeholders. in particular, consolidating and preparing management reports, budgets and forecasts for functions and cost centres, analysing overall rpfc results based on business drivers and providing meaningful analysis and commentary to assist decision making.
responsibilities include:
  • focus on consolidation and variance analysis of daily, weekly and monthly\xa0finance\xa0reports
  • assist with preparing business plans and proposals and capital expenditure requests,\xa0
  • assist in budget and forecast preparation
  • preparation of high quality and insightful reporting to management and board
  • analyse\xa0and report on performance improvement initiatives across the division, and model safe working practices
  • assist in the rollout of planning and reporting tool.
the ideal candidate:
  • you will be\xa0tertiary\xa0qualified with a degree in business, commerce or accountancy
  • ca qualified
  • experience in financial accounting, ideally within fmcg or accounting firm with exposure to fmcg clients (big 4/mid tier experience favourable)
  • proficient with excel (pivots) & ability to learn erp system (qad)
  • strong communication skills with the ability to liaise with a wide range of key stakeholders
  • belief in the importance of quality outputs as a reflection of both business and personal brand
  • attention to detail, ability to identify patterns/anomalies in large data sets
  • high level of commercial acumen and analytical skills
  • able to work independently
  • inquisitive mind
  • adaptable, flexible and comfortable with ambiguity
our offer:
when you join real pet food company you have an opportunity to make a significant contribution while developing your career within an expanding fmcg company. with the continued growth of our business, this is an exciting time to join\xa0the pack.

please note: no agencies will be considered during this process. we advise you to refrain from submitting unsolicited profiles

Title: group capital modelling analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

qbe is one of the top 20 global general insurers and is recognised as australia\'s largest international insurance and reinsurance company, with operations in 37 countries around the world.

reporting to the manager, group capital modelling, the role of capital modelling analyst will assist in the provision of high-impact actuarial services within qbe’s group capital modelling function. \xa0\xa0

with demonstrated knowledge and experience in actuarial analysis and modelling, you will be given a fantastic opportunity contribute to a wide range of capital modelling activities, with an additional focus on developing and improving modelling processes to promote the use of economic capital modelling across the wider business.

the opportunity:

  • support business decision-making processes such as, but not limited to, capital management, risk management, reinsurance, catastrophe aggregations, reserving, and asset liability management.
  • support the development and maintenance of the global capital model, including prioritisation and implementation of proposed model developments, and management of model releases.
  • perform analysis to determine the capital needs of the business.
  • contribute to the use of the model for capital allocation, risk appetite monitoring, operational risk modelling, reserving variability analysis, and analysing reinsurance options.
  • performing validation and ensuring appropriate checks are performed within processes to minimise inaccuracies.
  • crafting reports and presentations for internal management and regulators.
  • network with qbe actuarial, risk, reinsurance and exposure management functions globally, so as to enable appropriate consistency of process, and encourage the sharing and adoption of standard methodologies.

what does success look like?

  • relevant qualifications (actuarial institute or equivalent body).
  • general insurance experience (within capital, pricing or reserving) is advantageous, but other actuarial backgrounds will be considered.
  • strong understanding of industry best practice in actuarial analysis and modelling.
  • strong vba, access and sql proficiency. knowledge of igloo would also be advantageous.
  • excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • ability to produce reports and data for technical audiences and senior management. \xa0
  • highly developed communication and negotiation skills.

what’s in it for you?

you will be provided with a competitive salary package and benefits, in an environment that offers support, and encourages career development and learning.

qbe recognises the value of diversity in the workplace and supports a range of flexible work arrangements to promote a better family/life/work balance.

applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in australia, and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment. if you are a qbe employee, please inform your manager before applying.\xa0

for more information, click the apply button to submit your details.

\xa0

\xa0

Title: systems business analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

our client, a growing it solutions providor, are looking to welcome a confident business analyst to their team to drive the ongoing development of market-leading consumer-first technologies.

client details

our client is a growing it solutions providor, servicing a highly diverse client-base. a unique opportunity has arisen for a confident business analyst to join their team on a permanent basis to drive continual improvement to their organisational processes. they are proud to promote the development of their staff, and are seeking applicants who would like to see their career progress.

description

reporting into the national it manager, the business analyst will work to ensure the business operates with maximum efficiency. key duties and responsibilities will include:

  • establish, analyse and review organisational goals, policies and procedures;

  • consultation and engagement with executives, staff and board members on organisational operations;

  • analysis of business needs;

  • design and improvement of business processes and structures;

  • acting as a key liaison between management and staff;

  • drafting of emails, documentation, presentations, diagrams, flow charts, process mapping, jira records and functional specification documents, etc.;

  • ability to run requirements sessions, and stakeholder meetings; providing guidance end to end through to required outputs (e.g. acceptance or approval of wireframes, requirements, etc.); and

  • presenting to stakeholder groups and participating in showcases.

profile

to be successful in this role, you will:

  • professional business analyst with the ability to apply your analytical thinking to design innovative solutions;

  • minimum expectation of a bachelors degree or equivalent education/experience;

  • have at least 12 months experience in a similar role, with a further 5 years’ experience in it;

  • have the ability to liaise with project team members to provide insight, guidance or follow up for user stories, requirements, business rules etc;

  • portray exceptional communication skills - both written and verbal - and the ability to engage effectively with stakeholders of all levels of seniority; and

  • possess a high level of attention to detail with documentation and required processes.

job offer

  • unique opportunities for progression;

  • varied projects and opportunities for engagement with complex business units; and

  • expand your skill-set through involvement with market-leading and innovative technologies.

to apply online please click the \'apply\' button below. for a confidential discussion about this role please contact madeleine wilson on +61 2 8221 8136

Title: business analyst
Description:

Title: dealer profitability analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

at hyundai, we are driven by the belief that everyone should have access to the very best in modern mobility. we want to become a lifetime partner for our customer and not just supply some of australia’s most popular cars but also innovative future mobility solutions. our purpose is to enhance people’s everyday lives by caring for many. hyundai motor company australia continues to enrich its product line-up with vehicles that are helping to build solutions for a more sustainable future, such as nexo, the world’s first dedicated hydrogen-powered suv and the kona electric, the world’s first small electric suv.

in australia, we strive to create an inclusive, energised and team-based workplace where our values form the foundation of our culture – customer, challenge, collaboration, people and globality. we take pride in creating meaningful work experiences, encourage innovation and fresh ideas and deliver a wide range of employee benefits. community minded we created hyundai help for kids which supports a range of charities including ronald mcdonald house, clown doctors and bear cottage as well as an employee volunteering program.

the opportunity

our network development department based at macquarie park head office has a great opportunity for a dealer profitability analyst. the purpose of this role is to work closely with dealers to provide financial and data analysis and coach staff in converting financial data into performance metrics to help drive a transparent performance based culture.

about the role

reporting to the general manager, network development your key responsibilities will include:

  • providing and interpreting financial data for internal and external stakeholders
  • analysing data and making recommendations to improve profitability
  • managing the relationships with dealer profitability consultants and financial controllers
  • managing benchmarking and dealer financial composite workshops
  • reviewing dealer submissions to ensure validity of data
  • assisting dealers in their monthly reporting, mapping, allocations etc
  • data modelling and generating performance metrics
  • providing key insights to dealers
  • dealer business plan reviews
  • various financial related tasks and support work.

about you

to succeed in this role, you will need the following qualifications, skills, experience and attributes:

  • tertiary qualifications in business, accounting or finance
  • strong commercial acumen
  • high level of computer literacy with advanced excel skills
  • data modelling experience
  • good communication skills both verbal and written
  • strong relationship management, interpersonal and consultative skills with the ability to interact confidently with a range of stakeholders
  • highly organised with a proactive approach to work
  • detail and deadline oriented with the ability to handle multiple priorities at once
  • a current driver’s license.

benefits

we offer a range of benefits including:

  • competitive salary package\xa0
  • participation in our generous vehicle lease program
  • a fully equipped fitness gym with a personal trainer on site to help
  • an on-site subsidised café which offers a range of nutritious meals
  • training and development

if you are ready to take the next step in your career then we would love to hear from you. apply in confidence to careers@hyundai.com.au with dealer profitability analyst in the subject line.

\xa0

hyundai is an equal opportunity employer.

\xa0

profile

how to apply

applications close friday, 10 may 2019.

all applications will be treated with the strictest of confidence.

copyright agency encourages applications from aboriginal and torres strait islander people.

to be eligible to apply you must have an appropriate australian or new zealand work visa.

only successful applicants will be contacted.

Description:
