Title: business improvement analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about riteq

riteq is an australian founded software company focused on workforce management solutions. we operate throughout australia and internationally, providing innovative cloud-based software that delivers benefits to medium to large sized organisations across a wide range of industries.

we improve how organisations engage with and maximise the full value of their people – starting with ourselves! we passionately believe in the power of an engaged and happy workforce. by promoting community and a growth mindset, we foster empowerment, creativity and personal fulfillment. the result is in the innovation that drives and excites us – to simplify complex business problems.

about the position

we are looking for an experienced process and systems analyst who is passionate about systems and processes. reporting to the commercial finance director, you will join a commercially minded team to design, implement and roll out all internal processes within the company. furthermore, your project management experience will ensure you manage selected internal projects and initiatives that impact multiple departments – with a focus on internal systems. finally, there will be a requirement to provide governance and protocols to ensure the quality of the data in the systems is up to date and not compromised.

\xa0

responsibilities include:

  • act in accordance with riteq’s values
  • work closely with senior managers and key stakeholders to correlate existing processes and document accordingly
  • design and implement internal process improvements and guidelines that maximise productivity and efficiencies
  • communicate and champion these new processes through internal training and education
  • improve the efficiency and quality of data capture
  • seek out continuous feedback and improvement in processes, update documentation and re-educate if needed
  • act as the system owner for the dynamics 365 crm ensuring the data and usage is optimised including being responsible for:
  1. \xa0facilitating the compilation and documentation of all business requirements for the crm system
  2. assessing and prioritising business requirements
  3. configurating, implementing, rolling-out and ongoing management of the psa module
  4. coordinating internal technical resources to complete integration between internal systems in order to achieve automation
  5. coordinating internal resources and third-party vendors to ensure the success of internal system implementations
  6. ensuring that all internal projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget
  7. maintaining a matrix of all internal systems to be able to easily assess the fit and impact of any new proposed systems
  • participate and possibly manage other internal projects and initiatives

\xa0

about the skills and experience

  • previous experience as a project manager for software projects through the full software development life cycle in an agile or waterfall environment
  • worked extensively with microsoft dynamics 365 (preferable) or other crm’s
  • proficient at root cause analysis, business process mapping and flow charts
  • excellent documentation and attention to detail skills
  • be able to set priorities, analyse problems and formulate clear and effective solutions
  • excellent communication skills; verbal, written, interpretation & comprehension
  • ability to multi-task and manage time effectively
  • ability to use effective negotiation skills to resolve conflicts
  • autonomous and proactive with the ability to be a team player

desirable

  • experience in using project management and documentation sharing tools including jira and confluence

\xa0

please note that to be considered you must have full working rights in australia.

if this sounds appealing to you, please apply online by submitting your cover letter detailing your salary expectations and your cv.

Title: data analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

client

we are currently supporting a global financial services organisation, an early adopter of analytics technologies which they are using to build market leading data solutions.

the provision of analytical capability is at the forefront of this organisation, they know data is the key to their success and are committed to its development. as such they continue to invest heavily into this function.

the opportunity

working in a team of dedicated data, analytics and governance professionals you will play a key role as a data analyst supporting key reporting functions across the group.

this role is pivotal to the success of the business unit. you will bridge the gap between the business and technical teams, taking business requirements before extracting and analysing large data sets and reporting back to the business utilising a number of visualisation tools.

to be successful you will:

  • at least two years working within a data analysis position in a commercial environment;
  • outstanding sql skills with the ability to understand and write complex sql queries and scripts;
  • strong business analysis skills, enjoy bridging the gap between the business and technical teams. you must be commercially aware and be comfortable working with senior managers;
  • experience working in large environments with large and complex data sets.
  • hands on experience with a variety of data analytics and visualisations tools such as alteryx, powerbi, tableau;
  • proven financial services experience with knowledge of internal and external reporting procedures such as arpa or asic would be advantageous but not essential.
  • understanding of dw/etl environment would be beneficial.

Title: senior business analyst - clinical systems / healthcare industry
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">this highly rewarding career opportunity is available for an experienced senior\xa0business analyst to play an important role for a new systems upgrade and implementation project that will be transformational for the organisation embarking on a significant period of business change along with modernisation to their core it systems.
\xa0\xa0
as the business analyst on this new high visibility project, you will be involved in the day to day functions of gathering, capturing and identifying key business requirements as well as technical system requirements for both “existing” and “future state” systems analysis, data mapping, stakeholder management, change management, process improvement, bespoke reporting tasks, developing systems wire-frames and diagrams, and supporting new implementations and project initiatives.
\xa0\xa0
prior experience working with laboratory information systems (lis) and pathology would propel your success in this role, or other domain experience and knowledge working within health care and medical industries will also strongly support your overall success and impact.
\xa0\xa0
responsibilities include:
  • gain a sound understanding of business practices, processes and systems by liaising with users and stakeholders from all levels to enable successful partnership of the new lis system delivery.
  • creation of user stories, gap analysis and process mapping documentation, diagrams and wireframes.
  • stakeholder and external vendor management.
  • supporting the traceability of business requirements from the initial design, through to the build and testing stages.
  • determine and develop the technical and the non-functional requirements, and then develop systems integrations diagrams and workflows for future state architecture.
  • work across multiple business steams to determine and drive the best approach to achieve the desired outcomes from a business analysis task perspective.
  • provide ongoing ba support to the project team (pmo) for ongoing arising needs and project requirements, along with supporting business sme’s and stakeholders.
  • identifying of continuous improvement within your areas of responsibility.
skills & experience required for this position:
  • a bachelor’s degree or equivalent in business domains or i.t
  • 5 + years business analysis experience covering gap analysis, “as is” - “to be”, process mapping / improvement, systems analysis, impact analysis, stakeholder / vendor management, workshop facilitation etc..
  • industry experience working within the health care and medical domains.
  • exceptional presentation skills in line with working in enterprise level corporate environments.
  • experience working with visio and jira.\xa0
  • experience working with microsoft office products.
  • high level communication, negotiation and influencing skills with the ability to forge strong working relationships with colleagues, stakeholders and senior management and executives.
  • business analysis certifications such as babok will be an added advantage.
  • previous or current experience and knowledge working with pathology or lis systems will be highly regarded.\xa0
please feel free to contact matt moran if you’re keen to have a chat and learn more about this rewarding career opportunity on (02) 9199 5602 or matthew.moran@alcami.com

Title: campaign analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

about us


infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. we enable clients in 45 countries to navigate their digital transformation. with over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. we do it by enabling the enterprise with an ai-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. we also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.

\xa0

visit www.infosys.com to see how infosys (nyse: infy) can help your enterprise navigate your next.


short description:


the campaign analyst is to partner with marketing and product to identify and define the business problem; recommend optimal marketing activity; deliver campaigns using campaign management systems; and make continuous improvements based on customer insights derived from campaign analysis.

\xa0

major accountabilities of position:

•work closely with inter-departmental and cross-functional teams to provide data driven insights to optimise marketing campaigns
•work in cross functional teams to determine the most appropriate target customers and convert this into customer selection rules
•conduct pre-campaign analysis for campaigns
•make recommendations on marketing volumes and marketing strategy through data insights and past campaign results
•conduct ad-hoc analysis projects as required
•prepare documentation for all client and analysis projects, to ensure an audit trail is sufficient for a colleague to be able to review and/or reproduce analysis
•develop a high level of skill in sql to perform analysis
•share relevant knowledge with others to encourage any mutual benefit across the team
•ability to proactively look for continuous improvements through greater standardisation, speed, simplicity or automation of analysis or campaign processes.

skills required


•4+ years of relevant experience
•experience in working with large scale rbdms (oracle/teradata preferred)
•advanced sql is essential, sas will be highly regarded, r/python is desirable
•desired experience in financial services / banking / telecommunications / fmcg or related sectors. particularly in product or marketing analytics in the mortgages, personal finance (credit card/personal loan) and deposit /transaction account domains
•prior experience with campaign management software (teradata ro/cm) highly desirable
•an understanding of campaign optimisation (e.g. decision trees, responder/non-responder analysis)
•proficiency in most ms applications
•experience with direct marketing practices including experimental/test design, lead management and customer targeting

\xa0

infosys is an equal opportunity employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of gender or other attribute covered by equal opportunity legislation.

please note in order to protect the interest of all parties involved in the recruitment process,


infosys does not accept any unsolicited resumes from third party vendors. in the absence of a signed agreement any submission will be deemed as non-binding and infosys explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire the submitted profile. all recruitment activity must be coordinated through the talent acquisition department.

  • factory expertise in troubleshooting issues any in working with azure data\xa0factory azure data lake analytics and azure data warehouse.
  • experience in working with usql jobs.
  • expertise in data warehousing concepts and design
  • strong knowledge of performance tuning to define azure code artefacts for optimal performance qualifications for the cloud.
  • devops engineer include devops and or engineering experience strong azure cloud engineering background familiar with powershell and azure.\xa0

next steps

if you would like to express interest in this role, please click on the apply button now. due to a high number of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a further discussion within 3-5 business days. we thank you for taking interest in this opportunity with us. for a complete list of opportunities with cognizant visit http://www.cognizant.com/careers

Title: business analyst - bi / dw / etl

Title: sales operations analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">the opportunity\xa0

the sales operations analyst is a member of the sales effectiveness team and reports to the sales director, aon commercial. the role is responsible for analyzing, measuring and tracking sales effectiveness and results; and for the provision of leads and other relevant data to enable the business to achieve targets.\xa0

the sales operations analyst also helps drive sales growth by applying data and analytics to identify areas for expansion and continuous improvement. you will report based on your analysis of sales data and present data and findings to stakeholders and management across the business.\xa0

the salary for this role is $125,000 tfr.

key responsibilities will include:\xa0

  • integrate, compile, analyze, and evaluate data on sales performance metrics, including trends for products
  • assist with the development of objectives, strategies, and plans at achieving efficient use of organizations resources
  • analyzing and evaluating current systems and structures in the commercial sales team
  • reviewing operating procedures and advising on enhancements\xa0
  • advise on system projects, use cases, and improvements for all of the commercial sales team
  • work with aon data sources including heat maps, local market planning (“lmp”) and fp&a to develop targeting strategies for local offices
  • partner with industry vertical director, practice and product groups to identify targeted industry verticals and targeted product segments on a national, region and local level
  • research prospects and clients using analyst reports, avention, dunn & bradstreet reports, equifax data and reports, yahoo! finance, google and related sources of information to identify potential new business opportunities and develop prospect- and client-specific risk profile information
  • partner with the marketing support team to obtain prospect, client, and industry-specific reports
  • identify target lists for the various sales plays and ensure field populates into crm system
  • ensure appropriate campaigns are established in conjunction with the assigned marketing resource
  • suggest creative sales and growth ideas based on trends and pattern recognition from data analysis which results in increased sales team effectiveness and productivity
  • work with lead generation team to create prospects and appointments for bdm’s

about you

  • the ideal candidate will have a minimum of 10+ years of operations or sales experience (preferably in the financial services industry)
  • strong financial background to understand budgets, creative problem solving, display of leadership skills, and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • strong ability to work closely with various cross functional groups
  • a creative thinker who brings innovative ideas, ability to analyze complex data and recognize trends and patterns
  • excellent verbal and written communication skills, organizational skills and relationship skills
  • process-oriented person who can provide a clear, complete analysis that support sales efforts, resulting in revenue win for the company
  • qualifications include bachelor’s degree in business or related major, excellent microsoft office skills (excel, ppt, word, etc.)
  • familiarity with sales and marketing systems such as salesforce and eloqua7-10 years of sales, research, consulting, analytics experience or related formal training

about us

with close to 1600 employees, we are the largest organisation of our kind in australia. globally, we have an employee base of 50,000 people working across 120 countries. this allows us to gather the best thinking from around the world and deliver solutions locally. we provide colleagues with the support to make an impact, a team that will inspire you to achieve, and on-going opportunities for development.

aon is an equal opportunity employer and we invite you to be part of an organisation that has a diverse workplace, values continuous learning and supports many charities and environmental initiatives.\n\n

Title: digital data engineer | bigquery | python | gcp
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">our client is a well-known and rapidly expanding insurance and financial services brand based northwest of the sydney cbd. due to the continued expansion of their data & analytics arm, they are now looking to add a strong digital data engineer to their growing team on a 12-month contract!

this is a fantastic opportunity to be a part of a large, growing business and work on some truly exciting stuff!

about the role -\xa0
  • as a digital data engineer, your main goal will be to automate a number of processes within the business.
  • this will mainly focus on the automation of moving relevant data from bigquery to the company crm.
  • the scripts are already developed, you will focus more on designing the architecture that enables everything to work.
  • this is a technical role, and will not require much business or stakeholder engagement.
skills required -\xa0
  • previous experience as a data engineer will be necessary for you to be considered.
  • ideally, you will have experience in working with data from the performance of marketing or advertising, such as sem or tv.
  • experience with bigquery and google cloud platform is essential for the role.
  • python experience will also significantly aid your application but is not necessarily a must-have.
  • you will have a strong technical mindset, with excellent problem-solving skills.
what\'s in it for you?
  • an opportunity to join and influence a large business that is truly data driven.
  • a tonne of awesome benefits, including an onsite gym, free fruit, occasional free lunches, and massages!
  • work on some really exciting and interesting stuff, this business truly revolves around data and they have huge amounts to work with!
please\xa0apply\xa0with your resume via seek or send it through to\xa0data@thedrivegroup.com.au\xa0and we will be in touch for a confidential discussion!

follow us on linkedin:\xa0https://www.linkedin.com/company/thedrivegroup\xa0for the latest tech news, new jobs & our $1000 \'introduce a friend\' referral fee

Title: data scientist / analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

at vodafone, we put our customers at the heart of everything we do to give australians more choice and freedom to connect the way they want.

we are looking for an experienced data scientist to join the business intelligence and business analytics team to help us meet the growing demand for data driven insights at vodafone.

as a data scientist you will be responsible for the design, development and production of advanced analytics solutions and automation capabilities that aim to provide actionable insights to support informed decision making. reporting to the data & analytics manager you will be supporting our finance, technology, customer value management and commercial business units to draw insights from their data in bi. the type of analysis includes customer base insights, brand insights, network analytics and performance.

based in our north sydney office this role would ensure analytical solutions are delivered in an agile fashion and that data integrity is maintained across our analytics layer. you will also need strong stakeholder management abilities as you will be engaging with senior stakeholders, influencing the increased usage of advanced analytics within the organization

knowledge & experience requirements:

  • computer science, math, statistics, physics or related degree.
  • 5+ years of applied industry machine learning, optimisation and/or statistics experience.
  • strong python or r programming experience and related data science libraries (such as scikit-learn, pandas, tensorflow/keras).
  • strong sql database and code versioning (e.g., git) skills.
  • experience with data visualisation tools or frameworks i.e. qlik, tableau, d3.js, ggplot2 etc.
  • demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills.
  • an individual with energy and drive to succeed and who understand the importance of stakeholder management and setting realistic expectations.
  • customer focus and passion for delivering exceptional customer service.
  • be highly motivated, well organised and self-directed.

with vodafone, you’ll have the power to make a difference to our customers and how they connect with vodafone, we are committed to attracting, developing and retaining the best people by offering a flexible, diverse and inclusive workplace where hard work is truly rewarded. you will have access to fantastic benefits as part of a global company, including generous leave policies, leadership development programs and opportunities to grow your career. you’ll be faced with loads of variety where no two days are ever the same in a collaborative work space that helps drive innovation.

the future is exciting. ready?

when you sign up and create a livehire profile, your personal information will be collected in accordance with vodafone\'s privacy collection statement and livehire\'s personal information collection statement.

your new role plays a significant mentoring role in providing design and technical assistance to other members of the software engineering guild. you will enjoy developing and maintaining technical solutions and providing expert advice relating to technical code and applications with a focus on sql and ssis. other key focus areas include to:

at commbank, we're committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce reflecting the customers, businesses and communities we serve. as a value's driven organisation, we nurture and support our people; through focusing on skill and talent development, collaboration, flexibility and internal promotion. with service in mind at every touch point, we take accountability for the role we play in enhancing the financial wellbeing of our customers and communities. at commbank you can be you.

Description:

Title: customer development analyst - coles
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

the role

our team at mars food have are seeking a customer development analyst to join their team. this role will see you be responsible for leveraging in depth analysis of multiple data sources to identify opportunities to improve business performance, including market, category, shopper, promotions and other internal performance metrics. you will also develop and monitor reports that are shared with key stakeholders whilst providing timely recommendations to the national business manager as well as contribute to the development and execution of internal and external category reviews and other internal forums. \xa0

\xa0

predominately an internal facing role, you will drive the customer agenda and day-to-day support to the national account manager(s) and national account manager\xa0with compelling business performance analysis. your ability to influence internal stakeholders across all functions and build strong business relationships with nielsen & quantium will be critical to your success.

\xa0

additional key responsibilities:

  • develop and maintain market and shopper data reports including the creation of adhoc analysis as required by national account managers;
  • leverage insights and your strong influence to recommend solutions that will deliver mutually beneficial;
  • evaluate and monitor business initiatives to drive continuous improvement for both customer and company;
  • work closely with our data providers and act as the account team lead in coordinating and driving relevant analysis;\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0

Title: business analyst, end user computing
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

#closer #braver #faster

\xa0

analyst ii, end-user computing | employee experience | group technology

\xa0

  • iag is australia and new zealand's largest general insurance organisation and the parent company for many leading brands including nrma insurance, cgu, sgio, sgic, wfi and lumley
  • join a team whose mission is to enable world-class technology experiences for iag's 18,000+ employees and partners across australia, new zealand and our other locations
  • at iag, the employee technology experience is directly connected to overall business performance - including enabling better external customer experiences, employee productivity, talent attraction and retention, and innovation

you'll make a difference by leading the analysis activities for the end user computing (euc) team, eliciting business needs and communicating these to technology teams as required.\xa0

as a business analyst, you will support the team by ensuring business information and key processes are optimised by acting as the key liaison between business subject matter experts and technology service owners, build, delivery and support teams.

while your technical awareness in the end user computing space is important, your strong business analysis skills, knowledge in process improve and awareness in agile practices, will set you apart.

#iaggrouptech #businessanalysis #employeeexperience #processimprovement #endusercomputing

\xa0

key responsibilities

  • develop, monitor, maintain and continually improve business processes.
  • support the manager and team members with key processes including asset, service activation, cancellation and change processes
  • work with a range of stakeholders including business, commercial, finance, vendors and internal technical teams to develop well rounded investment cases
  • track benefits and take timely action to adjust course to ensure delivery of benefits
  • conduct requirements workshops with various business partners and end users identify, understand, analyse and communicate the customer process and information requirements
  • develop functional specifications, describing the process and conceptual information requirements of a business requirement via appropriate methods, models and descriptions
  • contribute to the quality of business requirements, ensuring all functional specifications and non-functional requirements are defined and captured
  • contribute to ensuring that all analysis and design tasks are carried out in accordance with the organisations agreed standards, methods and procedures
  • work closely with pilots/technology experiment led teams to ensure business requirements are understood and benefits appropriately assessed
  • build effective working relationships with initiative/project stakeholders
  • align business and technology stakeholders around objectives and priorities
  • help advise key stakeholders to enable informed decision making
  • actively participate in communities of practice

\xa0

your experience\xa0

  • over 3 years of business analysis and process improvement experience
  • prior experience with requirements gathering and workshop facilitation
  • experience or domain knowledge in end user computing
  • experience with lean six sigma
  • strong stakeholder and vendor management skills
  • good analytical and problem-solving skills
  • working knowledge of problem and incident management
  • advanced microsoft excel and microsoft powerpoint skills
  • knowledge in agile and jira
  • project management and coordination experience would be beneficial

\xa0

about us

at iag, we believe that everyone has a unique point of view to share, shaped by their life experiences, cultures and passions. we celebrate and commit to:

#proud to be me - we value difference, not sameness

#together - harnessing our collective wisdom enables us to be our best for our customers and each other

#no boxes - it's not about labels, boxes or categories. it's about building a diverse and inclusive mindset into everything we do

\xa0

let's talk

in addition to a diverse and inclusive culture, some of our benefits include 13% superannuation (3% kiwisaver), 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work program, recognition and reward program, and various corporate partner discounts.

we encourage aboriginal and torres strait islanders to apply for this position.

Title: salesforce functional analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
a bit about us
bizcover is the leading online insurance service that simplifies comparing and buying business insurance cover, so small businesses can benefit from transparent pricing, a fast hassle-free experience, and the right cover. it has been recognised in deloitte\xa0technology fast 50 as one of the fastest growing technology companies and by westpac as one of the top 20 business of tomorrow.
we are undertaking a digital transformation to reinvent and leverage our globally recognised platform to fulfil\xa0our vision of leading the global sme commercial insurance market. the business is experiencing rapid growth and is investing in all areas to drive future earnings growth.\xa0
\xa0
what you’ll be doing
as a salesforce functional analyst, you will be working as part of a small dedicated team who will be responsible for delivering projects to the business to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness.\xa0\xa0its a blank canvas at the moment so there is a lot of scope to innovate. we encourage everyone to contribute towards the technical direction and value people voicing their opinions and committing to a decision.\xa0
\xa0
key duties / responsibilities will include:
  • requirements gathering from key business stakeholders
  • salesforce configuration, testing, training and post deployment support
  • manage all levels of development (requirements definition, planning, functional design, prototyping, development, test, issue resolution, deployment, and support
  • develop user stories and process flows to support the design and development of salesforce solutions
  • participate in key meetings and facilitate workshops
  • drive end-user adoption of salesforce through exceptional documentation writing and training
  • complete the configuration for user stories within salesforce, appexchange products, or other cloud-based technologies
to be considered for this role we are looking for somebody with the following skills / experience:
  • experience using salesforce to develop client or business solutions
  • hands on experience configuring salesforce, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls
  • excellent stakeholder management skills (both internal and external)
  • proven ability leveraging analytical and problem-solving skills in a fast-paced environment
  • strong communication skills (written and verbal)
  • agile / scrum experience
  • proactive, solution focused

Title: digital business analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

forget what you know about big banks and how they do digital! we work like a start-up in a large organisation which is really great because unlike some start-ups we're fully supported to innovate and push digital boundaries. in our digital team we love agile and you will be a part of a collaborative team who work fast and are empowered to make decisions which result in the best product for our customers.

the role will see you getting involved in some truly great projects creating innovative new products. as our business analyst you will work closely with the product owner and scrum team to refine and write user stories, provide guidance to the scrum team on user behaviour and to enhance user experience. you will help drive development, identify areas for improvement through data analysis, and promote continuous improvement to enable us to achieve our strategic goals. you will also be helping the team with ensuring the quality of work being delivered is upheld, as well as sharing the responsibility of providing production support.

you will need to bring the following to this role:

  • 3+ years' experience in a business analyst role in an agile digital environment, preferably within financial services.
  • a background in digital design would be highly desirable
  • advanced problem-solving skills
  • strategic thinking and experience working directly with developers and creative teams
  • excellent communication skills
  • excellent time management skills.

we are a diverse team with backgrounds from across the world, but we all have one thing in common – we love all things tech and changing customer experiences.\xa0 we are doing great things which will revolutionise how our customers interact with us.

we collaborate, design and create amazing digital products as well as constantly improving our current digital suite to match. we want your opinion to help us go from strength to strength. you'll be a part of a team that loves the work they do and who enjoy working together. they're passionate about their work, and they're passionate about motivating each other to do great things.

about cognizant

cognizant (nasdaq: ctsh) is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process services, dedicated to helping the world\'s leading companies build stronger businesses. headquartered in teaneck, new jersey (u.s.), cognizant combines a passion for client satisfaction, technology innovation, deep industry and business process expertise, and a global, collaborative workforce that embodies the future of work. cognizant is a member of the nasdaq-100, the s&p 500, the forbes global 2000, and the fortune 500 and is ranked among the top performing and fastest growing companies in the world.

our culture

your passion, integrity and experience are integral to cognizant\'s success. you will be welcomed into a dynamic and expanding global leader in it and business consultancy where you will be valued for who you are. we take pride in our partnership with our clients, so your ability to add value and provide exceptional service to our clients are fundamental to your success. in return, you will be empowered with opportunities and support to develop your career and collaborate with people focused on innovation and ideas.

about the client and project

client is a retail superannuation client, open to any superannuation employee in australia.\xa0 it is best known for attracting high net-worth individuals. our client offers defined contributions / accumulation superannuation, income streams, insurance, and financial advice. headquartered in sydney and has more than a million members with a revenue of 4-5 billion and total assets under management around 40-50 billion. they have embarked on a transformational journey to implement oracle insurance policy administration systems and integrate it with their superannuation platform and other oracle systems in their eco system.

the role: life insurance, oipa & data analysis business analyst

  • work very closely with business to understand requirements and document the same
  • strong experience and expertise in claims management to articulate business requirements to development and testing teams effectively
  • very strong oipa business analysis skills are required
  • support testing teams with requirement clarifications and nonfunctional requirements.
  • work very closely with the business, it and other vendor teams to successfully drive the project
  • a strong understanding of life insurance, superannuation and strong knowledge and experience specifically on claims modules
  • strong data analysis skills is required to understand, profile, bring out meaningful insights
  • understand and create regulatory reporting based on data available
  • able to do gap analysis between group vs. retail claims implementation.
  • strong interpersonal and articulation skills and should be pro-active in looking ahead for issues & risks

essential experience, skills and competencies:

  • 10+ years of experience in business requirements gathering
  • experience in oipa & claims management is strongly recommended
  • strong data analysis skills required, understanding & extraction of regulatory reports
  • excellent command over written and verbal communications skills.
  • working experience with business & it teams is a must
  • conceptual knowledge of agile methodology is nice to have
  • should have excellent analytical and problem solving skills
  • self-motivated, analytical and driven to overcome challenges.
  • effectively receives, interprets and disseminates information verbally and in writing in a manner that is clear, concise and able to be acted upon
  • flexible, self – motivated and can work well independently as well as in a team in a multi-vendor environment

next steps

Title: national skin audit administrator
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">we are currently seeking a determined and experienced senior data entry operator, to take on data entry and other administration of a national skin audit produced within our sds pathology laboratories. the successful candidate will be available to commence by late may 2019.
the opportunity located at either our support office in st leonards or our laverty pathology laboratory in north ryde, this role will report to our national skin audit coordinator located in our queensland qml pathology laboratory, but receive local guidance and support from our chief operating officer in anatomical pathology who is based in st leonards. duties and responsibilities include:
\xa0\xa0
generally;
  • recording information - entering, transcribing, recording and maintaining information (written or electronic /magnetic);
  • processing information - compiling, coding auditing and information verification;
more specifically;
  • data entry - from the reverse side of pathology test request forms into the skin audit it system;
  • generating the skin audit reports once data entry for a relevant period is complete;
  • distributing skin audit reports to customer general practitioners – in print hard copy or via email;
  • working with our marketing departments and medical liaison officers to help promote the use of the skin audit report;
  • handling inquiries from audit report customer doctor practices and escalating for action if required;
about you you must be able to demonstrate:\xa0
    • sound written and verbal communication skills;
    • excellent personal organisational skills and attention to detail;
    • previous experience in a medical administration or health care role;
    • ability to work in a high data volume environment;
    • self-motivation and a commitment to work to reasonable deadlines;
  • a reliable and proactive nature;
  • ability to quickly learn and use new data-entry interfaces;
  • ms office competency;
  • a customer service focus;
this role attracts a generous remuneration package based on the boutique nature of the role

does this sound like you? if this opportunity aligns to your professional experience to date and your career aspiration for your next role, then please click the ‘apply for this job’ button today! \xa0\xa0
about us
healius limited, formerly known as primary health care, is one of australia\'s leading listed healthcare companies, providing a broad range of medical and health related services, which are offered through an extensive network of medical centres, diagnostic imaging and pathology centres.
\xa0\xa0
our\xa0pathology\xa0division, is one of the biggest pathology providers in australia, operating under a number of high value state based brands, including qml (qld), dorevitch (vic), laverty (nsw & act), wdp (wa & nt) and abbott (sa). you must have the right to live and work in australia to apply for this job. the selection process will include relevant background checks to assist in determining your suitability for the role.

Title: statistician / biostatistician
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
  • an opportunity to work with a range of health-related data including mbs and pbs data, general practice (medicineinsight) data, and linked 45andup study data.
  • experience using time series analysis is a must!
  • get involved in interesting program evaluation and analysis work using sas
  • full time, maximum term contract until 30 june 2021
  • applications close: cob\xa0wednesday 15th may\xa0

\xa0to be considered for this role, you must:

  • be an australian citizen or permanent resident\xa0
  • have experience using time series analysis

our mission

independent, evidence-based and not-for-profit, we help people make the best decisions about medicines and other medical choices to achieve better health and economic outcomes.

we provide consumers and health professionals with practical tools and information about medicines, health conditions and medical tests. our vision is to be an innovative change leader, trusted for our objective, collaborative and evidence-based approach to medicines and other medical choices.

http://www.nps.org.au

who we’re looking for

we believe it\'s important to be excellent at what we do and to recognise the skills and experience we bring. our people are passionate about our mission and are invested in our values, so you should be too. we believe that cultural fit is essential to success. these are our values, and they influence how we work together and how we reward our people:

  • courage - we have the courage to think and do things differently for a better future.
  • customer centricity - we meet the needs of our customers by listening, responding to feedback and adding value.
  • collaboration - we seek connections, share learnings and help each other succeed.
  • integrity - we are ethical, honest, transparent and open-minded.
  • accountability - we do what we say we will do.

what you’ll be doing

in this role, you will be responsible for the implementation of statistical methods to evaluate the impact of nps medicinewise programs on medication and medical test utilization, medication adherence and health outcomes. this will include time-series analysis, longitudinal data analysis, survival analysis and other statistical models. furthermore, you will develop and apply appropriate methods, for epidemiological research projects, drug utilisation surveillance and pharmaco-vigilance reporting using pbs, mbs and medicineinsight datasets.
it’s an opportunity to collaborate with a diverse, cross functional team to produce meaningful findings to those implementing programs, for reports to government and for published journal articles.

what you will need

  • experience using time series analysis is a must
  • a postgraduate degree in biostatistics or statistics
  • demonstrated experience with sas for statistical analysis, data manipulation and data visualization
  • demonstrated experience to conduct time series and longitudinal data analyses
  • good verbal and written communication skills

desirable

  • australian citizen willing to undergo baseline security check
  • experience using linked data
  • demonstrated experience using r
  • experience with health-related administrative data such as pbs and mbs
  • understanding of bayesian analysis
  • understanding of australian health care system

what we offer

Title: transformation, senior manager - data, analytics and reporting
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

amgen is committed to unlocking the potential of biology for patients suffering from serious illnesses by discovering, developing, manufacturing and delivering innovative human therapeutics.\xa0\xa0 a biotechnology innovator since 1980, amgen has grown to be one of the world’s leading independent biotechnology companies, has reached millions of patients around the world and is developing a pipeline of medicines with breakaway potential.

in 2019, amgen was named one of the world’s most admired companies by fortune magazine.

the role

reporting to the director, finance and operations, australia and new zealand you will transform technology, processes and the people to deliver integrated business data & reporting to key stakeholders and develop recommendations across the affiliate to ensure achievement and delivery of budgets, forecasts and long range plans.

you will manage performance reporting processes including dashboards, business scorecards, sales reporting, qbr submissions, and working with your team identify and implement continuous improvements.

responsibilities

  • transform newly established business data & reporting team within affiliate, developing the team and implementing optimised, integrated processes to support internal customers. ensure local policies exist and enable required training.
  • ensures timely production of business performance reports and dashboards including affiliate, brand and sales information for local management and japac as required
  • oversees monitoring of data integrity and systems integration
  • leads team to support relevant business planning and decision making processes (eg budget and le/forecasts); provides data required to enable financial and business analysis including modelling of "what if" scenarios and variance analysis.
  • leads systems inputs from finance including hyperion, gcps and data lake analytical platform.
  • ensures efficient processes and procedures are in place to produce accurate, timely reporting
  • leads f&o projects locally and may participate in japac projects
  • communicates and provides direction to affiliate about reporting trends and their business implications (including technology).
  • provides decision support to various stakeholders (bu’s, project teams, functions).leads and develops direct report(s).

minimum requirements

  • degree in accounting or business administration
  • experience of more than 5 years work in a similar position in an international pharmaceutical/biotechnology/healthcare environment
  • experience in finance including performance reporting, planning, systems utilization• experience in leading change and building a team
  • track record of successfully establishing and maintaining cross functional business processes
  • fluency in english, both in written and oral communication
  • excellent user of office programs including word, excel, powerpoint• experience with olap tools eg business objects, tm1, cognos or similar
  • experience with sap, hyperion or similar
  • presentation skills

preferred requirements

  • studies specialised in finance (financial analysis, controlling, accounting, consolidating)
  • mba or similar further education would be an advantage

closing date - friday 10th may, 2019

Title: it audit manager + data analytics
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

this is a fantastic opportunity to join one of australia’s most recognised brands. due to a divisional restructure the need for an it auditor with strong data analytics capability have been recognised. you will report directly to the head of audit and will be part of a nimble, yet highly effective internal audit team. the main focus of this engagement will be the development of leading edge analytical capabilities that will assist the audit team to work more efficiently and effectively and to achieve more powerful audit insights that will ultimately to drive improvements in the business control environment.

ideally, we are seeking a candidate who is strong on continuous control monitoring / data analytics using various technologies such as sql, acl, idea , sas, tableau, r etc. the position will also be involved in it audits and some project assurance work.

some specific tasks will be to:

  • act as a subject matter expert regarding advanced analytics, providing advice to internal stakeholders and support to special projects as required;
  • be the thought leader and support in the areas of continuous monitoring / auditing and dynamic and emerging risk assessment techniques;
  • act as a project manager for designated group audit analytics projects;
  • execution of it audits and project assurance audits;
  • continuous performing assessments of processes to identify inherent risks in order to recommend procedures for improvement;
  • stake holder management internally and externally (service providers). the ideal candidate will be a subject matter expert in data analytics and continuous control monitoring. you will hold a similar position in a complex business or be in the profession in the it audit / data analytics or forensic teams. you will have strong evaluation, design and mapping skills and will constantly strive to improve the effectiveness of controls and processes. it is essential that you have strong communication skills in order to communicate to clients the degree of gaps and deficiencies observed. you need the ability to bring “technical jargon” into laymen’s terms.

apply via direct link or e-mail me on taniab@ethosbc.com.au. this opportunity will also lead the successful candidate to work on some exciting and cutting-edge projects with future growth into the broader business.

for further information on this role or to confidentially apply, please contact tania barnard on 02 8227 9200 or apply directly via the apply for this job button. only word format resumes will be accepted.

Title: data and insights reporting analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

since listing on the\xa0asx in june 2017, we at\xa0elmo cloud hr and payroll (asx:elo)\xa0have gone from strength to strength to establish ourselves as the fastest growing tech company in the region. this makes elmo a very exciting place to work, and as a result of the sustained growth we are looking to hire a data and insights reporting analyst.

the primary function of the data insights & reporting analyst is to:

  • support report insights consultants to produce reporting for client survey projects.
  • utilise and assist in refining existing processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness, to produce both standardised and custom reporting for clients through the use of excel models / business intelligence (bi) tools / and our own propriety survey software - peoplepulse.
  • analyse survey data to identify and communicate key insights and learnings.
  • take part in the development of new products for the report insights division.

the core role of the data insights & reporting analyst includes but is not limited to: \xa0\xa0\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

  • ensure the quality and accuracy of data through established qa process and proof-read reporting work.
  • assist the report insights consultants with the\xa0coordination and delivery of the report project schedule.
  • work with report insights consultants to shape the organisation\'s approach to surveys and reporting / models.
  • analyse data and produce reports for clients, meeting deadlines according to reporting project schedule.
  • use advanced excel / data models to feed a range of different reporting templates in pdf and powerpoint formats, provide improvements where identified.
  • categorise free-text survey comments into key themes ensuring accuracy for successful future categorisation.

positional qualifications, attributes and skills:

  • 1-3 years commercial experience in market research and/or workforce surveys\xa0and/or data analysis roles.
  • tertiary qualifications in a related field.
  • advanced excel (e.g. filter data, pivot tables, formulas, and macros) and powerpoint skills to build and maintain models, ensuring streamline production of reports.
  • experience in bi platforms (such as tableau), spss, and an understanding of the statistical analysis of correlations in data, highly valued but not essential.
  • a keen understanding of data visualisation and data quality management best practice.
  • high attention to detail – a necessity for the accurate cleaning and weighting of data files and reporting.
  • experience working to deadlines and managing multiple projects.
  • ability to work to processes and thorough testing to ensure extremely high levels of accuracy in reporting.
  • enjoy critical thinking and the opportunity to be innovative.
  • proven ability to communicate complex information, in a simple yet compelling way.
  • a can-do attitude and a curious mind.

become an elmonian and enjoy the benefits!

join us on our journey and enjoy the benefits of working in the heart of the sydney cbd, in our brand-new office equipped with meditation, yoga, and cafe facilities (including free barista-made coffee and morning tea) or take a breather with colleagues for a game of pool or table-tennis at your leisure. reap the benefits of regular training and self-improvement programs, in a friendly and open environment.

key to this role is an awareness of data privacy and security as you are dealing directly with sensitive data in accordance with elmo security policies.

Title: software & data integration practice manager
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
  • $180-200,000 package per annum + benefits
  • manage a high performing team of software architects & engineers
  • promote cutting edge technologies and capitalise on 600+ active customers
about the company

at ac3, our purpose is to make technology real, and as the leaders in secure multi-cloud solutions, we get to do this for our customers every day. we are an australian owned ict msp, with offices in sydney, melbourne and auckland, servicing over 50% of the nsw state government and over 700 enterprise customers.
we are a growing business with a focus on three technology areas – cloud and infrastructure, cyber security. and software and data integration. we support our customers at every step of their technology journey, from consult, to procure and build, to run and optimise and talent management.

we’re a company that believes in doing the right thing by our customers and each other, and delivering on our promises. beyond getting to work with cool tech and cool clients, you’ll also find real recognition and flexible work that works for you.

about the role

joining our professional services team, you\xa0will be providing guidance and bring your technical expertise across all things software & data integration related and promote our capability both internally and externally.\xa0

this is a strategic area of our business. you will manage the software & data integration practice, team members, growth and profitability.

some of your key responsibilities will be:\xa0
  • promote ac3 through thought leadership: through webinars, blogs, social media posts, presentations at meetups and customer events
  • become a trusted advisor within key customer accounts and assist them with their cloud journey
  • build consultancy offerings and delivery model, ensuring it is aligned with industry and vendor best practice methodology
  • drive technical qualification, scoping, estimation, design and architecture of new or existing opportunities
  • work with projects team to deliver successful customer outcomes
  • manage, lead and develop a high performing team: software & data integration architects and engineers, application support engineers, business & quality assurance analysts, and agile project managers.
  • collaborate with higher management to develop financial forecasts and budgets for the p&l
  • develop technical designs that challenge the status-quo and support customer innovation

skills & experience

the ideal candidate will be highly motivated, solution-oriented, collaborative and approachable with a focus on best practice:
  • experience and confidence in a customer facing role or consultative pre-sales role
  • experience in software development and leadership, in addition to experience in software consulting
  • experience managing multiple tasks in a busy environment and ability to work under pressure
  • demonstrated experience managing and leading people
  • creative, strategic and thoughtful "hands-on" leader with "can-do" leadership approach
  • strong customer focused problem solving skills
  • expertise working with cloud-native architectures, including public cloud paas / iaas, rest api, micro-services architectures, open source platforms\xa0
  • exceptional oral and written communication skills, with proven document/report writing ability
  • expertise in multiple programming and development frameworks such as java, spring boot, spring mvc, nodejs, oas 2.0+, python, etc.
  • excellent knowledge of automated testing frameworks and tools for software & data integration projects such as mockito, selenium, jmeter, postman etc.
  • expertise in multiple relational and non-relational databases (e.g. oracle, mysql, postgresql, redshift, mongodb etc.) and open-source big data processing frameworks (e.g. apache hadoop, spark, storm, cassandra, impala etc.)
  • expert-level devops knowledge working with :
    • source version control tools (git, subversion, tfs, bitbucket, etc.)
    • containerisation technologies (docker)
    • orchestration engines (kubernetes / openshift/ rancher / swarm, jenkins ci/cd, octopus, etc.)
culture

as number 28 on australia’s great places to work list, it’s clear that culture is a top priority at ac3. we approach business with family values, which means people here have real relationships that go beyond work. we believe it’s important that everyone is heard and treated with respect, whether you have the next big idea or simply a question. we keep it simple and live by our fours ways of being:
  • own it: if i say i’m going to do it, i do it. and i give it my all.
  • better it: i take the current status quo and make it better.
  • brave it: i listen, say what needs to be said, and do the right thing. especially when it’s tough.
  • enjoy it: i take my work seriously, but don’t take myself too seriously.
we’d love for you to experience the ac3 way for yourself!

benefits
  • work for a genuine leader in the public cloud arena
  • work with the best cloud experts in australia
  • endless opportunities to learn & develop\xa0
  • flourish as a thought leader in the industry and collaborate with key innovators in the industry
  • manage and grow an already high performing team
  • capitalise on 600+ current active customers\xa0
  • genuine flexibility in the workplace\xa0
  • convenient sydney cbd location
  • $180-200,000 package per annum + benefits

if you are interested in this position and believe that your experience is closely aligned with the requirements listed, then please forward your application via the apply button.

all positions at ac3 must undergo a criminal background check.

Title: environmental reporting analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

sustainability solutions is a leader in environmental and sustainability services for the property industry offering a wide range of solutions to owners, occupiers, developers and investors. sustainability solution’s experienced team of specialists and engineers work collaboratively with our clients to develop policies, strategies and programs that drive tangible environmental performance and cost reduction outcomes for our clients. our core services include performance reporting & analytics, strategy & client advisory and engineering & optimisation.

the environmental performance reporting & analytics position is now available in cushman & wakefield’s sustainability solutions team. as an analyst you will undertake tasks to support the delivery of a range of environmental reporting services.

about the role:

Title: cash control analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

see yourself in our team:

wealth management brings together the group’s funds management and distribution capability as well as domestic insurance and financial advice business support divisions.

these include the well-known brands of colonial first state, colonial first state global asset management, and comminsure.

this role is within colonial first state (cfs) and sits within the fund services division. fund services has 200 staff and is responsible for the production and provision of fund data to asset managers and investors within cba funds. the area is broken down into several areas.

  • investment operations
  • fund accounting
  • fund operations
  • investment review services
  • implementation management
  • statutory reporting
  • operational risk management
  • interfunding

cash control sits within the fund operations area, its vision is to deliver accurate reporting and enable timely clearance of reconciliation exceptions relating to investor flows feeding through our various application/clearing accounts.

cash control performs reconciliations across all cfs first choice, essential super and group super products.

\xa0

do work that matters:

reporting to the team leader - cash control, each cash control analyst is responsible for the daily reconciliation & peer review of a subset of the 40+ application/clearing bank accounts covered by the team.

  • daily tasks includes:
  • balancing the account;
  • exception management e.g. investigation, escalation and clearance of exceptions;
  • peer review of colleagues’ reconciliations.

reconciliations are performed using the system accurate nxg, which receives data feeds from both our registry system and bank account statements. based on a series of rules developed by the team the system seeks to auto-match items leaving only the unreconciled exceptions to be investigated and resolve.\xa0

we're interested in hearing from people who:

  • have a minimum of 12 months experience in managed funds industry, specific reconciliations or client administration experience favourable
  • have strong interpersonal & communication skills
  • possess strong attention to detail & analytical skills
  • have the ability to communicate with all levels of staff
  • have a proven ability to identify and implement continuous improvements
  • hold knowledge of key cfs systems e.g. fms registry, accurate\xa0 nxg, insight

if you can picture yourself being part of this high performing team and role please apply using the link or refer to a friend.

we offer you the opportunity to expand your career surrounded by a skilled and successful group of individuals. our remuneration packages are highly competitive and you will have access to a range of exclusive and exciting benefits.

the people, businesses and communities we serve are wonderfully diverse. to reflect this, we’re committed to hiring a similarly diverse workforce. with a focus on inclusion, accessibility and flexibility, we’ll support you at every stage of your career.

partners in performance (pip) is a global management consulting firm that works hand-in-hand with our clients to rapidly deliver sustainable results in business performance. our firm has real scale and a demonstrated track record with reach across australia and new zealand, south east asia, africa, north and south america, europe and middle east. whilst sydney is our headquarters we have a truly global footprint. as a firm, we are about unleashing potential in our clients and our people.

the role

this is a pivotal role within the sales and marketing team as you will have end to end responsibility for reporting, data integrity and the provision of meaningful insights on how pip\'s sales and marketing activities can be optimised.

using your senior analytics experience, you will liaise with directors to utilise and adapt existing key sales metrics to gain insight into and improve seller efficiency and effectiveness. you will work with directors and heads of departments to design and report on marketing kpis to gain insight into and optimise sale campaigns, social media and the website.

key role objectives;

  • continue to improve systems to improve sales reporting plus sales, opportunity and engagement workflow requirements (approx. 10% focus)
  • maintain data integrity of systems – salesforce and hubspot (approx. 10% focus)

\xa0

candidate requirements

the role will appeal to a senior sales and marketing analyst who is looking for a more autonomous, varied and fast-paced role. it is a standalone analyst role within the sales and marketing team. the key requirements and competencies for success are: -

  • minimum of 5 years\' experience of providing sales and marketing analysis (essential)\xa0
  • very strong power bi and excel skills required (essential)
  • degree qualified in relevant discipline\xa0
  • demonstrated experience of \'owning\' end to end systems and reporting
  • outstanding interpersonal skills and confidence dealing with people at all levels, including director and head of departments level. this role also has exposure to the md of pip who takes a strong interest in sales reporting as well as directing new reporting requirements
  • a strong and logical approach to problem solving applied to reporting and process workflows
  • enthusiastic, flexible attitude and team approach plus strong customer focus.
  • ability to deal with multiple and changing priorities
  • solid attention to detail but also knowing when to apply 80/20
  • ability to work autonomously given this a standalone analyst role within the global sales and marketing team.
  • experienced in salesforce (crm) and e-marketing tools (e.g. hubspot, google analytics, pardot) would be highly regarded.\xa0

this role will appeal to an experienced senior sales and marketing analyst who is looking for a more autonomous, varied and fast-paced role - a role that you truly own!\xa0

t is a rare opportunity to work across a high-growth, global business that is committed to the development of its people, utilizing your past experience and continuing to build your career. if you would like to join us as we continue on our exciting growth journey, then we welcome hearing from you.

interested?\xa0\xa0

as a senior analyst in ges, your primary focus is on identifying and improving operations between the internal deloitte networks to streamline our services to our clients. you will work alongside the global management team to continue overhauling processes, which improves efficiency while maintaining quality.

at deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. we value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

you will join a diverse team with one thing in common – we love all things tech and are obsessed with quality\xa0and the customer. you will love agile, as much as we do, and you will be energised by a collaborative group that works at a fast pace and are empowered to make decisions that result\xa0in the best solutions for our customers. you enjoy bringing people together,\xa0getting to know them\xa0and understanding the role they play in enabling and supporting an awesome payments capability.\xa0you love to share the wealth of information you have uncovered with our team, from specialists through to senior executives.

in this role you will work closely with the stakeholders, product owner and scrum team to ensure features and stories are refined and ready, with acceptance criteria complete. you will develop a true understanding of our customer and employee experiences and promote and maintain the focus on quality and human centred design delivery.\xa0you will be the one to provide guidance to the team on user and system behaviours and define and help clarify stories to help drive development.

you will have the technical skills to be able to dive into sql or code to verify and compliment your understanding, and a background in development would be a great advantage. using your technical and analytical skills, you will need to understand the integration patterns of our platform and critically assess the impact that changes will have on our customers. additional experience with payments or financial products would be highly regarded.

our success is measured as a team and you will be willing to use your diverse skills to work collaboratively to get things done and achieve team goals.

banking and financial services comprises our retail banking and financial services businesses. the group operates predominantly in australia and is organised into four business divisions: personal banking, wealth management, business banking and macquarie leasing. we provide personal banking, wealth management, business banking and vehicle and equipment leasing products and services to retail customers, advisers, brokers, dealer groups and businesses.

macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. at macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. the one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. if you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.\xa0

we facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. talk to us about what flexibility may be available.

Title: business analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

amcs group is a global leader in business operational optimisation software and vehicle technology for the recycling and waste management industry. amcs’ software is managing over €3bn worth of transactions annually, over 14,000 vehicles and in excess of 3,000 sites. employing over 500 people, we have operations in ireland, uk, denmark, netherlands, sweden, us, australia and new zealand. to support the continued growth of the business, we currently have a requirement for a\xa0business analyst\xa0within the anz/asia region.

we are actively seeking an experienced business analyst who could work collaboratively with anz/global technical delivery teams to successfully deliver projects in australia and internationally within the region. this role will report into the head of services & delivery anz. \xa0our ideal candidate is a team player who is enthusiastic about delivering complex business solutions, comfortable challenging the status-quo with a constant appetite for new knowledge and skill accumulation.

requirements & responsibilities:

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0showcase and foster amcs core values - innovation, dedication and loyalty.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0strong requirements gathering and workshop facilitation skills.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0communicate effectively with internal/customer stakeholders across geographies at all levels.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0ability to organise and conduct effective meetings internally and customer environments.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0high energy work ethic with a never say die attitude.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0effective written and verbal communication skills, including ability to influence and negotiate.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0ability to run product demos to the customer.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0comfortable working actively towards achieving personal kpis based on billability and revenue targets.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0prior technical experience as a developer or a dba would certainly come in handy.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0be expected to work with product and industry subject matter experts in order to understand, propose, educate and help implement new business processes.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0understand customers\' needs, determine solutions to meet those needs, and document these solutions in the form of user stories, use cases and technical specifications that can be implemented by the delivery team.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0develop and recommend solutions and strategies, based on the analysis of customer business goals, objectives, and needs.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0carryout scope verification and internal acceptance testing (iat) which includes developing test cases and test strategy documentation.

  • good grasp of solutions modelling through uml and a broad toolkit of analysis methods/artefacts.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0work closely with the implementation, development, product, devops and vtech teams to address questions and provide clarification on requirements during delivery of projects.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0prepare detailed requirement specification documentation with use cases, presentations, and other documents to explain requirements internally and externally.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0ensure all reported data and information are accurate, consistent, relevant and timely.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0elicit, evaluate, prioritise, analyse, and document client\'s business needs and requirements.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0excellent analysis and problem-solving skills.

  • this role would primarily be based in sydney with occasional work duties from customer offices locally and overseas as the need arises.
  • occasional interstate / international travel might be required at a short notice.

qualifications, experience, knowledge and skills:

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa03+ years of experience as a business analyst

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa05+ years of experience in the software industry, preferably working for crm or erp vendors.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0degree in computer science or related field is strongly desired.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0industry-recognised qualification such as iiba-ccba or cbap or other equivalent would be beneficial.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0experience in ms office and visio or similar tools.

·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0understanding of it infrastructure and enterprise solution concepts.

Title: treasury systems analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">this is a rare opportunity to join a leader in the financial services sector who have a strong name in the australian market. this blue-chip organisation offers services in acquisitions, settlements, loan origination, portfolio management and principal finance. having developed a scalable platform, this organisation is focused on providing secured lending products, different to the major banks.
\xa0\xa0
our client is looking for an exceptional individual to join their team in sydney as a treasury systems analyst. working closely with the manager for this area, you will provide financial modelling for new business products to assist with decision making by business leaders. this is a fast-paced environment, with exciting new projects happening and you will appreciate the variety and career opportunities this role offers.

specific responsibilities will include:
  • treasury systems support
  • developing financial models for treasury division including waterfall cash flow modelling
  • providing financial analysis to the business including developing relationships
  • data analysis of data sets that may be presented to the business for review
  • reporting and presentation – development of reports showing impact of financial models

in return you can expect a rewarding role with a professional team, and an organisation that values team contribution. central location with lots of employee benefits.
