Title: entry level commercial analyst - princess cruises
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

princess cruises is the third largest cruise ship operator in the world and part of the world's leading cruise holiday company, carnival corporation (represented in the asia pacific region by carnival australia). known as the destination experts, princess cruises visits over 350 ports around the world. locally, princess cruises has operated cruises for more than 15 years and has five ships departing from sydney, brisbane, melbourne, adelaide, fremantle and auckland.\xa0

\xa0

known internally as the market planning analyst and reporting to the director of market planning, the role is responsible for supporting the market planning and revenue management teams in asia pacific. the successful individual will create reports for relevant analysis, draw insights from market data, conduct pricing recommendations, maintain market models, and create/execute new pricing strategies for the brand.

\xa0

specific responsibilities will include:

  • provide strategic analysis and pricing recommendations for fit inventory
  • create, review and maintain suite of reports to track voyage bookings
  • work closely with the svp princess cruises asia pacific and the market planning director to maintain annual yield targets
  • keep abreast of the industry's marketing activities including pricing, itinerary and policy analysis, using these insights to support deployment and pricing recommendations
  • coordinate team priorities, deadlines and communication with the market planning team and provide timely turnaround of information to the marketing team
  • ensure content accuracy of marketing collateral, including voyage information, terms and conditions, offer dynamics and pricing in a timely manner
  • inventory and yield management of fit inventory

\xa0

\xa0we encourage applications from highly intrinsically motivated individuals with a ‘can do' attitude and a willingness to learn, who bring:

  • tertiary qualifications in economics, finance, accounting or similar
  • 1-2 years' experience in an analytical role, preferably within a commercial function
  • very strong numerical and analytical skills, with a high attention to detail
  • superior planning, prioritisation and organisation skills
  • intermediate excel skills, with some knowledge of relational databases or ms access
  • an undoubted thirst for knowledge, coupled with a strategic mindset
  • excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • superior interpersonal and relationship building skills
  • excellent levels of initiative, who aren't afraid to ask questions
  • strong levels of resilience, and a proven ability to work under pressure and multitask to deliver to deadlines
  • flexible availability, as this role does contain fluctuating workloads at times
  • name your favourite holiday destination in your application

Title: data analyst, digital advice
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

do you enjoy the challenge of solving complex problems that can have a direct impact on the success of a business?

as a data analyst, you’ll join a dynamic digital advice team who are passionate about delivering macquarie’s next generation robo-advisor.

working within an agile and collaborative environment, you will contribute to the delivery of leading-edge automated investment advice solutions for forward thinking financial advice practices. day to day responsibilities will include designing and implementing processes to update and maintain a global securities database as well as identifying and managing new datasets that support and enhance our product offering.

you’ll have the opportunity to work with the latest software technologies and market data providers, as well as working alongside talented engineers and highly experienced financial professionals to understand problems and deliver game changing solutions to our customers.

bringing with you a strong interest in financial markets and an analytical mind, you will utilise your skills to support and influence the future of our product offering, making it more efficient and more reliable whilst continually enhancing its’ capabilities. knowledge of excel, python/pandas or excel are advantageous but not a requirement.

banking and financial services comprises our retail banking and financial services businesses. the group operates predominantly in australia and is organised into four business divisions: personal banking, wealth management, business banking and macquarie leasing. we provide personal banking, wealth management, business banking and vehicle and equipment leasing products and services to retail customers, advisers, brokers, dealer groups and businesses.

macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. at macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. the one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. if you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.\xa0

Title: senior data governance officer
Company: department of family & community services nsw
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

senior data governance officer

temporary full time - up to 12 months with possibility of extension

clerk grade 9/10

their futures matter



location: redfern, nsw\xa0

salary range: clerk grade 9/10 - $108,044 - $119,061 pa, plus employer\'s contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading
contact: (02) 9377 6562 or paula.cheng@theirfuturesmatter.nsw.gov.au ? paula cheng
closing date: 11:59pm on sunday, 19^th may 2019.\xa0


\xa0

  • responsible for the day-to-day activities for the development and implementation of data governance policies, practices, procedures and systems that will ensure tfm meets its legislative and compliance obligations


  • full-time, temporary 12-month position with possibility for extension\xa0in accordance with the government sector employment act 2013.
  • redfern location close to redfern and central stations




about us\xa0


this is an exciting time to join the their futures matter (tfm), which leads a nsw government landmark reform to deliver improved outcomes for vulnerable children, young people and their families.\xa0our vision is to create a service system that delivers coordinated, wrap-around and evidence-based supports for children and families to transform their life outcomes.

\xa0

\xa0

central to this vision is our investment approach that will direct and prioritise whole-of-government funding to deliver targeted solutions that achieve measurable and meaningful outcomes.\xa0for more information on the work we do at tfm, go to\xa0www.theirfuturesmatter.nsw.gov.au/about-their-futures-matter

\xa0

\xa0

about the roles


the senior data governance officer is responsible for the day-to-day activities for the development and implementation of data governance policies, practices, procedures and systems that will ensure tfm complies with the privacy and personal information protection act 1998 (nsw)(ppip act) and health records and information privacy act 2002 (nsw)(hrip act).

\xa0

reporting to the manager, data governance, the incumbent will prepare data privacy and security advice and guidance and provide support to tfm staff and executives. in addition, the senior data governance office will work with external privacy and security specialists, and liaise with external and internal stakeholders in the conduct of data privacy and security activities.

\xa0

to be successful in this role the ideal candidate will have:\xa0

\xa0

  • demonstrated experience in data governance, data management or data privacy and security
  • good knowledge of nsw privacy legislation and information security policies
  • good knowledge of and experience in compliance\xa0
  • good knowledge of and experience in process management
  • demonstrated strong project management and organisational skills, including monitoring and reporting on project plans, milestones and deliverables.
  • ability to handle multiple tasks, with proven self-initiative and problem solving abilities
  • proven track record of quality performance in highly pressured environments\xa0
  • good presentation and communication skills both written and verbal\xa0\xa0
  • strong interpersonal skills with experience of working in an agile team environment where working collaboratively, effectively and efficiently is critical to success\xa0
  • tertiary qualification in information management, business administration, law or other related disciplines is preferable.

click here to download the role description and supplementary information about the position. please refer to role description for focus capabilities for this position.

\xa0

a recruitment pool may be created to fill similar roles for both ongoing and temporary opportunities if and as they arise.

\xa0

\xa0

applying for the role


please submit a current resume (no more than five pages) and a cover letter (no more than two pages) describing how your qualification, knowledge, skills and experience will make you a great fit for the job. you should also include in your application the names and contact details of two referees who could reasonably comment on your capabilities required for this position.

\xa0

closing date: 11:59pm on sunday, 19^th may 2019.


contact: paula cheng, director investment modelling, research and evaluation p: (02) 9377 6562 or e: paula.cheng@theirfuturesmatter.nsw.gov.au

\xa0

our office is an agile working environment, with a mix of spaces to foster collaboration or support focused work, according to individual and project needs.



our commitment to diversity and inclusion


\xa0
tfm is committed to building a workplace culture that values diversity and inclusion. we actively promote the employment of people with disability, aboriginal and torres strait islanders, lgbti and other diversity groups.

tfm encourages applications from people with disability and will provide reasonable adjustments in our recruitment processes and in the workplace.

if you need an adjustment in the recruitment process, please call or email the contact person listed below, and also advise us of your preferred method of communication.

thank you for your interest in this position. we look forward to receiving your application.

\xa0

Title: solutions architect - senior (cloud/data
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

change people’s lives and love what you do!\xa0 cochlear develops world-leading medical devices that help people hear. as a top 100 medical device company and the market-leader in implantable hearing devices, more people choose a cochlear-branded cochlear implant system than any other. our employees tell us that the number one reason they enjoy working for cochlear is the opportunity to make a difference to people’s lives.

this is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced senior solution architect to work in our it architecture team at our cochlear global hq. you will work closely with project managers, agile delivery teams and business partners to define solutions and guide their implementation.

key responsibilities

the senior solution architect role provides technical direction for projects from concept to completion along with input to strategic architecture roadmaps and reference architectures.

in order to be a successful candidate for this role you need to have a passion for technology and experience in modern cloud data solutions. your previous designs are elegant in their simplicity and have enabled others to build upon the foundations you laid. you understand modern architectures and the rationale behind those architectures. you are also prepared to design solutions involving legacy systems too.

you have experience with waterfall and agile delivery methodologies and understand how to work in either. in your previous roles you have advocated test and deployment automation. you have also had some exposure in operational roles and understand why it is important to do the job properly

you are not afraid to challenge the status quo but understand the balance between perfection and practicality. you understand your audience and can communicate potentially complex solutions to a wide range of stakeholders.

in this role you will be responsible for:

  • developing reference architectures for architectural domains
  • lead the definition of the solution architecture and deliver conceptual and detailed designs to resolve the business requirement.
  • close collaboration on project implementation with project managers, business stakeholders and delivery teams
  • constantly look for opportunities to leverage and reuse existing it capabilities, services and solutions where appropriate
  • identify and investigate opportunities to utilize and integrate emerging technologies to provide cost effective flexible solutions.
  • assist the it broker team and associated business stakeholders in the development of business cases and value propositions to support the proposed solutions
  • wherever possible, advocate the architecture services, processes across the global information technology teams and business functions by means of sharing documentation, providing advice or impromptu education
  • contribute ideas on systems and process methods to improve information technology products and services

the successful candidate will have the unique opportunity to shape cochlear’s flagship business. you will have the benefit of working across multiple interesting and innovative projects, with significant career development avenues for the right person. cochlear offers a supportive and collaborative working environment with ample opportunity to progress.

\xa0

key requirements

  • a bachelor’s degree in computing or engineering
  • demonstrated experience as a senior solution architect

  • demonstrated experience in identifying, researching, evaluating and recommending new

    and emerging technologies

  • strong enterprise applications background, with an ability to grasp the big picture
  • project planning and specification skills, together with problem solving and analysis

  • excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to interact professionally

    with executives, managers and subject matter experts

desired requirements

  • post graduate qualification
  • architecture certification such as togaf
  • demonstrated 3-5 years experience as a senior solution architect
  • previous experience in project teams using agile and waterfall delivery methodologies.
  • strong technical background in any of the following:

- cloud data platforms (snowflake, redshift, bigquery)

- data science platforms (spark, r, jupyter notebooks)

- devops (ci/cd pipelines, immutable architecture, devsecops )

- integration patterns (mdm, etl/elt, ipaas)

- stream processing (kafka, kinesis etc)

- test automation

- data governance

- machine learning / artificial intelligence

- cloud/networking/infrastructure automation (aws and on premise)

\xa0

cochlear summary

cochlear’s mission is to help people hear and be heard. around the world, more people chose a cochlear-branded hearing implant system than any other. our employees tell us that the number one reason they enjoy working for cochlear is the opportunity to make a difference to people’s lives. learn and grow with us as we tackle the most complex challenges in helping people to hear now. and always. cochlear is the global market leader in implantable hearing solutions including cochlear implant systems (ci) and bone anchored hearing aids (baha™).

if you feel that you have the skills and experience to be successful in this role and take on new challenges to build your career with cochlear, please start your application by clicking the apply button below.

Title: gm strategy, insights and analytics
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">client details
better use of data and technology can help people live healthier, happier and more productive lives. digital health can make a real difference to people’s health by giving them greater control and better access to information. tasked with improving health outcomes for australians through the delivery of digital healthcare systems and the national digital health strategy for australia, the australian digital health agency (the agency) commenced operations on 1 july 2016. the agency is responsible for national digital health services and systems, with a focus on engagement, innovation and clinical quality and safety. our focus is on putting data and technology safely to work for patients, consumers and the healthcare professionals who look after them.
\xa0
description
the gm strategy, insights and analytics will play a pivotal role in the execution of the strategic aims and outcomes for the agency. working closely with and directly for the chief digital officer, and other members of the executive leadership team, this role focuses upon stakeholder engagement, evidenced based evaluation, review of legislation and subsequently policy direction, the innovation roadmap and leadership of a tight knit group of professionals that anchor the organisations strategic outcomes. \xa0
\xa0
profile
this position is both a strategic and hands on leadership role focused on delivering outcomes in line with the strategic plan for the agency.\xa0 it is essential to have experience working within the health sector. this could be a senior leadership capacity or as a consultant providing services. an understanding of the australian health policy framework would also be an advantage. a critical component of the role centres around aligning operational outcomes with the strategic direction. problem solving skills and a solution based approach are critical attributes.\xa0you will be an excellent communicator with an ability to manage and influence senior stakeholders including government and peak industry bodies. another key aspect of the role is the ability to engage with a wide range of stakeholders within government and the health sector.

to apply, or for more information, please contact simon meyer at futureyou on 02 9195 2323

unsw is currently implementing a ten year strategy to 2025 and our ambition for the next decade is nothing less than to establish unsw as australia’s global university. we aspire to this in the belief that a great university, which is a global leader in discovery, innovation, impact, education and thought leadership, can make an enormous difference to the lives of people in australia and around the world.

Title: manager - data & analytics
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

at vodafone, we put our customers at the heart of everything we do to give australians more choice and freedom to connect the way they want.

we are looking for an experienced data & analytics manager to join our business intelligence team to help and support us meet the growing demand for data driven insights at vodafone. reporting to the head of bi demand, analytics & reporting and managing a small team, data & analytics manager is responsible for managing the delivery of standard and advanced analytics projects, direct supervision of analysts and working closely with business stakeholders to create a future road map and deliver value through analytics.

based in our north sydney office, this role is responsible for the design, development and industrialisation of advanced analytics capability for the business that aims to provide actionable insights to inform decision making. the ensures that we are looking after the evolution of next generation analytical platforms and contributes to the formation of “vodafone - analytics centre of excellence”.

key accountabilities include:

  • ensuring data integrity is maintained across all data consumption layers where insights are driven from a single source of truth to deliver cutting edge analytical capabilities that align with short, medium and long-term business initiatives.
  • engaging with technology teams and influencing change and stability in design of the enterprise data eco system.
  • participate in design governance forums and be accountable for changes in the data presentation layer.
  • partner with gms & head ofs’ and present the strategy for data requirements and delivery.
  • lead cross-functional projects using advanced data modelling and analysis techniques to discover insights that will guide strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities.

knowledge & experience requirements:

  • 5 + years of experience in a position monitoring, managing, manipulating and drawing insights from data, and someone with at least 3 years of experience leading a team.
  • an individual with energy and drive to succeed and who understand the importance of stakeholder management and setting realistic expectations.
  • working knowledge of data mining principles: predictive analytics, mapping, collecting data from multiple data systems on premises and cloud-based data sources.
  • understanding of and experience using analytical concepts and statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analysing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations for business units.
  • experience and knowledge of statistical modelling techniques: glm multiple regression, logistic regression, log-linear regression, variable selection, etc.
  • strong python or r programming experience and related data science libraries (such as scikit-learn, pandas, tensorflow/keras)
  • strong programming skills with querying languages: sql, sas, python etc.
  • experience with big data tools: teradata, aster, hadoop, etc.
  • experience with data visualization tools: tableau, qlik
  • a degree or background in maths, engineering, computer science, finance, business or it
  • understanding of cloud frameworks like aws or gcp and tools like sage maker, tensorflow.
  • strong ability to plan and manage numerous processes, people and projects simultaneously.
  • excellent communication, collaboration and delegation skills.

with vodafone, you’ll have the power to make a difference to our customers and how they connect with vodafone, we are committed to attracting, developing and retaining the best people by offering a flexible, diverse and inclusive workplace where hard work is truly rewarded. you will have access to fantastic benefits as part of a global company, including generous leave policies, leadership development programs and opportunities to grow your career. you’ll be faced with loads of variety where no two days are ever the same in a collaborative work space that helps drive innovation.

the future is exciting. ready?

when you sign up and create a livehire profile, your personal information will be collected in accordance with vodafone\'s privacy collection statement and livehire\'s personal information collection statement.

about us

ssi is a community organisation and social business that supports newcomers and other australians to achieve their full potential. we work with all people who have experienced vulnerability, including refugees, people seeking asylum and culturally and linguistically diverse (cald) communities, to build capacity and enable them to overcome inequality. our vision is to achieve a society that values the diversity of its people and actively provides support to ensure meaningful social and economic participation and to assist individuals and families reach their potential.

what we offer

we have a fantastic benefits package that promotes work/life balance; something we are very passionate about! this includes a fortnightly accrued day off (ado) for full time staff, flexible working arrangements and generous salary packaging options so you can increase your take home pay!

we offer the opportunity to engage in meaningful work that makes a real difference to the lives of our clients, their families, carers, and communities.

ssi is passionate about social justice and diversity and is committed to being an eeo employer. we embrace diversity in our workforce and encourage applications from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, including those from aboriginal, torres strait island heritage and people with lived experience of disability.

Title: qc analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

our company

as part of the largest research company in the world,\xa0nielsen sports is the premier provider of analytics and insights within the sports industry, offering the most reliable source of independent and holistic market data in the sector and the most complete view of consumer trends and habits worldwide.

\xa0

combining solutions from sponsorship effectiveness to fan data capabilities with nielsen’s understanding of consumer behaviour and media consumption means it is uniquely positioned to help grow businesses through sport. nielsen sports equips decision-makers with smart data and advice, allowing them to better understand and connect with audiences and customers through media, sponsorship, communication and experiential platforms.

\xa0

nielsen sports’ brand exposure data and metrics are considered currency in the global sports marketplace. coupled with its sponsorship data and nielsen’s buyer intent and purchase data, it provides more than 1,700 clients with uniquely powerful and integrated solutions to help them make smarter business decisions.

\xa0

the role

this is an opportunity for someone with an analytical mind to apply their skills to provide solutions to clients in the sporting world. \xa0you will be working in a small team of data analysts and will be playing an integral role in providing insights and solutions for some of the biggest brands and rights holders in sport. backed by an employee-oriented organisation, a strong candidate can progress quickly and develop their skills across the broader nielsen business. nielsen provides on the job training and support in skill development.

\xa0

this is an entry level role. you will be proactive, with strong attention to detail and excellent communication skills. a passion for all sports will give you a head start in this role. nielsen will provide the necessary training to develop these skills on the job.

\xa0

key responsibilities will include:

  • cleaning, harmonising and updating data to conform to company methodologies
  • performing quality checks on all data, identifying potential issues and working with our offshore production team to rectify
  • identify, analyse, and interpret key performance measures and trends in multi-dimensional data sets
  • complete data management to strict deadlines for multiple projects
  • upload data to client-facing dashboards
  • maintaining the integrity of all data stored in the analysis database
  • identifying and implementing continuous improvement to our processes

\xa0

skills & experience:

  • bachelor’s degree and / or substantive relevant business experience (data analysis background would be useful but not essential)
  • broad knowledge of the australian sporting landscape is desirable
  • excellent excel skills
  • data compilation and analysis skills
  • high level of accuracy and attention to detail
  • effective time management and organisational skills
  • an understanding of how data and analytics can help companies achieve their goals
  • excellent written & verbal communication skills

Title: business analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

at arxxus technology partners, we value and engage the very best diverse talent - people with great expertise, innovative ideas and passion - who love working together to deliver amazing customer solutions and experiences.

that’s our ‘not-so- secret’ sauce, that allows us to deliver innovative cloud solutions – from strategy, through to implementation and continuous innovation services. that’s also what has made us a respected leading provider of salesforce professional services.

our mission is simple - to keep evolving our business and culture, to best connect and support- each customer and our teams to continue to innovate and learn, grow and excel together.

your analytical and technical expertise lets you fully understand the business requirements of our
managed services clients. this builds strong trusting relationships - both of which lay the foundation

  • providing advice on contract renewals of managed services clients, and consulting on best practice as required
  • keeping an eye out for how client processes can be more efficient and innovative, and working with customers to log cases and follow the processes
  • managing customer roadmaps and making sure that hours burn down is happening

experience / skills / requirements:

  • good interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate ideas clearly at all levels

Title: senior policy analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
  • great opportunity to work on high profile projects
  • join an organisation dedicated to furthering the public interest
  • collegiate and supportive team environment
  • attractive salary package

we are currently looking for a senior policy analyst to undertake research and contribute to planning for a range of initiatives related to banknote development and production. this includes aspects associated with security feature development, banknote design, policy development, banknote trials, public consultation and stakeholder management.

the reserve bank of australia’s note issue department is responsible for research into and development of new banknote designs and security features, and the supply of good quality banknotes to meet the community's demand. our banknote planning and partnerships team is responsible for progressing strategies and policies for banknote development, along with engagement with stakeholders.

as part of the team you will:

  • contribute to multi-year projects and new policy development designed to improve planning for banknote development and production
  • coordinate the development of a relationship management framework to support strategic relationships and partnerships
  • ensure effective engagement with various internal and external banknote stakeholders, including the cash-handling industry, law enforcement, special interest groups (such as the vision impaired community) and note printing australia
  • contribute to the maintenance and development of banknote communication channels to ensure their relevance and accuracy

the successful applicant will have:

  • relevant tertiary qualifications, e.g. business, project management, communications, economics, public policy\xa0
  • previous involvement in, and proven aptitude for, research, analytical and policy work
  • an ability to build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders
  • excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • the ability to articulate and communicate effectively both written and verbally

*this role requires a high level of security clearance. to be eligible to obtain a security clearance australian citizenship is required.

by joining the rba you will have the opportunity to:

  • work for an organisation that truly makes a \xa0difference to the australian people
  • develop your career in a collaborative environment
  • access to a wide-range of benefits

about the rba

the reserve bank of australia pursues national economic policy objectives and undertakes a range of associated activities in financial markets and banking. it also issues australia's banknotes and operates infrastructure critical to the payments system.

how to apply

your application should include a resume detailing your experience and qualifications.\xa0 a supporting statement addressing the selection criteria would also be welcomed.

the reserve bank of australia is an equal opportunity employer.\xa0 we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applications from experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility.

Title: change analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">
  • join transport for nsw and be part of significant government investment into nsw?s transport future
  • transport service grade 7 ($98,955 - $110,830), plus employer\'s contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading.
  • 2 year contract
  • a responsive organisation that encourages feedback and builds effective partnerships\xa0
about us
\xa0

at transport, our vision is for a truly integrated transport system that will meet the needs of our customers now and into the future. the transport portfolio includes transport for nsw as principal agency with sydney trains, nsw trains, state transit authority and roads and maritime services as our key operating agencies.


we are a values based organisation and\xa0 employ the most talented people to work together to deliver services for our customers and make nsw a better place to live, do business and visit.


the opportunity\xa0


the future workplaces program is supporting the move to activity based working across the transport cluster. future workplaces is a business transformation program addressing digital, physical and culture reform.


this is an exciting opportunity to work on a large scale transformation program with significant impact across an organisation, with over 4,000 staff being relocated to activity based working hubs at macquarie park, sydney and burwood.\xa0

\xa0

you will be given an opportunity to work on innovative, and hands-on, approach to change implementation, in a small but fast-paced and agile project team, and participate in requirements gathering workshops, engagement and support initiatives, business readiness activities, training and capability development sessions.\xa0


key accountabilities\xa0


as the change analyst your role will be to work with business units to understand current state in regards to digital, physical and cultural ways of working.

\xa0

you will undertake analysis to understand change impacts and collate the information to share with both project and functional partners of the project, and businesses and people impacted by the change

\xa0

you will work with the business to develop and implement action plans to ensure business readiness for the relocation and for activity based working

\xa0

for more information on this position, view the role description here


benefits


at transport our people have access to a range of benefits that help balance life at work and at home. these include flexible working arrangements, professional development opportunities, health and wellbeing programs, and a program that helps you stay connected with work before, during and after parental leave.\xa0


check out our\xa0employee benefits guide\xa0to find out more about the benefits available to you when you join transport.\xa0


our commitment to diversity\xa0


great people come from all walks of life and at transport for nsw we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community and the customers we serve.


please note that whilst the role is initially a 12 month contract there may be opportunities for the successful candidate to grow their career further and move into a permanent opportunity.


essential requirements

  • experience in working on change and transformation projects.\xa0 experience in projects related to activity based working, relocations, technology implementation and use, or culture change will be highly regarded.
  • ability to engage with stakeholders and people impacted by change
  • experience in business requirements gathering in order to develop current state analysis, developing action plans and implementing and monitoring change management activities
  • an innovative and hands-on approach to implementation of change strategies designed to increase change acceptance
  • the role is based in sydney but will be required to spend significant time at macquarie park, so the ability to work at both locations is essential\xa0
how to apply


to apply for this role,\xa0please submit a comprehensive resume as well as a brief covering letter\xa0(no longer than two pages) which addresses:


a) the reason for your interest in this role, and\xa0

b) how your skills and experience suit the role


for more information on how to apply for a role in transport for nsw please\xa0click here.


should you have enquiries about the role, please contact ciaran martin on 0466 616 258 and quote reference\xa00000708d.


if you encounter technical issues please contact i work for nsw support team on 1800 562 679 (mon-fri) or support@jobs.nsw.gov.au.


applications close: 11:59pm, monday 13 may 2019

\n\n

Title: senior quantitative analyst
Description:
div data-automation="mobiletemplate" class="_2e4pi2b">

they are a well renowned finance brand that respects talent, rewards hard work and believes in helping individuals grow and advance their career. they strive to build a company with individuals who work every single day to innovate and share know-how in ways that benefit people, society, and the planet.

in this role you will be an integral part of the model development team to mitigate the model risks under the model governance for the entire organization. the team is responsible for the basel iii program, discovering and diagnosing modeling related risks including input data, assumption, concept, methodology, process and implementation.\xa0


essential duties and responsibilities:

  • responsible for development, implementation and documentation of credit loss forecasting models\xa0
